loans.name: Chengo

texts.en:
Chengo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Chengo dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, soap and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animals for her business.

loans.name: Alycia

texts.es: Alycia de 59 año de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura, siembra maíz y maicillo, con esfuerzo a logrado mantener sus siembras las cuales las comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, el terreno está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus hijos viven en estados unidos pero le ayudan económicamente, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así continuar con sus siembras y tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alycia, 59 years old, has made a living from agriculture for many years. She grows corn and sorghum. Through her efforts she has managed to
continue planting, which she sells in the nearby areas. The land is located close to her home.

She lives in her own home with her husband. Her children live in the United States but they help her financially.

The client is requesting a loan for the purchase of seed, manure, fertilizer, pest controls, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph. In this way she can continue planting and, along with her husband, have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pest controls, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Sololá se caracteriza por ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticada. El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de Rodrigo albañil de 25 años de edad con una familia de dos  hijos, por los cuales el está decidido a realizar una lucha par trabajar todos los días.

La actividad que el realiza es la albañilería el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 7 años y se a convertido en una muy buena fuente de ingresos par el y su familia,  el es muy dedicado a su trabajo lo realiza de la forma más correcta y rápida para dejar las construcciones de su comunidad muy bien hechas.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de herramientas de albañilería para poder trabajar y realizar su trabajo con más rapidez y bien hecho, uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio y que ellos estudien para que sean profesionales en el mañana.
texts.en:
Sololá is characterized as being a well populated city with well built, modern houses constructed with very sophisticated materials.  Socio-economic development has been a principal factor in this development as well as labor by qualified builders and construction workers, such as Rodrigo. 

Rodrigo is a 25-year-old construction worker who has a family with two children. He is dedicated to working every day for his children. He has been a builder for 7 years and the work has become a very good source of income for him and his family. He is very dedicated to his job and he performs it quickly and correctly so as to insure that the buildings in his community are very well constructed.

He has requested a loan to purchase construction tools so that he can perform his work rapidly and well. One of his dreams, as time passes, is to become a master builder and to teach his children the same trade. He hopes that they will study so that they will become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es: Leocadio es originario de la comunidad los robles  tiene 64 años de edad , en sus tiempos nos comenta que era un poco complicado estudiar ya que no habían muchas escuelas así que el solo aprendió lo básico como es leer y escribir , después para poder ganarse la vida  aprendió a muy temprana edad los labores del campo en lo que es la agricultura , es la fecha y se dedica a esto ya que han sido su fuente de ingreso y con lo que le permitió sacar a delante a su esposa y dos hijos , ya sus hijos son hombres realizados tienen su propia familia. En la comunidad carecen de tener energía eléctrica   es por eso que quiere aplicar a crédito para comprar un pequeño sistema solar y instalarlo en su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Leocadio is originally from the Los Robles community and is 64 years old. He tells us that during his time, studying was a bit complicated since there were not many schools. Hence, he only learned the basics of reading and writing. Later on, in order to make a living, he learned agricultural work in the fields at a very young age. 

He engages in this since it has been his source of income and has allowed him to move his wife and two children ahead. Now that his children are grown men they have their own families. 

His community lacks electrical power which is why he wants to apply for a loan to buy a small solar power system and to install it on his humble home.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, 27, is a small-scale mixed farmer from Boito village in Kenya. He has been doing farming for the last five years to fend for himself. His primary income sources are milk, tea, vegetables, motorcycle transportation services and other personal business. Benard is very active with so many streams of income that one would find it hard to believe that he is just a bachelor with no kids.

Benard is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. Of all the farming activities that he has going, he finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable. The additional cow will significantly increase the volume of milk he sells per day. This investment will enable him to pay the loan installments on time and spend the remaining income elsewhere.
 
Benard is usually very cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The cow that he is going to buy will be insured to cushion him against unforeseeable reversal of fortunes. Income from this investment will be used to grow his business and uplift his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dolores de 34 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor de granos básicos desde pequeño, ambos han procreado 2 hijos, los dos estudian educación básica en la escuela local. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado porque su familia al ser de escasos recursos no pudo darle un mejor estudio.

Dolores es ama de casa, pero ayuda a su esposo a cultivar la tierra por lo que tiene cerca de 10 años de experiencia en agricultura, esto debido a que no contaban con suficiente dinero como para pagar mano de obra que apoyara a su esposo en trabajar la tierra.

El préstamo que solicitan será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de  maíz, ya está sembrado y es el momento en que necesitan hacer la aplicación para asegurar una buena cosecha.

Dolores se plantea la meta de que en base a esfuerzo y trabajo logren que sus hijos culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Dolores, 34 years old, is married and her partner has been a farmer of basic grains since his youth. They have procreated 2 children who both study at a local elementary school. She could only study up until 4th grade because her family, having limited resources, could not give her a better education. 

Dolores is a stay at home mom but she helps her husband to cultivate the land since she has nearly 10 years of experience as a farmer. Due to them not having sufficient money with which to pay for labor she supports her husband in working the land. 

The loan they are requesting will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers for cultivating corn. It has already been planted and now is the moment in which they need to apply it to ensure a strong harvest. 

Dolores is setting the goal that based on their work and effort they manage for their children to achieve a university education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado de educación básica porque su familia no tenía las condiciones para darle más estudio, tiene 30 años de casada su esposo se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, es madre de 2 hijos, ambos están estudiando y dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo.

María tiene 7 años de tener un negocio en el que vende tortillas, con el cual apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos, además gracias a ello han podido hacer reparaciones importantes en la casa.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 4 quintales de maíz que le venden a buen precio y otra parte será utilizada para la compra de fertilizante para el cultivo de maíz.

María piensa construir un cuarto más en su casa, además esperan que sus hijos terminen sus estudios hasta la universidad y así tengan la oportunidad que ellos no tuvieron.
texts.en:
Maria, 56 years old, could only study up until the 3rd grade of elementary school because her family did not have the means to educate her more. She has been married for 30 years and her husband makes a living cultivating basic grains. She is the mother of 2 children who both study and depend financially on her and her husband. 

Maria has had a business selling tortillas for 7 years with which she supports her husband with the costs of the household and of their children's education. Additionally, thanks to this they have been able to make important repairs to their home. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of 4 hundredweights of corn, sold at a good price, and another part will be used to purchase fertilizer for cultivating corn. Maria is thinking about building another room in their home. Additionally, they hope that their children finish studying up until university and in that way have the opportunity that they never had.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and 4 hundredweights of corn.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and the father of three children. He owns four motorcycles. He ventured into motorcycles because they were affordable and the market was assured since so many people that want to beat the traffic and to move quickly use them. John learned about the UGAFODE affordable interest rate and thought if he bought a new motorcycle, he would give it to a boy who would ride it and use the proceeds to pay the monthly installment. He will still own the motorcycle after the loan is complete. He is hardworking and innovative.

He is so grateful to the funders for the products that they offer.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Janet, a member of Chepkiripseet Kotes Group. She is a single mother blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and after undergoing trainings on enterprise management. She is able to manage her farming business.

She practices mixed farming which involves growing maize, beans and potatoes. She sells her produce in the local market. Her goal is to establish herself in farming by expanding her activities. It is for this reason Janet is borrowing a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest. This will enable her to keep up with the rising demand for her produce, making her level of income increase. She plans to use her profits to pay school fees and buy food for her children.

Janet is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase pesticide.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is named Hannah. She is a member of Solai Rabbit Farmers Self Help Group. She is fifty-five years old and the mother of three children. One of her children is in secondary school while the other two have completed schooling. Hannah is married and lives with her husband.

She practices rabbit rearing and poultry keeping, a business she has been running for over five years. This success has been boosted by the training on enterprise creation and financial management she has received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa .

Hannah is borrowing a loan to enable her to expand the rabbit rearing activities by buying more rabbits and also rabbit feed. She hopes her income will increase, leading to improved living standards for her family such as comfortable housing and quality education for her child.

Hannah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase rabbit feed and more rabbits.

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Stella, a member of Ngeleno Women Group. She is 23 years old, married and a mother of two children who lives with her husband. 
Stella is a poultry farmer. The training she acquired from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa has enabled her to run her business effectively. It has expanded and she now wants to buy more chicken and chicken feed. The loan will enable her to achieve her goal of further growing the business. 
Stella plans to use the profits to support her children's education. She is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to repay it promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabric and shoes for resale

loans.name: Bekiki Boda Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Sylvester; a member of Bekiki Boda Youth group. He is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children. Four children have completed school and the other two are still studying.

Sylvester earns his living by operating a motorcycle business (bodaboda) and farming potatoes. He is taking out a loan so that he can rent more land and buy planting seeds to enhance his potato farming. He looks forward to a good harvest. This will enable him to supply more to the market and hence earn more income, leading to better living standards and helping him to provide his two children with a quality education. 

Sylvester is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and rent additional farming land.

loans.name: Mavaega

texts.en: Mavaega is a 53-year-old woman who is married with three children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has had one year in this business. Mavaega needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, petrol, a new pulling string, a pair of overalls, safety glasses and new boots. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Mavaega joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, petrol, a new pulling string, a pair of overalls, safety glasses and new boots

loans.name: John

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is John, a member of Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group. He is 57 years old, married and blessed with seven children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 and after undergoing training on savings, enterprise and financial management, he has been able to mobilize savings, plan well on the finances and manage his enterprises effectively.

He borrowed his first loan from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa and it enabled him to start his poultry-keeping business. He is now borrowing the second loan to expand the business. He will be able to supply more eggs and chickens in the market. This will make his income increase, thus providing for his family's needs such as food, clothing and shelter. 
 
John highly appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Echek Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Eunice, a member of Echek Self Help Group. She is 48 years old and blessed with three children. She is married and lives with her family. Her economic activity is crop farming. She wants to diversify her farming activities by starting a poultry-keeping business as her new enterprise. This makes her borrow a loan to purchase indigenous chickens. She hopes the business will thrive and provide more income. She will be in a position to support her family and in the long run, improve their living standards so they have such things as comfortable housing.

Eunice is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Holien/bee Gichobo Project Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Jane. She is a member of Holienbee Gichobo Self Help Group. She is sixty-two years old, a single mother with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 and benefited from the training offered which she implemented by starting to rear goats.

She earns her living by rearing goats which she sells to the nearby slaughter house. The rising demand for her goats prompted Jane to apply for this loan to enable her to buy more goats. This will assist her to meet the demand and hence get more income. It is from these profits that Jane will educate her children as well as providing basic needs such as clothing.

She appreciates Kiva and their lenders for this opportunity and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Petala

texts.en: Petala is 47 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Petala needs a loan to buy new boots, chemicals, a new spade, a tiller, a pitch fork, a sprayer and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Petala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, chemicals, a new spade, a tiller, a pitch fork, a sprayer and crops

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Kennedy. He is 32 years old, married and living with his wife and three children.
 
He joined Nakuru East Mulembe Self Help Group in the year 2012 and has been an active member to date. He has gone through the training on enterprise creation provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. This has enabled him to operate his shoe making and repair business perfectly for two years. He is borrowing a loan to purchase shoe repairing materials such as shoe soles, shoe glue and shoe repair thread. He hopes this will enable him to meet the rising demand for his services and increase his income. This will help him support his family's needs.  

He is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase shoe repairing materials such as shoe soles, shoe glue and shoe repair thread.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Wilfred. He is 35 years old, married and living with his wife and three children. 

Wilfred runs a retail shop where he sells sugar, tea leaves, soap and bread. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he is now able to manage his business well. He is borrowing a loan to start a second-hand clothes selling enterprise. He hopes the business will flourish and increase his income. This will enable him to support his children's education and the other basic needs of his family such as food.

He is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete is a 37-year-old divorced woman with six children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Pelenatete needs a loan to buy pies, snacks, soft drinks, water bottles, sandwiches and donuts. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Pelenatete has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy pies, snacks, soft drinks, water bottles, sandwiches and donuts

loans.name: Sausoo

texts.en: Sausoo is 49 years old and divorced with two children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Sausoo needs a loan to buy cava bowls, elei printed material, Samoan woven caps, Samoan tapa, t-shirts and bangles. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy cava bowls, elei printed material, Samoan woven caps, Samoan tapa, t-shirts and bangles

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny, 45 years old, is a widow with three kids and a resident of New Tambo Katipunan Zamboanga Del Norte. She earns a living through motorcycle and car washing. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase sari-sari store items.

Leny deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for sari-sari store items

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is widowed with four children. She is 87 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Dulcisima is a farmer and grows coconut and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to build a corn and copra dryer.
 
Dulcisima has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Dulcisima hopes to save more for consumption.

loans.use: to build a corn and copra dryer

loans.name: Jesinta

texts.en:
The person in the photo is named Jesinta, a member of Solai Rabbit Farmers Self Help Group. She is sixty years old and blessed with nine children. All of her children have completed schooling. She is married and lives with her extended family.

Jesinta is a rabbit farmer. She joined the group to benefit from trainings on rabbit rearing. In addition to that she gained courses on enterprise management and financial development from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

She is borrowing to expand her rabbit rearing business by buying more kits so that she can keep up with the demand for rabbit meat in Nakuru. She hopes this will increase her income level. Jesinta plans to use her income to build a comfortable house.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly

loans.use: to purchase more rabbits.

loans.name: Ino

texts.en: Ino is a 35-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has had three years in this business. Ino needs a loan to buy new tires, a new windshield, window wipers, new seat covers, a new taxi sign indicator and also to renew her drivers license. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Ino joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new windshield, window wipers, new seat covers, a new taxi sign indicator and also to renew her drivers license.

loans.name: Keke

texts.en:
Keke is a 29-year-old married woman with three children
. 
She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Keke needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, new boots, a machete, a spade, a tiller and new gloves. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Keke will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, new boots, a machete, a spade, a tiller and new gloves

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge, está preparando su próxima siembra y requiere otro crédito para comprar semilla, abono e insecticidas para cultivar maíz y frijol, al realizar estos cultivos abastece a su familia de alimento y puede seguir manteniendo a sus clientes satisfechos.
Las condiciones económicas de Buenerge son mucho más favorables por la buena inversión del crédito anterior, la productividad de sus cultivos es mayor, sus ganancias han tenido una leve mejoría por lo que da a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y ha cancelado con puntualidad sus deudas.
texts.en:
Buenerge is preparing for his next harvest, and needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to grow corn and beans. He grows these crops both to feed his family, and to continue to satisfy his customers.

Buenerge's economic conditions are much more favorable because of his previous loan; the productivity of his crop is better, and his earnings have also had a slight improvement. This has given his family a better quality of life and has canceled out his debt.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to grow corn and beans.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en: Nelma is 65 years old, married with two kids, and a resident of Sinuyak, Katipunan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She earns a living through farming and ginger tea vending. She has enjoyed the privileges being a member of PMPC for four years. Now, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase housing materials. She deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for housing materials

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en: Florencio signed up his membership with PMPC and availed himself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small time loaner like him. Florencio was able to turn the tide in his favor and has made good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he availed himself of a loan to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, age 44, is from Dalacon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with five children. Alma is fond of "Amakan" weaving. Amakan is a light material commonly used as house walls for most Filipino native houses. Her fondness for Amakan weaving became a business and popular not only in their barangay but in the neighboring places in town as well. So, with this, Alma sees a good opportunity for a business to help her husband earn a living. In April 2014, Alma applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she didn't hesitate to become a member. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more bamboo for her Amakan business to produce more for her increasing number of customers. Through this, she hopes to increase her income to fulfill the needs of her family, especially her children's education. Alma dreams of nothing more than to have a decent and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo for her "Amakan" weaving business

loans.name: Keleka

texts.en: Keleka is a 32-year-old woman who is single with no children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. Keleka has requested a loan to buy rolls of material, a new sewing machine, needles, thread and a new pair of scissors. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of material, a new sewing machine, needles, thread and a new pair of scissors

loans.name: Tapunuu

texts.en:
Tapunuu is a 51-year-old divorced woman with three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Tapunuu needs a loan to buy sugar, cordial, large jugs, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, foam cups and a large cooler. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tapunuu has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordial, large jugs, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy, foam cups and a large cooler.

loans.name: Siauvaa

texts.en:
Siauvaa is a 23-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Siauvaa needs a loan to buy meat, bags of flour, yeast, onions, soya sauce, a new oven and plastic bags. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Siauvaa has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy meat, bags of flour, yeast, onions, soya sauce, a new oven and plastic bags.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 48-year-old woman who is single with four children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Makerita has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Ximena Alexandra

texts.es:
Ximena es una joven soltera de 18 años, trabaja como vendedora en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Quilmana.
Él éxito y buen desempeño en el trabajo es el resultado de todos los valores que sus padres inculcaron en ella. Es muy responsable, amable y tiene muchos deseos de superación.
Ximena está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una cocina para su casa, ya que la que tiene está un poco deteriorada y puede ser peligroso. De esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y así con mucho esfuerzo más adelante podrá estudiar una carrera profesional para orgullo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Ximena is a single 18 year old woman. She works in sales at a business in her hometown, Quilmana. Her success and good performance at work are the result of all the values that her parents instilled in her. She is very responsible, loving, and has a lot of desire to excel.

Ximena is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva, because with the support they provide she will be able to buy a stove for her home; the one she has currently is deteriorating and is dangerous. With this, she will be bettering her quality of life, and with hard work, she will eventually be able to study and pursue a career that makes her parents proud.

loans.use: to purchase a stove for her home.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona de 59 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su hija quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, ganchos para el cabello, aritos, cadenas, esmaltes para uñas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su hija logran salir adelante, Doña Petrona esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas mercadería para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Petrona is 59 years old. She lives in a family home with her daughter, who works and helps out with the household expenses. For the past 10 years, she has made a living selling candy, hair pins, earrings, chains, nail polish, etc. Her business is located in a busy area close to her home. 

With what she earns from her sales as well as what her daughter makes, they are able to get ahead. Petrona is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to be able to continue with her business and generate a good profit.

loans.use: to buy candy, hair pins, earrings, chains, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: And Liguey Marche2 Group

texts.fr: AND LIGUEY MARCHE 2 est un groupement de femme qui  est composé de 10 personnes. Elles évoluent toutes dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes  et la confection des pagnes et fréquentent le même lieu qui est le marché. Ainsi elles se réunissent toutes les jours pour faire des tontines journalières. La Présidente Madame FATOU est celle qui a levé la main sur la photo.  Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle sollicite ce montant  pour renforcer son fond de commerce et promouvoir son activité. Elle a une expérience de plus de 15 ans sur la confection  des pagnes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir, elle voudrait diversifier les produits et services pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent.
texts.en:
And Liguey Marche 2 is a group of ten women. They are all active at marketing fruits and vegetables and making pagnes (colorful West-African clothing), and are present in the same market. Thus they meet every day for their tontine (savings group) session.

The president Mrs. Fatou is the person raising her hand in the photo. She is married and the mother of five children. She is requesting this loan amount to build up her stock supply and promote her business activity.

She has over 15 years' experience in making pagnes (colorful West-African clothing). She helps her husband manage daily expenses and her children's tuition fees. She starts her day at 8 am to finish at 5 pm.

In the future she would like to diversify her products and services in order to increase her income and save money.

loans.use: buy fabric to make pagnes (colorful West-African clothing) for resale

loans.name: Cheikh Sadibou

texts.fr: CHEIKH SADIBOU est un jeune homme de 35ans qui évolue dans le transport. Il est célibataire sans enfants et n’a pas de parents bénéficiaires de crédits dans l’institution. Il gère les dépenses quotidiennes de ses parents et de ses frères et sœurs. CHEIKH demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter un moteur pour sa voiture qui est en panne. Il a une expérience de 5ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 21h. Il souhaite avoir une voiture en transport commun afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent et pour mieux gérer ses parents  c'est-à-dire améliorer leur condition de vie et fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Cheikh Sadibou is a young 35-year-old man who is in the transportation business. He is single with no children and has no relatives who have been granted loans from the institution. He manages the daily expenses of his parents, brothers and sisters.

Cheikh is requesting this loan amount to buy an engine for his car which has broken down. He has over five years' experience in the business and starts his day at 8 am to finish at 9 pm.

He wants to own a carpool vehicle so he can save money, improve his parents' living conditions, and raise a family.

loans.use: buy an engine for his broken down car

loans.name: Ibod

texts.ru: Ибод выходец из района Фархор, который расположился в долине реки Пяндж, на границе с Афганистаном. В состав Фархорского района входит 1 посёлок городского типа и 7 сельских общин. Ибод со своей семьей живет в сельской общине Гульшан. Он фермер и занимается выращиванием помидора, лука и других овощей. За счет продажи урожая, Ибод накопил немного сбережения и теперь в возрасте 51 года собирается параллельно начать новый бизнес животноводство. Ибод при дворе имеет коровник, а также уже запасся кормом для скотов. На сумму кредита он планирует купить двух голов молодых бычков и начать бизнес по их откорму и продаже. По его словам ему будут помогать жена и сын. Ибод верит, что его новый бизнес будет успешным и приносить ему стабильный доход независимо от сезона.
texts.en:
Ibod is from the Farkhor region, which is located in the valley of the Panj river, on the border of Afghanistan. The Farkhor region consists of one urban settlement and seven rural communities. Ibod and his family lives in the rural community of Gulshan. 

Ibod is a farmer and works with growing tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. Ibod has saved some money through selling his harvest, and currently, at the age of 51, he has decided to start a new business of livestock breeding in parallel. Ibod has a cowshed in his yard, and he has also stocked up livestock fodder already. 

For the loan, Ibod plans to purchase two young bull-calves and start a business of animal sales. According to him, his wife and son will help him. Ibod believes that this new business will be successful and bring him a stable income, which does not depend on the season.

loans.use: to purchase two young bull-calves to start a new business

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул немолодая жительница района Фархор. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем, ее муж работает врачом-ветеринаром. У них двое сыновей. Абдулхамиду 28 лет, а Абдулмачиду 25 лет. В настоящий момент один сын находится на заработках в России, он работает там на стройке. Курбонгул вместе со вторым сыном собирается начать животноводческий бизнес - откорм-продажу крупнорогатого скота. Муж тоже будет помогать им в новом бизнесе. У Курбонгул имеется опыт по выращиванию скотов. В свое время она помогала брату, живущему по соседству в его животноводческом бизнесе. Поэтому она уже хорошо изучила эту деятельность. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита Курбонгул закупит 5 голов бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Она надеется, что ей окажут финансовую поддержку. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
Qurbongul is an elderly resident of the Farkhor region. She is 50 years old. She is married. Her husband works as a veterinarian. They have two sons. Abdulhamid is 28 years old, and Abdulmachid is 25 years old. Currently one of the sons is a migrant worker in Russia. He works in construction there. 

Qurbongul and the other son have decided to start a livestock breeding business - fattening and selling cattle. The husband will also help them with the new business. Qurbongul has experience with breeding cattle. Earlier she helped her brother, who lives next door, with his livestock breeding business. Therefore she has already learned this business well. 

Qurbongul will purchase five bull-calves to fatten and resell for the loan amount. She hopes that you will give her financial support. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase five bull-calvs to breed and resell

loans.name: 25 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapas, tejido de mantas y venta de joyas, costura de zapatos, venta de cereales, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de productos naturales, venta de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura y venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace tres años, al observar a  otras personas que trabajaban con el mismo negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "25 DE OCTUBRE" will begin its seventh Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Cascada Social Center.  The group has nine members and Basilia is the secretary of its board of directors.  The members are involved in different businesses including hot dog sales, blanket weaving, jewelry sales, shoe manufacture, cereal sales, clothing sales, transportation service, natural product sales and chicken sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners including Basilia.  She has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years and joined by invitation through a friend who belongs to the institution.  Basilia has a sewing business and sells clothing.  She started her business three years ago on her own initiative upon observing other people who were working in the same business.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital and buy fabric wholesale from sellers in the city of El Alto.  Later she will sell her products at her sales stall.  Through her work she is able to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what it is about Pro Mujer that she likes, she says it is the loans, the health area and the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
58-летняя Латофат работает учительницей в средней школе своего района Файзабад. Она занимается преподавательской деятельностью на протяжении 37 лет. Конечно работа учителя кропотливая, но Латофат любит свою профессию и не может жить без школы и детей. 
У Латофат есть сын и дочь. Сын работает трудовым мигрантом за пределами страны, а дочь еще школьница. Латофат давно хотела провести ремонт в доме. Однако на ее маленькую зарплату этого сделать невозможно. Но Латофат хочет утеплить дом и подготовиться к зиме. Поэтому единственный выход она видит в получении кредита. Этот кредит ей действительно нужен и она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
58 year old Latofat works as a teacher at a high school in her region, Fayzabad. She has been teaching for a period of 37 years. Working as a teacher is of course laborious, but Latofat loves her work and cannot live without the school and the children. 

Latofat has a son and a daughter. Her son is a migrant worker outside the country, and the daughter is still in school. Latofat has wanted to refurbish her home for a long time. However, her small salary makes it impossible. Latofat would like to insulate her house to prepare for the winter. Therefore the only way out she can see is to take a loan. She really needs this loan and she hopes for support.

loans.use: to refurbish her home to improve living conditions

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер 23-летний молодой человек. Он уже женат и живет с женой, матерью и отцом в городе Истаравшан. Далер не имеет высшего образования. Последние два года он работает мойщиком на автомойке. У Далера есть сестра. Она студентка первого курса Худжандского Государственного Университета. Она поступила в этом году и занятия в ВУЗе уже начались. Однако ее семья должна оплатить за годовой контракт и за общежитие. Далер хочет помочь родителям, у которых трудности с финансами. Он берет кредит в размере 600 долларов США,. Около 400 долларов пойдут на оплату контракта, а остальная сумма на оплату общежития и на покупку одежды для сестры. Сестра Далера будет учиться на преподавателя начальных классов и он хочет, чтобы она успешно закончила ВУЗ.
texts.en:
Daler is a young man of the age of 23. He is already married and lives with his wife, mother and father in the city of Istaravshan. Daler does not have higher education. The two last years he has worked as a washer at a car wash. 

Daler has a sister. She is a first year student at the Khujand State University. She entered this year and has already started her university classes. However, her family needs to pay the yearly tuition and for her dorm room. Daler would like to help his parents, who have financial problems. He takes a loan of 600 US dollar. Around 400 dollar will go to paying tuition, and the rest to pay for the dorm and to purchase clothing for his sister. 

Daler's sister will study to be an elementary school teacher, and he hopes that she will graduate successfully.

loans.use: to pay for his sister's university education

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат. У него есть двое сыновей: 8 и 11 лет.  Ярослав имеет свой бизнес. 

Ярослав продает детскую одежду на рынке на протяжении 8 лет. Он арендует торговое место. В бизнесе Ярославу помогает жена.  Ярослав активный и трудолюбивый. В будущем он планирует развивать бизнес и строить дом.

Ярослав просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20 000 гривен на закупку школьной формы. Кредит поможет увеличить прибыль  и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Yaroslav is married. He has two sons who are 8 and 11 years old. Yaroslav has his own business. He has been selling children's clothing at the market for a period of 8 years. He rents a sales booth. His wife helps him with the business.

Yaroslav is active and hardworking. In the future, he plans to expand his business and build a house. Yaroslav requests a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase school uniforms. The loan will help him increase his income and improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms to sell for the autumn season

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU est une femme très brave qui habite à quelques kilomètres du guichet et y fréquente souvent. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des habillements pour femmes en vendant les tissus et sacs. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Etant à son 6ème prêt, elle demande ce montant pour acheter et vendre des tissus et sacs à main pour femmes. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle souhaite avoir une boutique au niveau du marché centrale pour mieux satisfaire ses clients  et épargner de l’argent. Ainsi elle pourra voyager en Chine et DUBAI pour diversifier ses produits et  augmenter ses revenus. De ce fait elle pourra aussi améliorer conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Fatou is a very courageous married mother who lives a few kilometres from the stall where she often works. She has developed a business selling women's clothing, fabrics and handbags. This will be her sixth loan. She is requesting this loan amount in order to purchase fabrics for women's clothing and handbags. She assists her husband in paying for their family's expenses and their children's school fees. Fatou starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at 8 PM. She wishes to find a new stall at the central market so that she can better satisfy her customers and save more money. She will then be able to travel to China and Dubai in order to diversify her stock and increase her profits. By doing this, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase handbags and ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: 44-летняя Замира живет в северном городе Конибодом вместе с мужем, сыном и невесткой. Муж и сын занимаются продажей напитков. У Замиры есть еще двое сыновей, один учится в городе Худжанд, а другой работает в России. Замира сейчас намерена начать свой торговый бизнес. Она имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Замира планирует заняться продажей детской одежды. Потому что она считает этот бизнес самым прибыльным, ведь дети растут не по дням, а по часам, и вещи им приходится обновлять регулярно. Поэтому на детскую одежду всегда будет спрос. Замира уже составила свой бизнес план, посчитала все свои затраты и пришла к выводу, что собственного начального капитала ей не хватает, чтобы привезти товар. Так, она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить ассортимент детской одежды и начать торговлю. Замира нуждается в финансовой поддержке и надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
44-year-old Zamira lives in the northern city of Konibodom together with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Her husband and son work with selling drinks. Zamira has two more sons, one studies in the city of Khujand and the other works in Russia. 

Zamira currently intends to start her own retail business. She has a sales point at the central market in town. Zamira plans to sell children's clothing, because she thinks this business is the most profitable, as children are growing fast and their wardrobe has to be changed regularly. Therefore there will be a demand for children's clothing. 

Zamira already made her business plan, considered all the costs and concluded that her own start-up capital is not enough in order to purchase goods. Therefore she applied for a loan in order to purchase an assortment of children's clothing and start the trade. Zamira needs this financial support and hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of children's clothing to start a retail business

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: ABDOU est un homme qui habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet. Il  n’avait pas l’habite de prendre des crédits mais vu qu’il veut terminer sa main en construction, il a sollicité ce montant. Marié et père de famille, ABDOU prie la totalité des charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il travaille dans l’administration et a une expérience de 21 ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 16h. A l’avenir, il souhaite construire une autre maison pour la mettre en location. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté,
texts.en: Abdou is a married father who lives a few kilometres from the partner's local branch. He does not usually take out loans, but seeing as he wants to finish building his own home, he put in a request. Abdou assumes responsibility for all his family's daily expenses as well as his children's school fees. For the past 21 years, he has worked for the local administration. He starts his day at 8 AM and finishes at 4 PM. In the future, he hopes to be able to build another house which he can then rent out. He would then be able to increase his income and save some money on the side.

loans.use: to purchase cement and iron so he can construct his own house

loans.name: Ugulbi

texts.ru:
Угулби предприниматель из города Куляб. В течение 8 лет своей жизни она занята в сфере торговли. Угулби занимается продажей детской одежды. Ее торговая точка расположена на рынке города. На ее товар всегда имеется спрос, так как Угулби привозит только качественную одежду и цены на ее товар приемлемые. 
Угулби замужем, ей 44 года. У нее есть две дочки, которым по 12 и 19 лет, и 14-летний сын. Старшая дочь и сын помогают ей в торговле.
Угулби сейчас хочет привезти сезонный товар, а также увеличить ассортимент одежд. С такой целью она берет кредит. Благодаря кредиту объём ее продаж увеличатся и ее бизнес будет еще успешнее.
texts.en:
Ugulbi is a teacher from the city of Kulob. She has worked in retail for a period of 8 years. Ugulbi works with selling children's clothing. Her sales point is situated in the city's market. There is always demand for her goods, as Ugulbi only brings in quality clothing and her prices are acceptable. 

Ugulbi is married. She is 44 years old. She has two daughters who are 12 and 19 years old, and a 14 years old son. The eldest daughter and the son help her with the business. Ugulbi would currently like to purchase seasonal gods, and also increase the assortment of clothing. With this aim she takes a loan. Thanks to the loan, her sales volume will increase and her business will be more successful.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of children's clothing

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Сафармо скромная трудолюбивая женщина, проживающая в селе города Куляб. Она сейчас вдова, ей 42 года. Сафармо от покойного мужа родила четверых детей. Ее сыновьям по 24 и 16 лет, дочерям по 20 и 12 лет. Младший дети еще учатся в школе. Старший сын работает на фабрике, производящей муку. Также параллельно он вместе со своей старшей сестрой помогает матери в ее деятельности. Сафармо на протяжении 7 лет занимается разведением крупнорогатых скотин. Она в основном выращивает коров молочной породы и ей нравится получать от них потомство. 
Сафармо сейчас в целях расширения деятельности берет кредит. Она на запрашиваемую сумму хочет приобрести еще двух голов дойной коровы и таким образом увеличить продажу молока, получаемых от коров. Кредит поможет Сафармо увеличить прибыль от бизнеса и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Safarmo is a modest and hardworking woman, living in a village near the city of Kulob. She is a widow. She is 42 years old. Safarmo had four children with her late husband. Her sons are 24 and 16 years old, her daughters are 20 and 12 years old. The youngest children are still go to school. The eldest son works at a factory, producing flour. In parallel, he and his eldest sister help their mother with her business. 

Safarmo has worked with cattle for a period of 7 years. She mainly breeds dairy cows and she likes to get offspring from them. Safarmo currently takes a loan with an aim to expand her business. She would like to purchase another two dairy cows for the requested loan amount, and this way increase the sale of milk from the cows. The loan will help Safarmo increase her income from the business and improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
Erika, es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece productos de la canasta básica, vive junto a su familia integrada por su esposo y dos hijos, de 3 y 6 años de edad, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero;  ella aprendió el negocio dentro de su familia, hace dos años fundó su propia tienda como una forma de generar ingresos para aportar en los gastos de su hogar, su horario de atención es de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m., por su experiencia no representa dificultades en este momento. 
Utilizará el capital para comprar lácteos, bebidas, detergentes, huevos, aceite, azúcar, etc., le será de ayuda para incrementar el inventario de su negocio y darle una mayor satisfacción a sus clientes, así mismo sus ventas y ganancias aumentaran, de esta  manera tendrá respaldado el pago de su deuda.
Los sueños de Vanessa son ampliar su negocio, dar a sus hijos estudios universitarios y comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Erika is the owner of a store where she sells basic household products.  She lives with her family, comprised of her husband and two children, ages three and six.  She has no economic support from overseas.  She learned about the business through her family and two years ago established her own store in order to generate an income to support the household expenses.  Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  For the time being and due to her experience, she is finding no difficulties.

Erika will use the loan to buy dairy products, beverages, detergents, eggs, oil, sugar, etc. to increase her store inventory and provide better customer service.  Her sales and profits will also increase as a result so she can pay off debt.  Vaness wants to expand her business, give her children a university education and buy her own home.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, beverages, detergents, eggs, oil, sugar, etc. to help increase her store inventory.

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, continua con su carpintería y la tienda funcionando y necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar plywood, madera, clavos, pegamento, cuerda de junco, barniz, y otros materiales importantes para seguir produciendo muebles, espera que su situación económica continúe mejorando para dar a su familia un futuro mejor.
Con la inversión anterior su negocio tiene mayor producción de muebles para vender, ofrece mejor calidad, tiene nuevos clientes tanto en la carpintería como en la tienda y las circunstancias familiares son más confortables.
texts.en:
José continues with his carpentry business and store activity and needs a new loan to buy plywood, nails, glue, reed rope, varnish and other important materials to continue making furniture.  He hopes his economic situation will improve so he can give his family a better future.

With his previous investment he was able to make more furniture to sell.  He has improved the quality of his products and made new customers in both the carpentry shop and the store, so his family circumstances are more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy plywood, nails, glue, reed rope, varnish and other important materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: MODOU est un homme marié et père de 4 enfants. Il  est maçon de profession et voudrait construire sa propre maison. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Etant à son  2ème prêt, il sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter du ciment et  du fer pour construire sa maison. Il est en location dans une autre maison et gère en même temps les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants.  Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir il voudrait lui aussi avoir une autre maison pour la donner en location, augmenter ses revenus et pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa famille et améliorer leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Modou is a married man and a father of four children. He is a mason by profession and has five years' experience. He would like to build his own house.

This is his second loan, and he plans to buy cement and iron to build his house. 

At the moment he is renting another house and managing simultaneously to take care of his family's everyday expenses and his children's school fees. He begins his day at 9 a.m. and finishes at 7 p.m. 

In the future, he would like to have a second house which he can rent out. He would also like to increase his earnings and be able to meet his family's needs and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of his house

loans.name: Saint Jean Baptiste Group

texts.fr:
Mme ODETTE est responsable du groupe SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE.  DELPHINE se porte très bien mais ne fait plus parti du groupe. Mariée, ODETTE est mère 06enfants. Le plus âgé 23ans et le moins âgé 08mois. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation (prépare et vend du dolo) depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de sorgho et 04 charrettes de bois de chauffe.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son champ d’activité et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Odette is the leader of the Saint Jean Baptiste group. The former featured borrower, Delphine, is no longer a part of the group, but she is doing well.

Married, Odette is a mother of six children. The eldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 8 months. Four her children go to school. She has five [additional] people under her care.

Odette has worked preparing and selling dolo [a kind of beer made from millet or sorghum] for nine years. She procures her ingredients from local markets. She wants to buy five sacs of sorghum and four carts of firewood. 

Odette wants to save her earnings. She plans to expand her business and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy five sacs of sorghum and four carts of firewood

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en:
Beathe is 48 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 14 and 25, and all of them go to school. 

She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more banana and shallots. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and shallots.

loans.name: Yovani Paul

texts.es:
Yovani es un joven trabajador de 27 años, trabaja como Obrero de campo en los diversos fundos de su ciudad natal, Santiago. Cada mañana se despierta motivado porque quiere brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia y mejor su calidad de vida, día a día es una lucha constante, trabaja por más de 10 horas, él cree que le va bien porque es muy entusiasta, responsable y soñador.
Yovani está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo brindado comprará un televisor para que su familia en feliz unión puedan disfrutar de sus tiempos libres y compartir las experiencias del día a día. Con esto él sentirá mayor tranquilidad y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Yovani is a hard-working young man of 27. He works in the fields of the various farms of his home-town, Santiago. He wakes up motivated every morning, because he wants to give his family the best and improve their quality of life. Every day is a constant struggle, he works for more than 10 hours. He thinks he does well because he is very enthusiastic, responsible and has dreams for the future.

Yovani is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he will buy a TV so that his family can enjoy their free time happily together and share the experiences of everyday life. With this he will feel more calm and continue to strive in order to start his own business in the future.

loans.use: to buy something for his house

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
En el interior una vivienda, los muebles y camas lucen muy limpias y brillantes, el piso reluce la imagen de los visitantes.  Todo esto gracias a la dedicación de una mujer llamada Isabel de 38 años soltera, quien es la encargada de servicios de limpieza desde hace dos años, ella tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años todos ellos son estudiantes de la comunidad donde ellos viven.

La actividad que Isabela realiza con tanto empeño es la de oficios domésticos en la comunidad donde ella vive, dicha actividad ella lo viene realizando desde hace más de 16 años porque por medio de esa actividad ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el sostenimiento de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno, ya que a ella desde hace tiempo ha querido comprar un terreno para poder dejar un recuerdo para sus hijos para que ellos mejoren las condiciones de vida en u futuro. Uno de las grandes aspiraciones de Isabela es construir casas para sus hijos y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en los diferentes campos laborales de la vida.
texts.en:
The inside of a residence, the furniture and the beds are all very clean and bright and the floor reflects the image of visitors.  All of this thanks to the dedication of a woman named Isabel who is 38 years old and single.  She has been in charge of cleaning services for two years.  She has three children, ages 14, 12 and 9 who are all students in the community where they live.

Isabel has been providing domestic cleaning service in her community for 16 years and earns a living this way to support her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy land to leave as a reminder to her children to improve their living conditions in the future.  One of her greatest goals is to build houses for her children and see them become professionals in different work areas.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIETOU est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 03 vont à l’école. 
Elle vend des pagnes  et aussi des produits de beauté depuis 07ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de son  secteur.
 Elle veut s’acheter 06 pièces de pagnes.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique de pagnes  et mieux entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Safietou is the representative of the Sigyongyaakadi group. She is doing well. She is married and a mother of four children. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest is one year old. Three of her children go to school.

Safietou has worked selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and other beauty products for seven years. She procures her goods from a market in her area. She wants to buy six lengths of pagnes. 

She wants to save her earnings. She has the ambition of opening a large pagne shop and of taking better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy six lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, comercializa toda una variedad de productos por esa razón posee mucha clientela, Isabel esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería como: sopa, detergentes, huevos, granos básicos, etc. y así tener  una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Isabel, 60, lives in her own house with her family.  She has a small store that she has been running for several years out of her home.  She sells all kinds of products and therefore has many customers.  Isabel is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy more merchandise such as soup, detergents, eggs, basic grains, etc. and thereby have more economic stability.

loans.use: To buy soup, detergents, eggs, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Remberto Alcides

texts.es: Remberto de 29 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su madre y sus hermanos, el posee una panadería desde hace 7 años, vende pan dulce y pan francés, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su madre en los gastos del hogar, sus hermanos le ayudan en la panadería, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora, Remberto esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, leche, miel, jaleas, etc. y así poder continuar con la elaboración del pan y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Remberto, 29, lives in his family home with his mother and siblings.  For seven years he has been running a bakery where he sells pastries and French bread.  He uses the profit from sales to help his mother with the household expenses.  His siblings help out in the bakery, as they are a very united, hard-working family.

Remberto is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk, honey, jellies, etc. to continue making bread and enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk, honey, jellies, etc.

loans.name: Agostinha

texts.en:
Agostinha lives in Baucau, she is married and she has no children. 

She is requesting a loan of $1.000 to improve her business. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, cooking oils, pop, detergents and other things to sell. 

Agostinha opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she will have a good chance of opening a big store in the future

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oils, pop, detergents and other things to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
-  
Agée de 33 ans  Afi est  mariée  et  mère d’ 4 enfants  résidant  à agoè. Elle a commencée son activité de  commerce en  vendant des chaussures. Elle s'approvisionne  2 fois  par mois au grand marché de Lomé  et  revend à son  Domicile  et  à la  devanture.  Afi  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
At 33 years old, Afi is married and a mother of four children. They live in Agoe. 

Afi started a business selling shoes. She procures her goods two times a month from the Lome Grand Market and then resells them from her home and from a shop window.

Afi is seeking a loan to expand her business in order to satisfy her customers and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of shoes

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
La dame, Fatou, âgée de la soixantaine d’année, est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 20 ans. Elle s’active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Son commerce qui consiste à vendre des produits divers. Elle en est à son troisième crédit à l’IMCEC, dont l’objectif est l’achat de tissus en coton appelé » meulfeu » venant de la Mauritanie, qu’elle va revendre au Sénégal.
Fatou fait l’ambulant : elle s’active la matinée jusqu’à 13h et l’après-midi jusqu’à 19h, elle est très brave et son âge ne l’empêche pas de gagner sa vie afin d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et d’appuyer son époux dans les charges de la maison.
Fatou rêve d’avoir sa propre maison un jour qu’elle construirait grâce à ses bénéfices et à ses économies.
texts.en:
Fatou, who is her sixties, is married and a mother of one child who is 20 years old. She has been working in commerce for more than ten years, where she sells various products. She is on her third loan with UIMCEC. Her goal is to buy cotton fabric called "Meulfeu" from Mauritania, and resell it in Senegal.

She sells her goods by traveling around and works from the morning until 1 p.m. and then from the afternoon until 7 p.m. 

Fatou is very brave and her age does not prevent her from earning a living so that she can improve her family's diet and help her husband with the household expenses.

Fatou dreams of having her own house one day that she will build thanks to her earnings and savings.

loans.use: to buy various products and fabric to resell

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es una hombre muy emprendedor de 33 años, trabaja como obrero de Campo en su ciudad natal, Santiago.
Su buen desempeño es el resultado de todos los valores que fueron inculcados en él por sus padres. Cada mañana Roger despierta con las ganas de seguir luchando porque su familia es lo más importante en su vida. Ser obrero es una tarea dura y pesada, pero él asume el desafío con mucho entusiasmo.
Roger está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales como cemento, arena para poder reforzar las paredes de su casa, ya que los temblores son frecuentes por su zona. Con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder brindarle un futuro mejor a sus padres.
texts.en:
Roger is a very enterprising man of 33 who works as a labourer in the fields of his home town, Santiago. His good performance is the result of all the values that his parents instilled in him. Every morning Roger awakes with the desire to continue striving to get ahead because his family are the most important thing in his life. Being a labourer is a difficult and demanding job but he takes on the challenge with a lot of enthusiasm.

Roger is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to buy materials such as cement and sand to reinforce the walls of his house, as tremors are frequent in his area. With this loan he will improve his quality of life and continue striving to offer his parents a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials to reinforce the walls of his house

loans.name: Luis Elvis

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor de 22 años, soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia. Por circunstancias de la vida no pudo estudiar una profesión, y para poder apoyar a su familia trabaja como Obrero de Campo. Él asume este reto con mucho entusiasmo y cree que le va bien por su alto sentido del compromiso, responsabilidad y porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar enseres para su casa, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y así seguirá esforzándose día a día para poder sacar adelante a su familia y en unos meses comprarse un carro para iniciar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Luis is a young entrepreneur. He is 22 years old, single and lives in Parcona together with his family. For different reasons, he could not study to become a professional, and had to start working in agriculture in order to be able to help his family. He faces this challenge with enthusiasm and believes that he is good at what he does because he is a committed and responsible person who always works hard.

Luis appreciates the support that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to buy home goods and improve his living conditions. He will continue to work hard every day to get ahead with his family and be able to buy a car soon and start his own business.

loans.use: to buy home goods.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling handicrafts at the flea market. To do this, she needs a loan to buy coconut shells, elei printed materials, fabric paints, earrings, bangles, bracelets and t-shirts. In the future, Marina hopes to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells, elei printed materials, fabric paints, earrings, bangles, bracelets and t-shirts.

loans.name: Elena Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 17, 14, 5 y 1 año, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Elena es una muy buena esposa que le gusta trabajar para  ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa interior por su localidad, pero el crédito lo comparte con su marido el cual también se dedica al comercio, el  vende ropa interior, camisetillas, carcasas de teléfonos, gorras y varios productos más, él se desplaza a otras ciudades a vender su mercadería. Trabajan todos los días, el  casi todo el día mientras que ella solo en las mañanas. Llevan 16 años con este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa, gorras, camisetas y todo de lo que ellos venden.  Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Su sueño es comprar un carro y tener un local.
texts.en:
The 30 August communal bank meets every fortnight in Picoaza parish of Portoviejo city, a place known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the happiness of its people.

Elena lives here. She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship and has 4 children with her partner. The children are 17, 14, 5 and 1 year old. The two oldest study in high-school and the next in junior school. Her husband is a market trader.

Elena is a very good wife who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She works in commerce, she sells underwear locally, but the credit will be shared with her husband who also is engaged in commerce. He sells underwear, t-shirts, phone cases, hats and several more products. He travels to other cities to sell his wares. They work every day: he works almost all day while she only works in the mornings. They have had their business for more than 16 years, and it allows them to get by. 

This credit will be used to buy clothes, hats, shirts, and everything they sell.  She has been with the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it because of the help which they give her with the loans. Her dream is to buy a car and have a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes, hats, t-shirts etc

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia is a 35-year-old unmarried woman with 6 children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Lusia needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, large pots, cooking oil, baking soda and eggs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Lusia has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, large pots, cooking oil, baking soda and eggs.

loans.name: Enina

texts.en: Enina is 26 years old and unmarried with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Enina needs a loan to buy kava plants, fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a large tiller, a crowbar and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Enina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy kava plants, fertilizer, a spade, chemicals, a large tiller, a crowbar and new overalls.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, a farmer's wife, has been helping her husband for over ten years on their own farm to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm improvement. This is their main source of income and expanding their farm means better income for the family. With her generated income from farming, she was able to start a retail store in their home. It earns additional income for the family. Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. They are determined to be successful in farming as well as in business, so that they can provide a better standard of living for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
For many years, Gerald has run a transportation service, while at the same time preparing and selling snacks in the market to make a living. With his income, he successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying ingredients. With his savings, he was able to start a swine fattening business in his backyard which earns more revenue. Recently, he requested a new loan to buy feeding supplies for his swine business.
He hopes to earn an increased income to help him improve the general living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for his swine business.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie, a 34-year-old mother of two operates a general store selling grocery goods to make a living. She has just started the business this year and wants to become successful with this business. To add inventory, she requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as increase the general living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and she works hard to support her family.
She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Lorna is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.
Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 42 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.
