Diana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.
Diana has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.
Diana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 44-year-old mother of three owns and operates a retail store in her local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns enough to sustain her family’s living expenses. Improving the business has become easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase more grocery goods and assorted drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is a single entrepreneur who runs a general store in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this since she had to stop her studies. She has managed the business properly and has successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy stock for her store. She has requested a new loan to purchase additional grains and feeding supplies.
In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grains and feeding supplies.

loans.name: Sophors

texts.en:
Sophors, is a 34-year-old vegetable farmer, while her husband drives a Tuk Tuk taxi and assists his wife in farming when he is free. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.
Sophors and her husband have one son and one daughter. One of her children attends school and the other is still too young. She is asking for a loan to help her in buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to assist in her farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is widow and she works hard to support her family.
She farms rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilia is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.
Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Her name is Maribel. She is thankful that she was granted a PHP 30,000 loan which she used to buy different jewelry needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.
She would like to apply for another PHP 25,000 which she will use to buy additional jewelry to sell. The more jewelry items she has on hand means more sales and thus increased earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She is glad and thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.
Maribel aims to grow her jewelry business and desires to have a place of her own to display her jewelries. She only wants a simple and decent life and for all her children to finish school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for jewelry that she will use in her business.

loans.name: Glady Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Glady, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 23, 18, 13 y 6 años, dos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. 
Doña Glady es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido, él se dedica  al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, ollas y varios productos más, su marido se desplaza a varias ciudades del Oriente Ecuatoriano lugares donde se queda por dos a tres semanas y una vez que acaba de vender lo que ha llevado regresa a su hogar para descansar una semana y volver a viajar, ella en ocasiones le acompaña en sus viajes. Lleva más de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad con el cual lleva el pan a su mesa.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar sabanas, edredones, ollas y varios productos más que venden.  Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Su sueño es tener un local para que su marido no viaje más.
texts.en:
The credit group "30 de Agosto" meets every fifteen days in the parish of Picoaza, in the city of Portoviejo. It is known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional St. Peter's and St. Paul's festivals, and for the cheerfulness of its people. 

Señora Glady lives here. She is 44 years old, and she is married with four children, ages 23, 18, 13, and 6. Two of them are studying in high school, and the younger one is in grade school. Her husband is a salesman.  

Doña Glady is a very good wife, and she is requesting the loan in order to help her husband, who is a salesman. He sells clothing of all kinds, sheets, comforters, pots and pans, and various other products. He travels to various cities in eastern Ecuador, spending two or three weeks at a time. Once he finishes selling his merchandise, he returns home to rest for a week, and then goes out again. Occasionally, she accompanies him on his trips.  He has been doing this work for 20 years, which has enabled him to put food on the table.

She will use the loan to purchase sheets, comforters, pots and pans, and various other products that they sell. She has been in the credit group for three cycles, and she likes it because she can help her husband. 

Her dream is to have a store so that her husband won't have to travel anymore.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, comforters, pots and pans, etc.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan, a farmer, is married with three children and he buys and sells fruits in their community to make a living. His earning from farming cannot meet their daily needs, for he only harvests his farm produce every three or four months. To settle this, he buys fruits in addition to his harvest to sell in town. He earns a good income from this that has sustained their living. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for his business. Improving the business becomes easier with his access to GDMPC. He took a new loan recently to buy more varieties of fruits to sell. Allan will find ways to gain profits aside from farming to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fruits to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 69, is a widow with six children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aida has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from a  rice retailing business.

Aida aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Betsy Adelaida

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Betsy, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es policía. 
Doña Betsy es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y ropa por catalogo, bisutería y otros productos de revistas, ella sale dos a tres días por semana en sus ratos que esta mas desocupada, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, tiene bastante clientela ya que son más de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su bien y el de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, bisutería y todo de lo que ella vende. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The 30 de Agosto Communal Bank meets in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for its happy people.

Betsy, 24, lives in this place.  She's married and they have two children, ages 7 and 3.  The older one attends school.  Her husband's a police officer.

Betsy's a very good mother and wife who helps her husband with the household expenses by selling all types of shoes, clothing, costume jewelry, and other catalogue products.  She goes out two or three days a week during her least busy times, leaving merchandise on credit and collecting every week or two, depending on the customer.  She has a lot of customers because she has done this work for more than three years.  She earns something to benefit herself and her family.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, and everything she sells.

She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the loans are fast and have very low interest rates.  Her dream is to give her little ones the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, costume jewelry, and so on

loans.name: Keny Osmin

texts.es:
De 24 años de dada pero ya con grandes aspiraciones en el futuro, soltero que cuenta con 2 hijos que son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

Keny se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la docencia.  Es maestro en Sololá desde hace más de cinco años, pero lo ha sentido desde pequeño.  Sus alumnos lo esperan siempre cada mañana para que Keny le imparta el saber de la vida. La segunda actividad que el realiza es la siembra de maíz y frijol para tener un ingresos extra par el sostenimiento de su familia. 

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito gestionado por Keny es para la compra de fertilizantes químico y orgánico para su cultivo de maíz ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus siembras sean de la mejor calidad durante este año.
Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de el es seguir sembrando maíz  y frijol en los terreno libres con que el cuenta y dar estudio a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida y construir casas para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Keny is 24 years old but already has great future aspirations. He is single but has two children who are excellent students in the school in his town. 

Keny works in one of the most important professions that exists in society today, which is education.  He is a teacher in Sololá and has been working in this field for more than 5 years, but he has felt the calling since he was young.  His students look for him each morning so that Kenny can teach them about life.  The other activity that Keny participates in is the growing of corn and beans in order to have extra income for his family. 

Keny will use his loan to purchase chemical and organic fertilizers to use on his corn crop, since for him it is very important that his crop is of better quality this year. 

One of his greatest aspirations is to continue growing corn and beans on free land that he has and also to be able to educate his children so that they can become professionals.  He would also like to build a house for his sons.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Dolores Ofelia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 26, 23, 18 y 11 años, todos aun viven en su casa y dos estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña Dolores al ver que su esposo no gana mucho en su trabajo se dedica a la cría de pollos en una pequeña granja, ella compra los pollos en Portoviejo cuando están pequeñitos los tiene por dos o tres meses y luego los vende enteros o por libras a personas de la localidad y muchas veces entrega también en las tiendas. Ella le da parte del crédito a su marido que se dedica a la agricultura, pero es ella la que más lo utiliza en sus actividades ya que es como se mantienen cuando su marido no tiene trabajo. 
Este crédito es para comprar más pollos y alimento para los mismos. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The credit group “30 de Agosto” meets every fifteen days in the parish of Picoaza, in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for being a very commercial zone, for its St. Peter’s and St. Paul’s festivals, and for the cheerfulness of its people. 

Señora Dolores lives here. She is 47 years old, and she is married with 4 children, ages 26, 23, 18, and 11.  All are still living at home, and two are studying in the University and in high school. 

Her husband is a farmer.  As she sees that her husband’s work doesn’t bring in a lot, Doña Dolores raises chickens on a little farm. She buys the chickens in Portoviejo when they are very small, she has them for two or three months, and then she sells them whole or by the pound, to people in the area.  Many times she delivers them to stores also.

She will give part of the loan to her husband who is a farmer, but she will use most of it for her activities, as this is how they support themselves when her husband does not have work. This loan is for the purchase of more chickens and feed for them. 

She has been in the credit group for two years, and she likes it because the loans help her. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Leydi Gabriela

texts.es:
Leydi es una joven de 25 años, soltera y trabaja como secretaria en su ciudad natal, Tate.
El buen desempeño en su trabaja es el resultado de todos los valores inculcados en ella por sus padres. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a muchas noches de estudio pudo estudiar la carrera de Secretariado y hoy ejerce su profesión con mucho entusiasmo.
Leydi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar algunos enseres para amoblar su casa, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder sacar adelante a su familia y crecer profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Leydi is a 25 year old young woman. She is single and works as a secretary in her city of birth, Tate. Her good performance at work is the result of all of the values instilled in her by her parents. Thanks to her parents' support and many nights of study, she was able to study the profession of being a secretary and today she practices her profession enthusiastically. 

Leydi is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered she will be able to buy some furnishings for her home. This way, she will be able to improve her quality of life. She will keep fighting to be able to get her family ahead and grow professionally.

loans.use: to buy furnishings for her house.

loans.name: Nevil

texts.es:
Nevil es un padre de familia de 29 años, vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Tiene una esposa que lo apoya de manera incondicional, junto a ella ha formado una hermosa familia con una niña de 3 años a quienes ama enormemente y por quienes lucha día a día para sacar adelante. Desde hace algunos años trabaja como Supervisor de personal en una empresa y cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza y es muy responsable.
Nevil está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado va a comprar una congeladora porque su esposa ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de chupetes y hielo, así sus ingresos mejorarán y seguirá luchando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nevil is a 29 year old husband and father. He lives in San Martin with his family. He has a wife whom he supports unconditionally. With her, he has started a beautiful family with a 3 year old girl. He loves them very much and fights day to day to get ahead for them. For several years, he has worked as a staff supervisor at a business and he thinks it is going well for him because he works hard and is very responsible. 

Nevil is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered he is going to buy a freezer. His wife has started a little business selling popsicles and ice. This way, their income will improve. He will keep fighting to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for his ice cream selling business.

loans.name: Jose Keving

texts.es:
Jose es un emprendedor joven de 21 años, soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Gracias al incondicional apoyo de sus padres estudió la carrera de Administración de empresas y con mucho esfuerzo pudo abrir un negocio de venta de muebles, José cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable, innovador y siempre busca salir adelante.
Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para incrementar su negocio y ofrecer más variedad de productos. De esta manera sus ganancias mejorarán y el podrá elevar el nivel de vida de su familia. Una de sus metas más adelante es poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
José is an enterprising young man, age twenty-one. He is single, and he lives in Parcona with his family. 

Thanks to the unconditional support of his parents, he studied Business Administration, and by working hard, he was able to open a furniture business.  José believes that it is going well for him because he is very responsible and innovative, and is always looking to move forward.

José is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, because the support that they have given him will enable him to purchase merchandise in order to increase his business and offer a greater variety of products. In this way, his earnings will improve and he will be able to raise his family’s standard of living. 

One of his future goals is to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his furniture business.

loans.name: Donald Oswaldo

texts.es:
Hojas de colores, lápices de colores, marcadores, reglas y un sin número de bocetos observaban los padres de Oswaldo en su cuarto cuando era un adolescente. Siempre le veían entusiasmado creando nuevos diseños de objetos diferentes, desde entonces se dieron cuenta que su hijo había descubierto su pasión, el diseño. Es un joven carismático, creativo e inteligente. Tiene 25 años, estas soltero y cursa cuarto año de la carrera que más le apasiona Arquitectura en Diseño Gráfico. Aparte de estudiar, con ánimos de colaborar en la economía familiar trabaja en una tienda. Agradece el apoyo incondicional que le han ofrecido sus padres ´para cumplir sus ideales. 
Oswaldo tiene como objetivo principal graduarse con honores y ser un arquitecto profesional y exitoso, razón por la que solicita un crédito, requiere pagar la mensualidad de la universidad y los trámites de su título. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que desea obtener su titulo como arquitecto, ya que sin este las oportunidades de trabajo serán escasas. Anhela trabajar y ser un pilar importante en la economía de su familia.  Entres sus metas próximas está seguir estudiando y especializarse, de manera que pueda ser un diseñador reconocido por su excelente trabajo.
texts.en:
Colored, leaves, colored pencils, markers, rulers and innumerable sketches are what Oswaldo's parents observed in his room when he was a teenager. They saw he was always enthusiastically creating new designs of different objects. That was when they realized their son had discovered his passion, design. He is a charismatic young man who is creative and intelligent. He is 25 years old, single and in the fourth year of the major that he is passionate about, Architecture in Graphic Design. Apart from studying, in order to help out with the family budget he works in a store. He is grateful for the unconditional support his parents have given him to achieve his goals.

Oswaldo's main goal is to graduate with honors and to become a professional and successful architect. That is why he is asking for a loan. He needs to pay for college tuition and to process his degree. He is putting his trust in the loan because he wants to get his degree in architecture, because without it employment opportunities will be scarce. He longs to work and be an important pillar in his family. Among his next goals are continuing with his education and becoming a specialist so that he can be a well known designer because of his excellent work.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition and to process his architecture degree.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo, 54 years old and a father of four, owns and operates an agriculture business, growing rice and vegetables to sell.

Eduardo has been engaged in his business for many years and he earns well from these activities.  His farm is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. 

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy organic fertilizer. His children had their own family, and he was happy to say that they have a better way of living with his unselfish support. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Bennyfer

texts.en:
To make a living, Bennyfer operates a general store in their village in order to provide for his family. He earns better income from his business that sustains their living. 

With his revenue, his previous loan used for the business was repaid successfully. He took a new loan recently to buy grains in addition to his grocery goods.

Improving and expanding the business is his passion, for he wants to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy grains in addition to his grocery goods

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer trabajadora de 53 años, con una familia maravillosa que la apoya de manera incondicional, vive en San Martin junto a ellos. Desde muy joven ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia y ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la venta de licores típicos de la región, ella cree que le va bien en el negocio por su esfuerzo constante y su amabilidad con los clientes.
Gladis está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer mejoras en su hogar como comprar cementos y otros materiales para reforzar las paredes. Con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando día a día por su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is a hard-working 53-year-old woman with a wonderful family who help her unconditionally. She lives with her family in San Martin. Since she was very young, she strove to get her family ahead and to offer them a better future. For more than 5 years, she has made a living seling typical regional liquors. She thinks that her business is going well because of her constant efforts and because she is friendly with the customers.

Gladis thanks the Kiva lenders, because with their help she will be able to make improvements to her home, like buying cement and other materials to reinforce the walls. By this, she will improve the quality of her live and continue to work hard every day for her family.

loans.use: to reinforce the walls of her house.

loans.name: Jandry Fernando

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive el señor Jandry, tiene 21 años de edad, está  soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El estudia en una universidad de la localidad. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos puede aumentar su negocio y lograr seguir con sus estudios.
El es un joven muy luchador que le gusta trabajar para tener sus propios ingresos y asi forjarse un mejor porvenir,  el tiene un negocio de cibert en su casa, allí ofrece servicios de internet y trabajos en computadoras, también en su local vende helados, sodas, jugos, golosinas, tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas de todas las operadoras, el también saca copias y vende ciertos útiles escolares y materiales de computadores entre otras cosas, es así como se gana algo que le sirve para sus estudios y su futuro.
Este crédito es para pagar el servicio de internet y comprar útiles escolares. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The 30 de Agosto Communal Bank meets in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for its happy people.

Jandry, 21, lives in this place.  He's single and lives in his parents' house.  He attends a university in the town.  He has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles and he likes it because thanks to the loan he's able to expand his business and continue with his studies.

He's a very persevering young man who likes to work to have his own income so he can make a better future for himself.  He has an Internet business in his home where he offers Internet and computer services and sells some school supplies, computer supplies, and other items.  That's how he earns something to pay for school and his future. 

This loan is to pay for Internet service and buy school supplies.

His dream is to finish school.

loans.use: to pay for Internet service and to buy school supplies

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Gina aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is 46 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Johna is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Johna has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
A few months ago, Frank was with his wife discussing their future plans when they arrived at a decision point: Should they continue their arrangement of working for other people or use Frank’s business acumen combined with his wife’s experience in the florist industry to open their own business? It was then that they decided that with a combined 15+ years in the florist industry, taking a risk to start their business was worth a shot.

With four children to raise and just the two of them covering all aspects of the business’ operations, you have a situation that would never be without its challenges and setbacks. Add to that the fact that Frank is continuing to work his full-time job at a computer memory manufacturer and initial difficulties with trying to find start-up capital, and this husband and wife team had to work hard to make their dreams a reality.

Frank sought out a Kiva loan to pay operating costs, including rent, and to maintain cash flow.

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Frank and his family hope to be able to build a sustainable business that will put them on the path to economic self-determination.

loans.use: to pay operating costs, including rent, and to maintain cash flow.

loans.name: Futiolo

texts.en:
Futiolo is 30 years old and unmarried with one child. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Futiolo needs a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, a spade, new boots, crops and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Futiolo will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, a spade, new boots, crops and gloves.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 50 years old, lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has passed away. Her daughter works as a cashier at a supermarket. Her elder son is a salesman at a boots factory. Her younger son studies at university. 

She has been selling fruits at an outdoor market since 2006. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy fruits in large amount in order to increase her working capital. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy fruits in large amount.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rocela has been selling their farm products, like copra, in town, to augment her husband's income from driving. Her children were going to study in their elementary grades and she had to earn money for their needs. 

With her generated income from her business, she was able to start a retail business selling grocery goods in their village. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for farm fertilization. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase grocery goods to sell. Rocela hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 39 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luz has a flower shop business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz has been in this business for 15 years.

Ma. Luz requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more flowers to sell. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 63 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dorothy has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Dorothy requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Dorothy has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Dorothy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for five years. 

Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 46-year-old widow with 9 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years.

Akenese needs a loan to buy a large display fridge, snacks, drinks, frozen goods, deodorants, shoes, and new canned items. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large display fridge, snacks, drinks, frozen goods, deodorants, shoes, and new canned items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university tuition, for her studies in information technology.

loans.name: Susuga

texts.en:
Susuga is a 54-year-old widow with four children. 

She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Susuga needs a loan to buy drinks, snacks, a cash register machine, plastic bags, donuts, sandwiches and rubber gloves. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Susuga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, a cash register machine, plastic bags, donuts, sandwiches and rubber gloves.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating a variety of crops and harvesting their fruit for sale to earn a living. 

She has to support her children's educational needs and was able to start a new business raising pigs for sale. 

She has to maintain a greener farm for it is their main source of income. To restore farm nutrients, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is 30 years old and married. She has three children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Mele needs a loan to buy sprayers, fertilizer, chemicals, new overalls, a pitch fork, new boots and crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Mele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, fertilizer, chemicals, new overalls, a pitch fork, new boots and crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is a 34-year-old unmarried woman with no children. 

She has a small plantation to earn a living from, and apart from that she also runs a small canteen in the local school. 

Isabella needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and boots for her plantation; and a new chest freezer for her canteen. 

She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Isabella joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and boots for her plantation; and a new chest freezer for her canteen

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking man, who wants to become successful in the future. He plans to work abroad after finishing his studies. He studied in the university, to gain a better education that will lead him into a better future.

He had a previous loan from GDMPC, which he used for school materials and books. Recently, he took a new loan to pay his tuition fees for the first semester. He is hoping for a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of tuition.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
This is Virgie. She is 46 years old and currently resides with her husband, Nestor, in Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for 24 years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner are working hard and they are determined to have a better income and to provide their children with a better future.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Virgie would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Virgie hopes to grow and expand her sari-sari store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita. She is 58 years old and currently resides with her husband, Ricardo, in Coron Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety store) for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her spouse are working hard, for they are determined to provide their family a better future.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

To improve sales, Rosita would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With the amount of 21,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and a greater variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her store. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Rosita hopes to prosper through all her hard work in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.


*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for larger quantities and a greater variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Crislyn works very hard to provide for them.

Crislyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Crislyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods, and canned goods. 

In the future Crislyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessica María

texts.es:
En los pasillos de la universidad siempre se ve a Jessica con una sonrisa en la cara y es porque está cumpliendo uno de sus más grandes sueños, estudiar la carrera de Medicina. Desde siempre le ha interesado la salud y el bienestar de los demás, razón por la que hoy está estudiando y adquiriendo los conocimientos necesarios para ser buena en ello. Es una joven amable e inteligente, tiene 21 años, está soltera y cursa quinto año de la carrera. En la lucha por alcanzar sus sueños la acompañan sus padres, quienes desean que su hija se desarrolle profesionalmente y sea una persona de éxito. 
Jessica solicita el crédito para pagar los gastos de su tesis y los preparativos de la graduación. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que no desea retrasarse en las clases y así lograr obtener su titulo como doctora sin ningún problema. Entre sus metas próximas está culminar su carrera con honores y conseguir trabajo en un hospital para poner en práctica todos los conocimientos adquiridos, de manera que pueda ayudar a las personas y al desarrollo del país. Planea seguir estudiando para obtener una especialidad en dermatología, área que le llama mucho su atención.
texts.en:
In the university’s hallways one always sees Jessica with a smile on her face, and it is because she is completing one of her greatest dreams, to study medicine. Health and the well-being of everyone has always interested her, the reason for which she is now studying and acquiring the necessary knowledge to be good at it. She is a kind and intelligent young woman. She is 21 years old. She is single and studying in her fifth year of the major. Accompanying her in the struggle to reach her dreams are her parents, who wish their daughter to develop professionally and be a successful person.

Jessica is requesting this loan to pay the expenses for her thesis and preparations for graduation. She is putting her confidence in the financing, given that she does not want to get behind in her classes and thus be able to obtain her title of doctor without any problems. Among her next goals are to finish her studies with honors and get a job in a hospital to put into practice all of the acquired knowledge, so that she can help people and the development of the country. She plans to continue studying to obtain a specialty in dermatology, an area that catches her attention a lot.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for her thesis and preparations for graduation.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Su amor por el campo y el cuido de los cultivos llevo a Ivania a estudiar Agroecología, carrera en la que se graduó con honores. Tiene 29 años de edad, está soltera y tiene un hijo de tres años. Es una mujer dinámica, inteligente y emprendedora. Se estableció como meta tener dos trabajos para mejorar la economía familiar, aparte de trabajar como docente en una universidad, trabaja como auxiliar en una empresa. En ambos trabajos se desarrolla con éxito. Agradece el apoyo de sus padres, quienes siempre le han apoyado en sus ideales.
Con ánimos de seguir rindiendo con éxito en ambos trabajos, Ivania solicita el crédito para contar con los equipos tecnológicos necesarios, requiere comprar una computadora de escritorio, una impresora, un data show y un mueble para la computadora. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que en la actualidad estar de mano con la tecnología es primordial, quiere realizar presentaciones llamativas y atractivas para sus alumnos, ya que para ella es importante que aprendan y capten de mensaje de la clase. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, brindarle salud y educación de calidad a su hijo, razón por la que seguirá trabajando con mucho esmero hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Her love for the field and caring for the crops moved Ivania to study Agroecology, a carreer in which she graduated with honors. She is 29 years old, is single and has a 3-year-old son. She is a dynamic, intelligent and enterprising woman. She set herself the goal to have two jobs in order to improve the economic situation of her family. Apart from working as a teacher in a university, she works as an assistant in a company. She is very successfull in both jobs. She is thankful for the support of her parents, who have always helped her with her plans. 

As she wants to continue working successfully in both jobs, Ivana is asking for a loan to buy the necessary technical equipment. She needs to buy a desktop computer, a printer, a data projector, and a computer cabinet. She places great hopes in the loan, because in our times it is vital to be up to date with technology. She wants to deliver eye-catching and attractive presentations to her students because it is important to her that they understand and grasp the message of her class.

It is her aim to improve the living conditions of her family, and to ensure the health of and a good education for her son. To achieve this, she will continue working hard.

loans.use: to buy a desktop computer, a printer, a data projector, and a computer cabinet.

loans.name: Ha Chung's Group

texts.en:
Chung is an ethnic Thai woman, born in 1984. She lives with her family in Mai Son district, Son La province. She has been participating in the program since 2010 and she has a lovely 7-year-old son.
  
Her family income is mainly based on breeding and farming, and she can sell from two to three chicken litters each year. It is just enough to cover her family living cost, but not to save much after deducting all costs. 

Her family has 1,500 square meters of farm land, and she wants to have money to invest in raising nearly 100 mixed fighting chickens, but she doesn’t have it. So she really wants to borrow some money for this investment.
	
She hopes the loan amount will help her develop good animal husbandry, improve family life, and save, accumulating money for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to invest in raising chickens

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Sophin is a 28-year-old who lives in Kratie province and is the mother of six children. 

To support her family, she earns income via growing rice and cassava. Moreover, she works for others for a fee and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. For Sophin, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have electricity for use and that she can update her lifestyle to better than it was before.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbaatar, who is 49 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2013. His wife runs a tailor workshop at home. Their elder daughter works at a high school as a teacher and their younger daughter began going to elementary school. 

Mr. Batbaatar is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as felts, fibreglass and planks for renovating his home and fences. Their family resides in a Mongolian traditional Ger or Yurt (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his home in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Betsy Katherine

texts.es:
Betsy es una joven madre de familia de 22 años, vive en Ica junto a su familia. Por circunstancias de la vida es madre soltera y tiene que ver la manera de sacar adelante a su hija. Con mucho entusiasmo y esfuerzo trabaja como vendedora de calzados de una reconocida marca, ella cree que le va bien por su dedicación y su lucha constante, sobretodo porque su hija es su mayor motivación en la vida.
Betsy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá empezar a construir un cuarto en el segundo piso de su casa, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida, sentirá mayor comodidad y continuará con su labor para poder en un futuro ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Betsy is a young, 22-year-old mother of a family. She lives in Ica along with her family. Because of circumstances of life, she is a single mother and has to find a way to bring her daughter out ahead. With much enthusiasm and effort, she works as a seller of footwear of a known brand. She believes that it is going well for her because of her dedication and her constant struggle, above all because her daughter is her greatest motivation in life.

Betsy is thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have provided to her, she will be able to begin to construct a room on the second floor of her home. In this way, she will improve her quality of life. She will be more comfortable and will continue with her labor to be able to see her daughter become a great professional in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a room on the second floor of her home.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 29 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Liza has a general store business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Liza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 28 years old and married with two children. 

Charlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Charlyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Charlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lydian

texts.en:
Lydian is a 43-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She runs a taxi business, serving the public to earn an income. She has six years with this business.

Lydian needs a loan to buy another second-hand taxi, a new paint job, new rims for the wheels and especially, to pay for the vehicle's license. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lydian joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy and license another second-hand taxi, and pay for a new paint job and new rims for the wheels

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
This is Amie. She is 28 years old and currently resides with her husband, Leovin, in Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for three years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her child. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their child with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Amie would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 50,000 PHP, she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Amie dreams to become a successful businesswoman. She hopes to give her child a better life than they currently have. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Vaioleti

texts.en: Vaioleti is 53 years old, married, and has six children. She owns and operates a store, selling a variety of items to earn an income. She has been doing this for 14 years. Vaioleti needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, a new display fridge, snacks, canned items, frozen goods, soft drinks, and a new cash register machine. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, a new display fridge, snacks, canned items, frozen goods, soft drinks, and a new cash register machine

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima is 40 years old and has four children. Ma. Fatima is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fatima requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for four years.

In the future, Ma. Fatima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 23 years old and married. She has one child, who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Lovelyn has been in this business for two years.

Lovelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maribel has a flower shop business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of flowers to sell.

Maribel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 26 years old and married with three children. Sherlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Sherlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Sherlyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Sherlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim is 54 years old and lives in a rural village in the Borseth district of the Kampong Speu province. He is a father of eight children, one of whom is still in school. 

Rice farming has been the primary source of the family’s income for 36 years and he earns about 20,000 KHR per day. To supplement the income, his wife also works as a garment worker in the local area. 

Sim’s group consists of two members, who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now, he is leading his group to seek a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to build a clean latrine for his family's use. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to build a clean latrine for his family's use.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Shumaila because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts. 

He wants to meet the demand of bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories but does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Shumaila humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan her husband will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

Shumaila is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 43 years old and married with three children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Nila needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, gloves, boots, and a machete. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Nila will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, gloves, boots, and a machete.

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en: Karoline is a 57-year-old widow with 4 children. She has a large elei printing business. To earn extra income, she also runs a bakery in her village. Karoline needs a loan to buy wooden carved designs, rubber designs, stencils and rolls of material. And, for her bakery, she'll also be buying bags of flour and a large stove. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. Karoline joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy wooden carved designs, rubber designs, stencils and rolls of material, and for her bakery, she'll also be buying bags of flour and a large stove.

loans.name: Tailelei

texts.en: Tailelei is a 52-year-old married woman with 4 children. She sells locally made Samoan chips in her community to earn a living. She has 9 years of experience with this business. Tailelei needs a loan to buy a bunch of bananas, a load of taro, plastic bags, a barrel of cooking oil, a large pot and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tailelei has been a member of SPBD since 2005.

loans.use: to buy a bunch of bananas, a load of taro, plastic bags, a barrel of cooking oil, a large pot and a new oven.

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale is a 46-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She owns and operates a shop in her village, and to earn some extra income, she also has a small bakery. Tafale needs a loan to purchase a large hanging scale, a new cash register machine, 2 large freezers, snacks, frozen goods and a new display refrigerator. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tafale joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a large hanging scale, a new cash register machine, 2 large freezers, snacks, frozen goods and a new display fridge.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 23 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Gina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mercilita

texts.en:
Mercelita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercelita is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mercelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mercelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mercelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Eldida

texts.en:
Eldida is 48 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Eldida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Eldida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 34 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jasmin has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of shoes, bags, and other personal items.

Jasmin has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jasmin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, bags, and other personal items.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Sally works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a restaurant. Sally is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy snack foods to resell.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy snack foods to resell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 55 years old and married. Beatriz works very hard to provide for them.

Beatriz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Beatriz has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, biscuits, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future Beatriz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 29 years old and married with one child who is in school. For the past 11 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling rice. Ana Marie has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family.

Ana Marie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as snack foods, canned goods, rice and other groceries. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, canned goods, rice and other groceries

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Tala needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, new boots, a machete, a new wheelbarrow and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, new boots, a machete, a new wheelbarrow and a tiller.

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cami Irma ella es soltera y tiene 60 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de textiles, la socia trabaja desde muy temprano  y por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,le gusta hacer trabajos en hilos como mantas y textiles,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de textiles. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar hilos de colores y palitos de tejer.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the community bank “KUSIKOYLLOR”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco. One of the members is Cami Irma. She is 60 years old and unmarried. She works in the business of selling textiles. She starts working early in the morning and through this business she wants to forge ahead. She has already been working in this business for several years. She likes to do projects with yarn like blankets and textiles. Her dream is to expand her business of selling textiles. She is requesting a loan to buy colored thread and weaving needles. The other members are in the business of selling clothes, selling bricks, running a grocery store and running a restaurant. Cami is thankful for those who are part of this dream in this way and she agrees to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: buy colored thread and weaving needles

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has earned a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Carolina also earns additional income from selling food.

Carolina is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a housewife who is a mother with six children. The only income for her family is through the subsistence earnings of her husband, who runs a grocery store. 

Khursheed is requesting a loan so that her husband can buy salt, rice, flour, detergent and other goods for his store. She hopes her husband will expand his retail horizons and be able to move into selling other more profitable goods. Khursheed wants to keep her husband’s store in operation so that her children will get a quality education and her family’s living standards will improve.

loans.use: to buy salt, rice, flour, detergent and various goods for her husband's store

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.
 
Shehnaz has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan so that her son can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.
  
Shehnaz is a 50-year-old woman, living with her six children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a good manner.
 
His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fee, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables for her husband.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 30-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the  family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all family members. Sana has been running her own beauty salon for past five years. She contributes her income to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, a hairbrush, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items. Therefore, Sana has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Sana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Эту 42-летнюю женщину зовут Латофат. Она решительный деятельный человек, имеющий свой бизнес. В 2008 году Латофат собственным капиталом открыла продуктовый магазин и ее бизнес существует уже 6 лет. 
Латофат живет вместе с мужем, и четырьмя детьми в одном из древнейших городов Таджикистана, в городе Куляб. Он расположен на 203 км юго-восточнее столицы республики - города Душанбе. 
Латофат в своем магазине продает такие продукты, как: печенье, рулеты, конфеты, макароны, шоколад, напитки, хлеб и т.д. Старшие дочери Латофат, которым по 21 и 19 лет, помогают ей в торговле. Латофат сейчас хочет увеличить ассортимент продуктов в своем магазине, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Для этой цели она берет кредит, чтобы привезти необходимый товар. Кредит поможет увеличить количество клиентов, так как они смогут найти в магазине необходимый им товар.
texts.en:
This 42-year-old woman is called Latofat. She is an active, determined person who has her own business. She opened a grocery store with her own capital in 2008 and it has been open for six years. Latofat lives with her husband and their four children in Kulob, one of Tajikistan’s oldest cities, which is located 203 km southeast of the capital, Dushanbe.

Latofat sells grocery products such as cookies, rolls, candy, pasta, chocolate, beverages, bread, etc. Her oldest daughters are 21 and 19, and they help her around the store. Latofat wants to offer a wider variety of products in her store in order to attract more customers. She is taking out a loan to acquire the necessary items. The loan will help her to expand her customer base because people will be able to find the products that they need.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and increase sales at her store

loans.name: Gladis Urania

texts.es:
Gladis es una señora de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado, no continuo sus estudios por la economía en que vivían sus padres, estaba acompañada pero su compañero de vida decidió alejarse del hogar, es madre de 3 hijos de 29, 26, y 10 años de edad, de lo cuales 2 de ellos están acompañados por lo tanto dependen de ellos mismos, el ultimo se encuentra estudiando y es el que depende de ella. 

Gladis trabaja en un club hotelero desde hace 16 años, trabajo que lo aprendió por sentirse sola y por la necesidad que tenia para mantener a sus hijos. Gladis para trasladarse a su trabajo viaja en trasporte que le asigna la empresa trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm.

El crédito que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar puertas y pintura ya que su casita no tiene puertas y no esta pintadita, también comprara 2 cerdos de engorde para crianza. Donde espera obtener un ingreso dentro de un tiempo para tener una mejor calidad de vida de su hijo y ella.

Gladis sueña con que su hijo menor estudie una carrera universitaria para poder sobrevivir en la vida.
texts.en:
Gladis is 45 years old and has a grade 3 education. She couldn’t continue in school because she came from a poor family. She used to be married, but her husband decided to leave home. She has three children aged 29, 26, and 10, two of whom are married and independent, but she supports the youngest as he is still in school.

For 16 years Gladis has worked in a hotel club, work that she learned how to do when her husband left and she needed to support her children. To get to work she travels by the transport provided by the business. She works form 7am to 7pm.

The loan she is seeking from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy doors and paint as her home lacks both. She also wishes to buy two pigs to raise. She hopes that this purchase will result in income after a while so both she and her son can have a better quality of life.

Gladis’s dream is to see her youngest son attend university so he can do well in life.

loans.use: buy doors and paint for her house, and two pigs to raise

loans.name: Mehebbet

texts.en:
Mehebbet is 31 years old and is married with two children, ages two and four. He works as a security guard and his wife is a nurse at the local polyclinic. Mehebbet wants to start his own business raising cattle to generate his own independent income. 

Mehebbet is requesting a loan to purchase a cow and feed to start his new business. He dreams of having a dairy cattle farm and will do everything possible to achieve this dream.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a dairy micro-business

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es: Ruth de 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de arreglos florales  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Doña Ruth está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  rosa, flores y accesorios para al elaboración de los arreglos y poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
47-year old Ruth sells flower arrangements. Her business is located in the local market which is close to her home. She lives with her husband and two children in their own home.

Sra. Ruth is seeking a loan to buy roses, other flowers, and accessories to make the arrangements so she can continue her business and earn more money.

loans.use: buy roses, other flowers, and accessories

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita has been working on their own farm for many years while her husband works as a driver to make a living. With her generated income from farm produce, she was able to raise her family well. Planning to improve the farm, she took a new loan recently to purchase planting materials and to cover farm fertilization costs to restore farm nutrients. Organic fertilizer helped to renew nutrients needed for the farm. She hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to purchase planting materials and to cover farm fertilization costs to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with five children. For almost four years, Virginia has owned and managed a vegetable farm in their village. She earns a net income of 1,000 PHP each week which is usually spent on her family’s daily expenses. 

Virginia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings to sell. She is asking for this loan as she has insufficient funds for her business. Virginia hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seedlings to sell

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 48-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a shop in which he sells bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blankets, etc. Recently, he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which diminished his purchasing power to buy new blankets. Now, customers want blankets because the winter season is going to start. Riffat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's business. He will utilize the loan amount for purchasing blankets and bed sheets.

Her dream is to provide all facilities to her children. 

Riffat is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy blankets and bed sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Maira Araceli

texts.es:
Maira, se dedica a la crianza de gallinas mejoradas, posee su granja desde hace 2 años, su mamá le enseño el negocio, su ventaja es que en la zona no tiene competencia para distribuir el producto. Maira vive con su esposo, son padres de tres hijos de 1, 5 y 9 años edad, comparten la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Utilizará el capital para comprar gallinas, concentrado y vacunas, le será de ayuda para fortalecer su negocio, alimentar y proteger de enfermedades a sus animales, con lo que espera mejorar sus ventas, tener más ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y la deuda adquirida.
Sus anhelos son tener una grana mejor establecida y seguir teniendo ingresos para ofrecer un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
