Maira earns her living raising chickens. She has owned her farm for two years and learned the business from her mother. She has an advantage in the neighbourhood in that no one else is selling chickens.

Maira lives with her husband and has three children aged 1, 5, and 9. She and her husband share the responsibility of buying the household necessities. 

She plans to use the loan money to buy chickens, special feed, and cows. These purchases will enable her to strengthen her business, as well as feed and protect the animals from disease. She hopes to increase sales and have more income to cover the costs of raising a family, and pay off her debt.

Her greatest wishes are to have a better-established farm and a secure income so she can offer a better future to her children.

loans.use: buy chickens, special feed, and cows

loans.name: Joevy

texts.en:
Joevy works hard to support his family. Joevy is single and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Joevy requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell. He has been in this business for seven years now and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

In the future, Joevy would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 56-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. She has been selling bed sheets along with her husband for many years. She purchases bed sheets from the market along with her husband at a low price and sells them at a high price. Her husband sells by bicycle and she sells from her home. The ladies of the town like her selection of bed sheets and demand more colorful bed sheets.  Her husband pays for all their expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.
 
She has requested a loan so she can buy more colorful bed sheets to fulfill the demand.

Akhtar dreams of a bright future for her children and wants to provide better facilities to them.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets for herself and husband.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 59 years old and married with six children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Judith aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 42, a mother of four children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible wife and mother. She engages in her daily routine work, in fact she has to do all tasks alone and that is why she becomes so tired daily. She has to look after her young children and old parents.  She wants to purchase a separate house for her family in which she could feel at ease and relaxed, but her husband’s job is unsatisfactory for getting high income.

Her husband owns a medical clinic in which he provides first aid services to patients. He has been taking training from a professional MBBS doctor, now he owns his own small clinic on the basis of his experience. He has been treating his patients, and his patients recovered as well. He has become very famous in the society and wants to establish his clinic using the latest medical equipment but he does not have capital.

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan for her husband; she hopes that her husband would be able to buy medicines, medical equipment, injections, and furniture for his medical clinic.

Rehana hopes that through the profit amount she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: to buy medicines, medical equipment, injections, and furniture for her husband's medical clinic.

loans.name: Abreen

texts.en:
Abreen is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, and he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He holds sole responsibility for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Abreen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales and earn maximum profit. However, due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase this fruit for his business. Abreen has therefore applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the fruit for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Мунира 42-летняя милая общительная женщина из юго-восточного города Куляб. Она живет там с четырьмя детьми и воспитывает их одна без мужа. Все ее дети еще учатся. Благодаря своему торговому бизнесу Мунира обеспечивает семью. Вот уже 14 лет как она занимается продажей продуктов питания в продуктовом магазине. Хотя Мунира имеет высшее педагогическое образование, она нигде не работала по своей специальности. Она выбрала путь предпринимателя и сегодня довольна своим бизнесом. 
За счет кредита Мунира сейчас хочет увеличить ассортимент необходимых продуктов в магазине, чтобы увеличить объем продаж.
texts.en: Munira is a kind and sociable 42-year-old woman from the southeastern city of Kulob. She lives there with her four children, whom she is raising alone with no husband. All of her children are in school. Thanks to her retail business, Munira can support her family. For over 14 years she has been selling grocery products at her store. Even though Munira has a degree in teaching, she has never worked in her area of specialization. She chose the path of an entrepreneur and is happy with her business. She wants to use the loan to offer a wider variety of essential products in her store in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy essential grocery products for her store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, a 58-year-old mother of three, helps her husband by working on their own farm to make a living. Aside from this, she runs a motorcycle transportation service to add to their income. She has supported the family basic needs and sent her children to school. She borrowed a new loan recently from GDMPC microcredit to repair an existing vehicle to provide better services. She saved a portion of her revenue in order to use it in the future.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle to provide better services.

loans.name: Minddanao Group

texts.en:
Imelda is the featured borrower of Minddanao group; she came together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as housekeepers and develop their beloved families living situations.

Imelda is a 38-year-old single mother of one child, for whom she works hard to develop his living situation and  provide him with the best education to make sure she can provide him with a brighter future.

Her loan amount will be sent to her child in the Philippines to cover his increasing living needs and education. Imelda is the first lady at the far left side of the picture with a black top. As for the other group members, Zeny is at the center, and Karen is the first lady at the far right side, both are single, and want to send the requested loan to their families to cover their increasing living needs.

loans.use: To send the loan amount to her child in the Philippines to cover his increasing living needs and education.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married, a mother of three, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family where her coconut land is located. She cultivates this land for a living. By saving her income from farming, she was able to put up a swine fattening business. Her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. Recently, she took a new loan to buy piglets and feeding supplies. She plans to cultivate the lot to gain an abundant harvest as well as having better income from her piggery business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeding supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 55 years old and has an only child. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She helps him in their transportation business while she is engaged in retailing cosmetics. Her previous loan used for their transportation services was repaid successfully. She took a new loan currently to cover maintenance costs and repairs. She wants to have a better living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs and repairs

loans.name: Mary Roselyn

texts.en:
Mary Roselyn is a 39-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines and she is married to Joefer, an Overseas Filipino Worker. She manages their household while operating the business. They work hard for their children and also to provide income for their everyday needs.

Mary Roselyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is paid in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are depending on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Mary Roselyn dreams of expanding her business more and hopes to give her children a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with six children; four of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson, 24, is a smallholder farmer who lives in a small village called Boito in the South Rift regions of Kenya. In this area, dairy and tea farming are the main economic activities practised by the constituents. Dickson, a mixed-farmer, practices both. He has been doing this work for 6 good years.  His primary income sources are milk, tea and motorcycle transportation services.

The father of 2 stated that milking is the most enjoyable of his activities on the farm. He is very connected with his dairy animals and has assigned a name to each of them. He has dreams of growing his dairy farm by herding more animals and buying more land.
 
Dickson is seeking a loan of KES 35,000 only to purchase a dairy cow. Business-related expenses keep rising by the day forcing farmers and businessmen alike to reduce costs and/or increase sales. The additional cow will help in the utilization of pasture and will increase of milk production and availability of more byproducts. Dickson will be able to save a bit on the expenses such as fertilizer. He hopes that he will be able to use your loan investment wisely to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marmar

texts.en:
Marmar lives in Artik town, and is a mother of three sons. Her husband is a builder, her elder son is a migrant worker and her second son serves in the army. The only son living with Marmar works at a local store as a cashier.

For 10 years now, Marmar has rented a small space in one of Artik's markets, where she trades in clothing. The assortment of clothing that she sells in her store is big enough to satisfy her customers' demands.

She has requested this loan to be able to purchase new stock of clothing for her store. 

She already took a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Marmar has been able to run her retail business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet, 49, is a smallholder mixed-farmer who makes a living selling milk, tea and food crops -- all produce from his farm. He owns a small piece of land in Thuita village where he stays with his lovely 39-year-old wife and four sons. To sustain this big family, he also has interests in other small side-businesses.
 
For the last 20 years that he has been doing this work, Japhet stated that he gets most enjoyment from attending to his animals and cultivating his land. His biggest challenges over the years have been transportation and marketing of his products.

Japhet is seeking a loan to purchase cereal grains. Farm inputs have grown so expensive that farmers have resorted to seeking cheaper deals that are run by unscrupulous businessmen. They end up buying ‘fake’ seeds that either do not germinate at all or they do germinate but the farmers will never live to see their produce.
 
With your loan, you are cushioning Japhet from this path to which many farmers fall prey. With your money, he is going to acquire seeds from the much more expensive but authentic, authorized dealers. This path is very likely to lead to a healthy and productive growth of the staple crops.
 
He is going to use the profits he will make to grow the business and to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cereal grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for hand labor to give assistance to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and equally responsible for all of them. 
She belongs to an ultra-poor family and that is why she cannot afford their educational expenses, so that most of her children are doing jobs as laborers in daily wages. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material.  Balqees has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to  buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

Balqees is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 32-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sajida is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn has been growing and raising pigs to sell in town for more than seven years. This is the primary source of income for the family. With her generated income, she was able to sustain and provide for the needs of her children. 

Merlyn took out a new loan to buy feeding supplies. She is planning to expand her piggery, hoping it will prosper and enable her to improve her children's lives. She has recently become a member of GDMPC.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Whats Apper Group

texts.en:
Lolita is the featured borrower of Whats Apper Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have become close friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines and decided to come to Lebanon and work as housekeepers to provide their families with a better living.

Lolita is a 44-year-old married mother of two. She works as a housekeeper to provide her beloved family with a better living, hoping that one day they can unite together after she establishes her own productive business.

Unfortunately, Lolita's acquired loan will be invested in paying for her mother's funeral expenses. She is very sad for her loss, since she used to feel that her children were in safe hands back in her hometown, but now she feels that they are insecure.

Lolita is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Diana (the second from the left) and Criselda (the second from the right) are married mothers of three children who work as housekeepers too and want to send the money to their families, while Charlet, the first lady from the left, is a single lady who also wants to send the money to her beloved family in the Philippines.

loans.use: To pay for her mother's funeral expenses

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.ru: Махфуза студентка 4 курса. Она родилась в 1984 году. Махфуза замужем и имеет 2 детей. Она после окончания средней школы не имела возможности поступить в университет, так как ее родители получали маленькую зарплату. Махфуза 4 года назад поступила в Медицинский колледж, так как она с детства мечтала стать врачом. Она учится последний год, и после окончания колледжа будет работать в роддоме, так как она учится по специальности акушера. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в колледже. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahfuza is a fourth-year student who was born in 1984. She is married and has two children. When she graduated from high school she was unable to attend university, since her parents' income was so low. Then, four years ago, she entered medical school, as she had dreamed of becoming a doctor since childhood. She is in her last year of school and when she finishes she will work in a maternity hospital, since she is training to be an obstetrician. She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her medical school tuition

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина молодая и энергичная девушка. Ей 18 лет. Она в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Мадина поступила в факультете банковское дело. Она после окончания университета мечтает работать в банке. Для этого она учится хорошо и старается получить хорошие оценки. Мадина не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители не имеют денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Madina is an energetic young woman. She is 18 years old and enrolled in Khujand State University after finishing high school this year. She studies in the finance department and wants to work in a bank after graduation. To do this, she studies hard and tries to get good grades. Madina is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents do not have money, so she applied for a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Kalerwe Group

texts.en:
Fulgensio is a 40-year-old, married with five children of whom all to school. He is a first time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd and is borrowing a loan of UGX 500,000 through the group in order to increase the capital in his business. He runs a small snack-making business which he started to raise income. He sells pancakes, doughnuts, and fried cassava among other snacks that his customers can easily eat.

 He has been able to get income to pay tuition for his children and also provide the basic needs for them. He has been able to supply his snacks to some shops and also supermarkets. He is a very hard-working  gentle man and also God-fearing. He is also thankful to the funders. His dream is to borrow more money and buy a plot of land and build a home for his family. Pictured are the group members with the UGAFODE credit officer on the extreme right.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 52 years old and widowed with three children. She is a farmer in Nakuru town and she keeps livestock. She has been in this business for 10 years and right now she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She will use this loan to buy poultry for rearing. She will be able to supply chicken and eggs to various markets and hotels in the area. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more livestock and also service the loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to have a stable farming business and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy poultry for rearing.

loans.name: Vip Vip Group

texts.en:
Neema is aged late twenties, single, and has got one son who is schooling. She has a 'mamalishe' business, serving breakfast and lunch foods, a business she has been with for one year. Neema uses income from her business to support her family. She works from 5 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her third loan request with Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use it to buy rice, maize meal, beans, sugar, baking flour, and cooking oil. She used the previous loans, repaid successfully, to grow her business capital. She bought rice, baking flour, cooking oil, and maize meal. She managed to receive an extra income which she used to buy a plot of land and covered school fees and household expenses. Neema dreams that one day she will be able to build her own family house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group"VIP VIP" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize meal, beans, sugar, baking flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mhar Fazoon

texts.en:
Mhar Fazoon is 43, living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantity.

Therefore, Mhar Fazoon has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.
 
Mhar Fazoon is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh milk in bulk for reselling from their shop.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Robinah has a tailoring business and has been in this business for 15 years. She works in a shop seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She has applied for a loan of Uganda Shillings 2,500,000  from MCDT - SACCO to buy more rolls of cloth and thread. She is aspiring of opening a tailoring school and also owning an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy rolls of cloth for making clothes

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 24 years old and a student at a university. He is also a staff member in a company and he has worked for the company since 2011. He can earn approximately $66.66 a day. Because of a lack of financial support, Lina would like to request a loan to pay for his third-year tuition fee. This loan will help him to go on his third year at the university. In the future, he is going to find a better job with better salary.

loans.use: to pay for his third-year tuition fee

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 27-year-old married woman who decided two years ago to start working in selling scarves and accessories in an attempt to help her husband who has a limited salary. After she gained experience, a few months ago, she opened  her own scarves and accessories sales business to increase her income.

Today, Zeinab is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new released clothes in an Autumn collection as an additional income business, as well as more fashionable and attractive scarves and accessories to attract more customers and provide them with better service. She hopes to expand her business more in the future and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new released clothes in an Autumn collection

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a poultry farming business in Nakuru town and has been in this business for six years now. She is 42 years old, married, and together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children. Her spouse also provides additional income for the support of the family.

Joyce will use this loan to buy more poultry for rearing. She anticipates making more income which she will use to grow her business as well as service the loan.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more poultry.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport by driving a truck for the last eight years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Rubina's husband needs to do maintenance on his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires one wheel to be replaced. It requires some other maintenance to maintain his truck. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do this maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Rubina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Rubina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. In this way, he can provide better transport to earn more profitable income. Rubina also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel for her husband's truck.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez, at the age of 40, is blessed with three wonderful daughters .In order to support her family and improve her living standard, which solely depends on her husband's earnings, she needs a loan to help her husband improve his business of reselling old clothes.The money would be utilized to buy and repair the damaged and ripped clothes. These clothes would then be resold in the market. The earnings generated from this business will help Kaneez to educate her children and provide an opportunity for her husband to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy and repair old clothes to resell.

loans.name: Pechsary

texts.en: Pechsary is a 19-year-old student at a university. He lives with his parents in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Pechsary would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him have enough money to cover the tuition expenses for a Bachelor's Degree. In the future, he is going to find a good job in any company or organization.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Matias Socorro

texts.es: Doña Matías de  56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, tomates, etc. para seguir elaborando mas pupusas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Matías is 56 years old, she lives in her own house with her family and she engages in preparing and selling “pupusas”*. Her shop is located in her house, and she can count on many customers thanks to her fair prices and the kindness she sells her products with. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as corn, beans, curd, fried pork skin and tomatoes to keep on preparing more pupusas and to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, curd, fried pork skin and tomatoes.

loans.name: Betkhem

texts.en:
Betkhem lives with her husband and daughter in Harij village of the Shirak region. Her husband is a constructor, who is specialized in the construction of churches. Betkhem herself runs their small family farm and takes care of the household. She keeps livestock (cows, calves, sheep and some hens), as well as cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. 

Betkhem is a very hardworking woman who does her best to develop her family's farm and help her husband in sustaining their living. The requested loan of 3,000 USD is very important for her to purchase potato and barley seeds, and forage for feeding her livestock in order to grow her farm.
 
Betkhem has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it back. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Betkhem has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Betkhem and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for potato and barley seeds and forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is spending time with her two children who are attending school. Her husband is an electronics repairman who offers his services in appliance repair. Mary Jane is also helping her husband in managing their electronics repair business. 

Her goal in life is for her children to finish their studies and become professionals. She and her husband are doing their best to give their children the best life. 

Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy tools and materials for repairing appliances. She hopes to grow the business someday for a continuous source of income.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for repairing appliances.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a happy person with the passion to succeed. At the age of 60, she still has the eagerness to succeed with her sari-sari store, which she has been operating for 11 years. She is thankful it is doing well. 

Luzviminda is getting older and so wants to save for her future. To accomplish that goal, she wishes to extend the products she sells so that she will earn a higher income. She is  therefore requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy drinks, breads, spices, and canned goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks, breads, spices, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna started her fish vending business when she borrowed a loan from ASKI. She is now two years into operating the business and hopes it will last until she can manage it. 

Edna is 49 years of age, married, and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. They earn their living from their respective sources of income. Edna wishes to earn a higher income and save some of it for the future of her family. She decided to borrow a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fish in the market and sell it around their village. She hopes to get a higher income in order to attain her wish.

loans.use: to buy fish in the market and sell it around their village.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building construction. In this regard her husband needs  raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. In that way, he can generate more income for financial support of his family. Razia is applying for loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a snack stand and establish it in a detour of her community.

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
This is Medie. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Medie hopes for her business to continue to flourish and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gladis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Gladis, invertirá nuevamente en su negocio, por lo que requiere más capital para comprar sandalias, zapatos y nuevos estilos de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, de esta manera se mantendrá ofreciendo a sus clientes productos de moda y a precios accesibles.
Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior realizo la compra de nuevos productos su negocio se ha ampliado, atrajo a nuevos clientes,  las ventas y ganancias son más favorables, tiene la oportunidad de dar a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Gladis will invest her new loan in her activity, as she needs more working capital to buy sandals, shoes and new fashions of women’s, men’s and children’s clothing. This will allow her to keep on offering her customers fashionable products at fair prices.
Thanks to her previous loan she has bought new products, her activity has grown and she has attracted new customers; moreover, her sales and her income have increased, and she has the chance to provide her family with better food and clothes, thus improving their health as well.

loans.use: To buy sandals, shoes and new fashions of women’s, men’s and children’s clothing,

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 29 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of her children attend school.

Mylene is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines for the last 5 years.  She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es: José, se ve en la necesidad de reparar su vehículo en el que realiza viajes, por lo que requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar repuestos y pagar al mecánico sus servicios, así seguirá atendiendo de mejor manera a sus clientes. José comenta que la inversión del crédito anterior le ha sido de utilidad para adquirir el nuevo vehículo con el cual ha generado otros ingresos importantes para resarcir sus deudas, costear sus gastos personales y cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José needs to fix his vehicle in which he makes trips, and that’s why he is requesting a new loan to buy spare parts and pay the mechanic for his services. With this he will be able to keep offering a good service to his clients. 

José says that with the investment of the previous loan he was able to acquire a new vehicle, with which he has generated more incomes of great significance to pay his debts, personal expenses and change his family’s life style.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay the mechanic for his services.

loans.name: Blanca Claudia

texts.es:
Blanca, realizo la compra de insumos para la tienda y para elaborar la venta de comida con el capital anterior, con lo que sus ventas mejoraron y la situación económica es más estable. Blanca y su familia viven en óptimas condiciones.
Actualmente tiene más demandas y considera que su inventario no está muy surtido por lo que se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar pan, golosinas, boquitas, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico,  jabón y otros productos que sean del gusto de sus clientes, espera tener tan buenos  resultados como en el préstamo anterior.
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Blanca bought supplies for her shop and ingredients to sell food, which meant that her sales increased and her economic situation is now more stable. Blanca and her family's living conditions are ideal. 

Now, she has more demand but not enough stock to meet that demand which is why she is requesting a new loan to buy bread, candy, snacks, sanitary towels, toilet roll, soap and other products that her customers like. She hopes that her results are as good as they were with her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy bread, candy, snacks, sanitary towels, toilet roll, soap and other products that her customers like.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 46 and she is married. She lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Kousar purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells it in her locality. She has been doing this since 2005, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to utilize her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to upcoming Eid festival, the demand for clothing will increase as well. 

This is the reason Kousar showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming cloths for her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for reselling form her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
Anam is a 26-year-old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has been working in the public sector for many years, and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family.  Anam provides sewing services and earns income to contribute to management of the household with her husband.

Anam needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, thread, pieces of clothing, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means, is unable to purchase these accessories.  Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for a loan that will enable her to purchase these above accessories to help her increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Anam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, pieces of clothing, and machine oil for her business.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jafar is a pensioner. He is a married man with four daughters who have families and live separately. Jafar, at his age, decided to get involved in a new business. He has been interested in animal husbandry for a long time. Now he wants to make his dream a reality. He has had this experience like many locals in his area. He has stocked up on livestock feed and also has some savings. Jafar is requesting the rest of the amount as a loan. He is planning to buy a head of livestock and start the business. He needs your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start his own business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina has three children, all boys, who they are sending to school. Her husband is a farmer. To make a living and in order to help her husband fill their children's needs, Catalina engages in a retailing business. She is also managing a restaurant in front of her sari-sari store within their village. Catalina wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store business. She will also use part of her loan to buy raw ingredients and meats to cook for her restaurant business. Catalina believes that she can provide all her children needs through the earnings she gains from the businesses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is a 52-year-old lady, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children have reached the age of marriage. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her three sons have been driving auto rickshaws for many years; their income is sufficient to feed the entire family. One of her sons has to maintain the auto rickshaw but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem. Therefore, Rasoolan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son will be able to fix the auto rickshaw.
 
She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until the time of their marriages. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela, 51 and a mother of four children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For over ten years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. Adela had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase organic fertilizer, and a portion of the amount will be used to pay the school tuition fees of her children. In the future she wants to see her children's success and to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay the school tuition fees of her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the application procedures to obtain her university degree.

loans.name: Lucila Suleima

texts.es:
Lucila, vive con su familia integrada por su esposo y sus hijos; dentro de su familia aprendió a administrar un negocio de artículos para el hogar, posteriormente con su experiencia fundo su propio negocio hace 3 años, es así como puede tener una fuente de ingresos con los que cubre las necesidades de su hogar.
Con la visión de ampliar su negocio y ofrecer nueva mercadería a sus clientes se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar relojes de pared, juguetes para niños/as, floreros, portarretratos, espejos, etc., tendrá un mejor inventario con el que atraerá nuevos clientes, aumentara sus ventas y ganancias, las cuales utilizara para pagar su deuda.
Sus sueños son ir poco a poco ampliando el negocio para lograr dar una vida más diga a su familia y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Lucila lives with her family, formed by her husband and her children. Within her family, she learned how to manage a business selling household articles. 

Afterwards, and with her experience, she started her own business 3 years ago. With this source of income she pays for the household needs. 

With the vision of expanding her business and offering more products to her clients, she decided to ask for a new loan to buy wall clocks, toys for children, vases, photo frames, mirror, etc. She will have more products with which she will attract new customers, improve her sales and profits, and pay her debts.

Her dreams are to expand her business little by little to give her family a more dignified life and buy a house of their own.

loans.use: to buy wall clocks, toys for children, vases, photo frames, mirror, and others.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Janet is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Adán

texts.es:
Adán es un señor de 56 años de edad, es agricultor, su nivel de estudio fue hasta el segundo grado, luego se dedico a trabajar para ayudar a su madre y sus hermanos ya que lastimosamente su padre falleció. Ahora es un hombre casado y es padre de 6 hijos de, 32, 29,27,25,18 y 16 años de edad, de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando y los demás ya están casados; por lo tanto dependen de ellos mismos, viven con Adán su esposa y sus dos hijos son los que dependen de él, su esposa se dedica al comercio venta de frutas y verduras mientras que Adán se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería desde hace 45 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre y por la misma necesidad económica en que vivian. Para trasladarse a su trabajo, Adán viaja en bicicleta medio kilometro trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 11:00 am. Rutina de todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar un sistema de riego para la siembra de pipianes, que sembrara en verano para poder producir mas cosechas y así lograra tener más ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Adán sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, para que en un futuro sean personas de bien, ampliar más su vivienda para estar más cómodos y tener dos vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Adán is a 56 year old man and a farmer. He studied up to the second grade, after which he started to work in order to help his mother and brothers due to the unfortunate death of his father. He is now a marred man and a father of 6 children, aged 32, 29, 27, 18 and 16. Two of them are studying and the others are already married, and so are financially independent. Adán lives together with his wife and two dependent children. His wife sells fruits and vegetables while Adán earns an income from agriculture and bricklaying, which he has been doing for 45 years. He learned this trade from his father and due to the situation of economic need in which they lived. In order to reach his job, Adán travels by bicycle half a kilometre, working from 6:00 AM until 11:00 AM. That is his everyday routine.

The loan that he is requesting from the lending institution is meant to buy an irrigation system for growing squash, which he will plant in summer in order to produce a bigger harvest and so earn a larger income, which he will use to give his family a better quality of life.

Adán dreams of his children becoming professionals so that in the future they are good people, and also to expand his home in order for them to be more comfortable and to have two milk cows.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation system in order to grow squash

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is a 60-year-old house-keeper from the Tskaltubo district. She has a five member family and the significant source of income is only from pensions.  It is really hardly enough to cover even their basic needs. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in under poverty. According to above-mentioned situation, Nanuli lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business. As these institutions require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Nanuli to get a loan of 2,000 GEL and start her trading business. She plans to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and sell at increased prices at the local market. She will have her own counter and will sell fresh products every day.

The loan will greatly assist Nanuli and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better lifestyle. She relies on the goodwill of lenders.

loans.use: To be involved in trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 64 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for 16 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 27-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband owns a barber shop. He is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all of the family members. 

Shameem's husband has been running his own barber shop for the past five years. He needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for his barber shop, but due to financial constraints he is not capable of buying these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Shameem has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her husband's business so that he can provide better services to his customers. It will also help him to earn a maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of his business and family.

For this financial assistance Shameem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband run his own barber shop

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. She knits handmade embroidery in her home. Her children also help her with the completion of her tasks. Her elder son has been running a small business of fiber sales. He buys raw material for his fiber work and sells its fiber variety to his customers for profit.  

Now he wants to increase his current business, but due to lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his mother, Zareena, has requested a loan from Kiva lenders. Zareena hopes that through this Kiva loan her son will be able to enhance his fiber business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more material for her son's fiber business

loans.name: Ever Armando

texts.es:
Ever es un joven de 22 años de edad, es jornalero, su nivel académico es el bachillerato no continuo sus estudios porque decidió trabajar para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. Es un hombre soltero por lo tanto no tiene hijos, viven con él sus padres y sus hermanos pero no dependen de él.

Ever se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió trabajar debido a que quería ayudar a sus padres en los ingresos del hogar, para llegar a su trabajo Ever viaja en bicicleta 1 km, trabajando en el horario es de 6:00 am a 11:00 am.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 2 vacas lecheras donde espera obtener ingresos, para poder apoyar más a su familia económicamente.

Ever sueña con tener un terreno propio donde pueda construir una vivienda digna y seguir estudiando para llegar a ser un profesional y así tener más posibilidades de tener un buen trabajo.
texts.en: 22-year-old Ever is a day laborer. He went to high school, but he stopped studying since he decided to work and help his parents with household expenses. He is a single man so he doesn't have children. He lives with his parents and his brothers, but they do not depend on him.  Ever has worked in agriculture for two years. He learned the trade from his parents and he decided to work in order to help his parents and increase household income. To arrive at work, Ever travels 1 km. on a bicycle and he works from 6:00 am-11:00 am. The loan that he is applying for from CREDICAMPO is to buy two milking cow which he hopes will help him increase his income to support his family economically. Ever dreams of having his own land where he will be able to construct a dignified home and continue studying in order to become a professional and have more opportunities to have a good job.

loans.use: to buy two milking cow which he hopes will help him increase his income to support his family economically.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make the monthly payment for the postgraduate course that she is studying.

loans.name: Maria Del Milagro

texts.es:
María del Milagro tiene 31 años, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a esposo y 3 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con buenas referencias, tanto laborales como familiares, pues los vecinos comentan que tiene una familia muy unida. María del Milagro vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María del Milagro se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales(caballos, cuyes y gallinas). Su conviviente se dedica a brindar servicio agricola como peon. Cuenta con 04 caballos los cuales alquila para trabajos de arado de la tierra. Ella necesita el crédito para la compra de 01 caballo en ocasión, con ello tendrá una mejor atención a clientes que demanden sus servicio y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Milagro is 31 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her 3 school-age children. They have good work and personal references, since they neighbors say they are a very close family. 

María del Milagro lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and stockbreeding. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the Chiclayo province at the Lambayeque region along the north coast of Peru.

María del Milagro works raising and selling animals (horses, guinea pigs and chickens). Her life partner works providing his services as a farmer. She has 4 horses which she rents for plowing the land. 

She needs the loan to buy one horse, so she can offer a better attention to her clients requesting her services, and in this way generate more incomes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy one horse, so she can offer a better attention to her clients requesting her services.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 51 años de edad se dedica a la producción de artesanías y al comercio en general , muñecas de trapo, uniformes, cosméticos, calzado, y todo lo que solicita su clientela, lo encuentran sus clientes en el pequeño almacén, que norma inició dese el 1989 ;   ella  desde muy niña poseía una fuerte inclinación por el comercio, por eso  poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia, hasta hoy que tiene su negocio y trabaja como una comerciante profesional en su ámbito familiar.  Norma elabora manualidades en tela, y siente una gran satisfacción por su trabajo; realiza sus ventas de contado y a crédito  sobre pedidos,  trabajando de 6 a 8 horas diarias en su pequeño taller de manualidades y comprando de contado  materias primas e insumos además de mercancías, en almacenes mayoristas, para venderle finalmente a sus clientes, quienes son sus vecinos y referidos por estos. La  meta empresarial de Norma es fortalecer su capital de trabajo,  aumentar la recuperación de la cartera de créditos  y su meta familiar es terminar de educar a sus hijos, que hoy se encuentran en las edades de 9 a 25 años; el gran desafío de Norma  es tener capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograr los objetivos propuestos. En la actualidad,  ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para elaborar muñecas de trapo y ropa,  además de mercancía variada que sus clientes han solicitado como calzado, cosméticos etc. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues fortalecerá su capital de trabajo, aumentando sus ventas y así mismo las utilidades.
texts.en:
Norma is 51 years old and works in the production of handmade goods and in general sales.  She sells rag dolls, uniforms, cosmetics, footwear and other goods that her customers request.  

Her customers find her in the small warehouse that she started in 1989.  Since she was a young girl she possessed a strong inclination for business, and because of this she acquired experience little by little.  Today she has her business and works and is known by her family as a professional tradeswoman.  

Norma manufactures cloth crafts and feels greatly satisfied by her work.  She performs her sales in cash and on credit by request, working from 6 to 8 hours a day in her small craft workshop.  She buys her premium materials in cash.  In addition to her supplies, she purchases her merchandise, from wholesaler warehouses, to ultimately sell to her customers.  Her customers are her neighbors and people referred by them.

Norma's business goal is to strengthen her working capital and increase the quality of her credit portfolio.  Her goal for her family is to finish educating her children, who are currently between 9 and 25 years old.  She is applying for a Kiva loan, and her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan she purchase supplies to manufacture dolls from rags and cloth, as well as various merchandise her customers have requested, such as footwear, cosmetics, etc.

With this investment her business will improve and she will strengthen her working capital, increasing her sales and likewise, her profits.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to manufacture dolls from rags and cloth, as well as purchase various merchandise to sell such as footwear, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 24-year-old man married.  His wife, Jane, adds additional income to support their family.   They are blessed with one child.  Samuel has operated a clothing business for three years and earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES.
 
Samuel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and requests his first loan of 20,000 KES  to buy skirts, suits, trousers, sweaters and blouses to sell to his customers.

Samuel plans to use the anticipated income to start an additional clothing stall and hopes to have a successful and bright future.

loans.use: to  purchase skirts, suits, trousers,sweaters and blouses to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Bibinozira

texts.en:
Bibiroziya, a hardworking married mother of two, started her own business five months ago sewing kurpacha (mattresses) and pillows. Her husband helps her sell her products. 

Bibiroziya wants to expand her enterprise  to attract more clients, and so is requesting a loan of 1800 USD to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en: Khalida is a 41-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building-making. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. Nowadays he wants to purchase a grinder machine for cutting iron accessories so that he can continue his shuttering work more efficiently and generate more income for the financial support of his family. Therefore, Khalida is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner so that her husband will be able to buy a grinder machine for shuttering work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a grinder machine for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Raheela's Group

texts.en:
Raheela, aged 26, has been involved in a embroidered cloth selling business for about ten years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to be starting and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

Raheela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Raheela thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Raheela stands in the middle of the picture.

loans.use: to buy printed and embroidered clothing for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Salme

texts.en:
Salme is from the town of Artik and lives there with her husband. 

She runs a clothing store in the center of  town. She receives clothing from abroad where her parents-in-law are living. 

She requests 3,000 USD  to increase the stock in her store and purchase winter clothing.
 
She had taken a loan from a local financial institution previously, but wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to recent hard work, Salme has been able to run her store in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for the store.

loans.name: Raphin

texts.en: Raphin is 26 years old and a nursing student at an institute. He lives with his parents in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Raphin would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to run his own small clinic and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es:
Melvin de 30 años de edad, es jornalero y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el sexto grado, no quizo seguir estudiando en ver el esfuerzo que su padre hacia, entonces mejor decidió trabajar para ayudarle económicamente en los gastos del hogar.

Es un hombre soltero, pero es padre de 2 hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad. Melvin vive con su madrecita, sus hermanos y una hija pero depende de él sus dos hijos.

Melvin se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres. Para llegar a su trabajo Melvin y su hermano quien le ayuda viajan en vehículo dos kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 6:30 am a 4:00 pm todos los días.

El cerdito que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar 2 novillas donde espera en un tiempo tener más ganancias y con ello poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Melvin sueña con tener 9 animales, mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: 30-year-old Melvin is a day laborer. He studied through the sixth grade. He did not want to continue studying after seeing the effort that his parents made, so he decided that it would be better to work in order to help them economically with household expenses. He is single, but he is the father of two children who are 4 and 1 years old. Melvin lives with his mother, brothers, and a daughter, but both his children depend on him. Melvin has worked in agriculture for 12 years, doing the work that he learned from his parents. In order to go to work, Melvin and his brother travel 2 km. in a car  and work from 6:30 am-4:00 pm every day.He is applying for a loan to buy two heifers in order to generate a larger income in the future and be able to give his children a better quality-of-life. Melvin dreams of having 9 animals, improving his home, and his children becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy two heifers in order to generate a larger income in the future and be able to give his children a better quality-of-life.

loans.name: Sumac Maki Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC MAKI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gerarda ella es soltera y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de pollos, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
La persona que sale con la cara tapada ya no pertenece al banco comunal Sumac Maki.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Sumac Maki." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

One member in Gerarda. She is single and 50-years-old and has 3 children. She raises chicken. She fattens them, raises them, and then sells them in different markets. The member has been in this business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the chickens. The member is applying for a loan in order to buy chickens and food for the chickens. 

The members who are in the group picture took it after a work meeting. The person whose face is covered no longer belongs to community bank "Sumac Maki." The other members sell clothes, sell artisan good or have grocery stores or restaurants. The members thank those who form part of their dream through Kiva and promise to comply with their payments in the established term.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food for the chickens.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 37-year-old married woman with three children who has sold mobile phones since 2013. She decided to start her own business to support her husband, a construction  worker.

Their income is not enough to cover both her family's needs and business development. Therefore, she requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her  merchandise with newly released mobile phones accessories and prepaid cards.

She works hard to  develop and expand her business, and hopes that in the future she might start a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase newly released mobile phones accessories and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, ha mejorado con el préstamo anterior su venta de tortillas, manifiesta que tiene mayor demanda de sus productos, por lo que tiene mejores ganancias.
Nuevamente requiere un financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de maíz y leña en mayor cantidad, le será de ayuda para aprovechara el buen precio al que le ofrecen la materia prima para mantener su negocio funcionando, seguirá luchando por mantener su progreso y seguir mejorando las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
María has improved her tortilla sales with the previous loan. She expresses that she has greater demand for her products, for which she has better earnings. 

Once again she requires funding to invest in the purchase of corn and firewood in greater quantity. It will help her to take advantage of the good price offered for the raw materials to keep her business functioning. She will continue fighting to maintain her progress and to continue bettering family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood in greater quantity. It will help her to take advantage of the good price offered for the raw materials.

loans.name: Mukeu Unity Women Group

texts.en:
Jane, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Mukeu Women Unity Group. A 56-year-old single mother with six children who are in school, she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about business, record keeping, and financial management.

Jane is a mixed farmer and also does poultry farming. She is requesting a loan to help boost her farming through the purchase of hybrid seeds that will enhance her production and income. Jane plans to use her money in funding her children's education.

Jane is happy for the opportunity of this loan and grateful to Kiva lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Eusebio Aniceto

texts.es:
Eusebio es una persona que siempre ha luchado por su familia, tiene 51 años y vive en Vista Alegre junto a su familia.
Tiene una maravillosa compañera de vida con quien fundó un hermoso hogar con 2 hijos, siempre lo ha apoyado en las buenas y en las malas. Desde hace varios años trabaja en el centro Municipal de su ciudad, Eusebio cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy emprendedor, trabajador, honrado y amable.
Eusebio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer mejoras en su casa como empezar a construir las columnas y paredes, ya que en dicha zona con frecuencia hay temblores y quiere que su familia se encuentre protegida ante cualquier dificultad. Gracias a esto él seguirá trabajando con la tranquilidad que su familia se encuentra a salvo.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a person who has always fought for his family. He is 51 years old and lives in Vista Alegra with his family. He has a marvelous life companion with whom he created a beautiful home with 2 children who has has always supported through the good and the bad. For several years, he has worked in the municipality in his city. Eusebio believes that his work is going well because he is entrepreneurial, hard-working, respected, and kind. 

Eusebio is thankful to the Kiva investors for the support that they have given him. He will be able to make improvements to his home like beginning to construct columns and walls since there are a lot a earthquakes and he wants his family to be safe when confronting any difficulties. Thanks to this, he will continue working peacefully knowing that his family is safe.

loans.use: to construct columns and walls in his house.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a 50-year-old  married woman with four children. Annabel works very hard to provide for them.

Annabel has operated a general store for 2 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF  to purchase more groceries to sell.  She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Annabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es:
Alba, a sus 48 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de 5 hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 14 años, comenzó a comercializar prensa y comestibles de manera ambulante por las calles del municipio de Medellín. Siempre ha querido salir adelante y mejorar sus ventas para tener un mejor sostenimiento económico.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará prensa y comestibles como frituras, dulces, entre otros al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran comerciante y tener un negocio que le permita generar unos ingresos mas estables.
texts.en:
Alba, at 48 years old, is a charismatic, active and helpful woman.  Being the mother of 5 children has been her principal motive for fighting tirelessly day to day, searching for alternatives to earn a living and give a livelihood to her children. 

Approximately 14 years ago, she began to sell periodicals and food as a street vendor on the streets of the municipality of Medellín.  

She has always wanted to get ahead and improve her sales in order to have a better financial standing. This being her motivation to request support through the means of a loan, with which she will buy periodicals and food such as fried food, sweets, among others by wholesale. With this she will be able to satisfy the demand from her customers.

She is always setting new goals for herself and among them is to become a great tradeswoman and have a business that allows her to generate a more stable income.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, fried foods, and periodicals to stock her business and continue to support her family.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.en: Maria Josefa is a widow who operates a cafeteria to make a living. Aside from this, she also sells cosmetics and ready-to-wear items to earn extra income. For the ten years she has run the business, she has earned well to support the needs of her child and has been able to sustain her business. She has taken a loan from GDMPC to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
At 33 years old, Japhet is on a steady rise to being a very successful mixed-farmer. He defies all the traditional agricultural practices that other villagers are hopelessly enthralled with. In Cheborge village, where he hails from, most villagers are subsistence farmers. The few who do commercial farming either keep dairy animals for milk or grow tea for the factories because it is a proven model. They all produce the same type and quality of tea, they all sell it to the same factory, they all get paid the same amount per kg and they all suffer shortcomings that befall their industry. The same spirit of conformity and contentment can be said about dairy farmers in the area.

Japhet, the father of one, has been doing farming for five years. His primary income sources are milk, tea and tomatoes. He enjoys gardening! However, his biggest challenge is lack of space for grazing.

Japhet is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. A cowshed is going to serve him best as far as dairy management is concerned. When he grew tomatoes, he came across many external challenges beyond his control including weather. He decided to construct a greenhouse, which in essence is a microenvironment where almost all factors and conditions are controlled. His production escalated dramatically since he became a god in his own way. The cowshed he is seeking to construct with your money will bring almost the same effect. He will not worry about grazing space anymore because food will be brought to the cows in the rations he determines. In a shed, he will have more control of the environment in which his animals will live.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Carla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carla, tiene una venta de sandalias y chancletas; ella es casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, no tiene ayuda económicamente del extranjero; atiende su negocio de lunes a sábado, lo aprendió dentro de su familia, la ventaja que tiene es la buena ubicación del negocio en el mercado y su desventaja es el precio del alquiler del local.
Utilizará el capital para comprar sandalias y chancletas, en nuevos estilos, colores y tallas para ofrecer mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes, espera incrementar las ventas y utilidades de su negocio, así mismo cumplir con puntualidad el pago de su deuda.
Sus proyectos son llegar a tener un bazar en el que tenga mayor oportunidad de crecimiento económico y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Carla sells sandals and flip-flops. She is married, lives with her husband and their children, and has no economic support from abroad. She tends to her business from Monday to Saturday.
