She learned it within her family. The advantage she has is the good business location in the market and her disadvantage is the rental price of the stall. 

She will use the capital to buy sandals and flip-flops in new styles, colors, and sizes to offer better buying options to her customers. She hopes to increase her sales and the utility of her business, and at the same time fulfill the payment of her debt on time. 

Her plans are to have a small store in which she will have greater opportunity for economic growth and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy sandals and flip-flops in new styles, colors, and sizes to offer better buying options to her customers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
As a father to 5 children, the great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals is what fills Patrick with enthusiasm and inspiration. 

Patrick is 56 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, he aspires to offer all of his children a university education. Patrick learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to his parents. He has a tiny plot of land to live off – just under half an acre – and has always struggled to support his family. Patrick has developed the farm in the sloping undulating terrain by successfully adopting suitable soil and water conservation methods such as stone pitched bench terracing and digging rain water storage pits. 

For over 18 years his income source has been from selling milk and tea. He supplement the meager income by doing other business.

Patrick passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding his own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. He is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in his village. Profits from milk sales have enabled him to take care of his family, and he wants to have more dairy cows and requests a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. He has already identified the breed of cow that he will buy. The cow will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk daily. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as the ideal drinking milk, because it will contain adequate amount of fat and the desirable quantities of protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production in his farm, which will translate to more sales volume and better income for himself and his family. 

Because of this high milk production potential, he will save more money to fully repay the loan. He believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping his dairy cow, he will have more income which will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy an exotic breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Elijah operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. he mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Elijah dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Somnayalgue Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA est responsable du groupe SOMNAYALGUE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgés à 21ans. 01 va à l’école. 
 Mme vend de l’atiéké (couscous de manioc) depuis 02ans .Elle vend aussi des layettes maintenant. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 05 sachets de couscous de manioc (atiéké) et 04 cartons de poisson.
 Elle veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne agrandir son restaurant et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa is in charge of group Somnayalgue. She is well. She is married and a mother of four children. Her oldest is 26, and her youngest 21 years old. One of them goes to school.

She has sold atiéké (cassava couscous) for two years. At present, she also sells baby clothes. She procures her supplies from local markets.

She wants to purchase five bags of cassava couscous (atiéké) and four boxes of fish. With her profits, she wants to bolster her business. She ambitions to develop her restaurant and to provide more for her children.

loans.use: to buy five bags of cassava couscous (atiéké) and four boxes of fish.

loans.name: Borin

texts.en:
Borin, who is 51 years old, lives in a community in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. He has three unmarried children; two are students and one is a seller. He is an active and honest grocery seller who can make around 7 USD per day. So far, he has been in this career for fourteen years.  

Borin wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is taking a loan through Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady, âgée de 52 ans, enseignante de profession depuis des années, s’est lancée dans le commerce il y a cinq ans maintenant. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont l’ainée, 25 ans et le cadet, 6 ans.
Khady a démarré son activité commerciale grâce aux crédits empruntés à l’IMCEC. Elle achète la marchandise chez ses copines qui font le déplacement vers Dubaï ou d’autres lieux de commerce et  qui ramènent des containers pour revendre. Elle vend selon la période comme pour cette fois-ci avec la préparation des fêtes, elle va acheter des tissus, des sacs, des chaussures pour revendre. Pour l’écoulement du produit, elle n’a pas besoin de se déplacer, elle a déjà sa clientèle qui la connaissent pour cette activité. Khady appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison et l’éducation des enfants.
 Madame Khady souhaite un jour réaliser son rêve qui est d’ouvrir une cantine et de s’y installer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady is 52 years old. A teacher for years, she started in retail five years ago. She is married and a mother of four: her oldest is 25 and her youngest 6.

Khady launched her retail business thanks to loans from IMCEC. She purchases her merchandise from her girlfriends who travel to Dubaï or other trade centers, and bring back containers of products to retail. What she sells depends on the period; for instance right now, with the lead-in to the holidays, she will purchase fabrics, bags, and shoes to retail. To sell her products, she does not need to get about, as she already has customers who know her and her business.

Khady helps her husband with the household expenses and the children’s education expenses. One day, she hopes to make her dream of opening a cafeteria come true, and to live on its premises.

loans.use: to buy bags, fabrics, and underwear to retail.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia ejemplar, tiene 21 años y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, estudió la carrera de mecánica y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse una mototaxi con la que trabaja actualmente, Carlos cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño, su constancia en su trabajo, responsabilidad y amabilidad con los clientes.
Carlos está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una cuna para su hijo, de esta manera estará más seguro y así con esa tranquilidad seguirá luchando por su familia. Más adelante quiere abrir su propia mecánica para poder independizarse.
texts.en:
Carlos is the father of an exemplary family.  He is 21 years old and lives in Ica, Perú, together with his family.  He is a person with a great desire to get ahead.  He studied mechanics and with great effort was able to buy himself a motorcycle taxi with which he currently works.  Carlos believes that things are going well because of his good efforts, his constancy in his work, his responsibility and his kindness to his customers. 

Carlos is thankful for the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to purchase a crib for his son, and in this way the family will be safer and he can continue working tranquilly for his family.  In the future he wants to open his own repair shop in order to have his own independent business.

loans.use: To purchase a crib for his son.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, a 58-year-old widow,  resides in Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She has three children who are in college, high school and elementary school.  She works hard to meet their daily household  and education needs.  She has fully dedicated herself to raise her children.

She has operated a food stall for a number of years. A food stall is a common sight especially in populated areas.  Working class people usually buy their reasonably-priced meals at food stalls for convenience and to save money.  The working class eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family.   Elvira is a good cook and her food stall is popular among neighbors and regular  customers.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP per day.

Elvira requests 30,000 PHP to buy pork, fish, chicken, and seasonings that are needed for her cooking.  She believes that with this financial assistance  her sales and earnings will increase.  She thanks God in advance for your great help.

Elvira dreams of expanding her business in order to secure the education of her children.  She wants them to have a bright future.  She meets weekly  with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business  draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God which she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, and gas.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monica is a 37-year-old married woman with 2 children and 2 adopted children. She runs a beauty salon business in the town of Tala and runs a poultry farm. Her spouse, Henry, provides additional income.  

She will use this loan to buy salon products such as hair weaves and wigs, hair bands, hair chemicals, and oil. She will also use part of the amount to buy more chicks to raise. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loans. In the future, Monica hopes to supply chicken feed and  build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy salon products.

loans.name: Cielo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Cielo siempre se ha caracterizado por su amor a los niños y su incansable búsqueda por su bienestar y educación, por esta razón, desde hace 7 años se viene dedicando al negocio de guardería y jardín infantil en el municipio de Medellín, prestando sus servicios todos los días en horarios extensos.

Manifiesta que es un negocio que le apasiona y se siente muy feliz de poder ayudar a los padres con el cuidado de sus hijos.

Solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su guardería y la adecuación de algunos espacios, también comprara material didáctico y de educación como juguetes y libros.

Con este préstamo podrá dar un mejor servicio de cuidado y podrá atraer a más clientes gracias a su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Cielo has always been known for her love of children and her tireless pursuit of their well-being and education.  That is why she has been in the daycare and nursery school business in Medellín for seven years.  She provides services every day with extensive schedules.

She says that she is passionate about the business, and she is very happy to be able to help parents care for their children.

She is requesting a loan to expand her daycare and to make improvements to some spaces.  She will also buy educational materials such as educational toys and books.

With this loan she will be able to give better care services, and she will be able to attract more customers thanks to her good service.

loans.use: to make improvements to her daycare business and to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is the age of 36 and lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been building houses for many years. He is very expert in his art; he has manufactured a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as brick trowels, buttering trowels, pointing trowels, hammers, chisels, jointers, and levels; his have become out of order. He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction work but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these tools. 

Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy tools for construction. Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for mason services.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane, exerce le métier d’enseignant depuis neuf ans. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’ainé, une fille, est âgée de 16 ans et le plus jeune, un garçon de 7 ans. Ousmane s’occupe des dépenses de location, de nourriture et de factures d’eau et d’électricité, ainsi que des soins médicaux de sa famille. 
Ousmane a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et ce troisième lui servira à acheter de la documentation dans le cadre de la formation qu’il suit pour augmenter son niveau d’étude. Dès qu’il aura obtenu son diplôme, il pourra accéder au rang de cadre pour bénéficier d’un meilleur salaire. 
Grâce aux prêts reçus de l’IMCEC, Ousmane a su d’avantage s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants et à améliorer leur conditions alimentaires.
Ousmane désire faire de l’élevage de moutons, un jour afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane has been a teacher for nine years. He is married and a father of three. His oldest is a sixteen-year-old girl and his youngest a seven-year-old boy. Ousmane takes care of the housing and food expenses for his family; he also pays the water and electricity bills, and the family’s medical costs.

Ousmane already benefited from two loans; this third one will be used to purchase documentation related to the training he is taking to increase his academic qualifications. As soon as he obtains his diploma, he will be able to become an executive and enjoy a higher salary.

Thanks to the loans received from IMCEC, Ousmane has been able to better provide for his children’s education and to improve the diversity of their food sources.

One day, Ousmane wants to raise sheep to diversify his income sources.

loans.use: to purchase work-related documentation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fuses, wires, light bulbs, switches, and insulating materials, among other materials that will allow him to perform good electric work.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 38 years old and married with two children, both attend school.

She has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She earns additional income selling food.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is an experienced farmer, from the village of Aragats  in Armavir region. She lives with her husband, pensioner parents-in-laws and a 10 year-old son. 

With the help of her family members, Nelli breeds a pig, and groves cabbage, cucumbers, and greens. Nelli's husband helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. This is a very important source of income for them. 

The requested loan of 3,000 USD will allow her to purchase cucumber seeds, fertilizer, windows for the greenhouse, and some pesticides to sustain her farm more effectively. 

This is Nelli's first loan and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Nelli ensures that she will make payments on time and hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase cucumber seeds, fertilizer, windows for the greenhouse, and some pesticides.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is composed of hardworking women. Jackline is 20 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her produce business, where she sells beans.

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of beans, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and personal development. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on her business.

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of beans

loans.name: Nogoye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois . Il est composé de 5 femmes issues du même villages et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Salla la responsable est une femme mariée âgée de 42 et mère de d'une fille scolarisé.Elle s'active dans l'élevage de bœufs. 
Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter un bœuf qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de sa fille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created from the first cycle of the village’s financial club. It is composed of five women from the same village, and united by excellent social and professional relations.

Mrs. Salla, the group’s leader, is a 42-year-old married woman with one daughter in school. Her business is cattle farming.

With her new loan, she will buy an ox to fatten and later resale. Profits from her business will allow her to provide her daughter with food and education, and to increase her savings with the village’s financial club.

loans.use: buy an ox to fatten.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La socia Eleuteria  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eleuteria continues working in food sales. Through this business she wishes to get ahead. She makes dishes such as roasted chicken and soups, among other things. Her dream is to expand her food sale business. Eleuteria requests the loan to buy vegetables, chicken, and beef. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill the payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Lenders! Kindly meet Amos, a 53-year-old active and hardworking man. He resides in the Chuka area of Kenya, an area known to experience the best weather patterns. It is also known as the bread basket of Kenya. He is a family man, and he cherishes his wife and 3 kids. 

Amos has been practicing farming for the past 15 years, and he has been able to take care of his family. Throughout the 15 years that he has practiced farming, Amos has been able to gather a lot of experience, and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Amos, being a responsible man who cherishes his family, would want to see his family grow economically and to have an impact in society. He wants to increase his farming business, so that is why he is seeking a loan of 25,000 KES. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, which would in return, increase his milk production levels. The cow dung from the cow will be used as fertilizer in his small kitchen garden, where he grows vegetables for sale and home consumption. 

Amos is very comfortable with the repayment period and monthly installments, and his projections are that he will be able to clear the loan even before the due date. Through the loan, Amos would be able to sell milk to his neighbors and also to the nearby villages, hence generating a lot of profits. This would result in better living conditions for his family and society. 

Amos’ target and dream is to open a milk processing plant once he has accumulated more funds.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband sells apples, bananas, and grapes. He is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage house hold.

Nazia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position he is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore Nazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila, who is a 22 year old, young, woman, lives in the Sagarejo district with her little infant. Her husband lives abroad and transfers money periodically to Leila. This is the only source of income for this young woman and her son. 

Leila has a great desire to be involved in her own activity and to do her bit for her son's welfare. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a business trading clothing with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from their borrowers. Leila’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural, poor, people the chance to start or re-start businesses. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. 

With the Start Up program she will be able to make savings and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to start a business trading in clothing and get her own source of income.

loans.name: Evaline's Group

texts.en:
Evaline's group is comprised of  hard working women. Evaline is 19 years old and lives in the town of Packwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Evaline has worked hard to manage her food stall business to sell cassava and beans. 

Evaline requests 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy beans and cassava.  This will help Evaline to generate greater profits and Improve her business. Evaline hopes to improve her standard of living. 

Evaline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy beans and cassava.

loans.name: Utana Group

texts.en:
Onike, who is in her mid-forties, is married and has got two daughters who are at school. For thirteen years now, Onike has been running a business selling bread, water and sodas. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her first credit request via the Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Onike will invest her portion to replenish her business with baking flour and cooking oil. Her ambition is to grow her business capital and introduce other projects. She is so thankful to everyone who will find the time to support her group.

loans.use: to replenish her business with baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia Matilde se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas y también vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas y compara verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Matilde works in the business of fruit and vegetable sales. She goes to different places to sell plantains, oranges, and apples and she also sells onions, tomatoes, and squash. She has worked for several years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell fruits and vegetables. She requests the loan to buy oranges, plantains, and grapes, and vegetables such as onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

She is happy about the loan and promises to fulfill the payments.

loans.use: to buy oranges, plantains, grapes, and vegetables such as onions, carrots, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Joy Hope Women Group

texts.en:
Rose, shown in the photo with her hand raised, is a member of Joy Hope Women Group. She is a 28-year-old married woman blessed with three children. She lives with her husband and earns her  living growing kale, potatoes, and dairy farming. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has received training on how to save money. manage business,  and resolve financial issues. This has helped her to  maintain proper records and manage her business properly.

Rose requests a loan to buy hybrid potato seeds.  She is pleased to have the loan and hopes it will enable her to expand the business and pay school fees and uniforms for her children. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid potato seeds.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan, the wife of a carpenter, wants to help her husband become a more versatile and proficient craftsman. She requires a loan so that her husband can buy new cutting and carving machines, thus enabling him to introduce innovation into his production capabilities. 

Gulshan, whose dream is to provide quality education for her two children, relies on her husband’s small income from manufacturing furniture. Thus, the loan would not only enhance the furniture business of her husband, but would also fulfill her dreams of her educated children.

loans.use: to buy wood and other raw material for furniture making.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a 32-year-old man married to Esther.  They have 2 children.  He  has operated a clothing business for four years and earns 15,000 KES each month.

Douglas was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and requests his first loan of 30,000 KES to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, and sweaters to sell to his customers.

Douglas plans to use the anticipated income to open a boutique and hopes to provide the best education to his children as he becomes a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, and blouses to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita’s husband is a fisherman.   Lucita goes to the village to sell the fish caught by her husband. Sometimes she imports fish to sell. Lucita and her husband live simply. 

Lucita and her husband use their income to purchase their daily food.  Lucita wishes to have savings and requests 18,000 PHP to buy fish to sell. Lucita’s loan will help her to have a stable and continuous source of income.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming inputs like fertilizers and herbicides for growing rice.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio Rolando  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ferreteria,el socio vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rolando continues working in the business of selling hardware.  He sells nails, paint and wire.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  He already has several years in this business and it is going very well for him.  His dream is to expand the hardware business.  He is requesting the loan to buy nails, paint and wire. 

Rolando is happy about the loan and he is committed to making his installment payments.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paint and wire.

loans.name: Rene Gustavo

texts.es: René, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo y reside en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de jornal y hace 3 años decidió por su propio negocio donde ofrece los servicios de reparación  de llantas para vehículo, carwash, cambio de aceite y venta de repuestos como parches, aceites, candelas, bandas, y otros accesorios para vehículos. Con el fin de capitalizarse y aumentar las ventas decidió solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá  en la compra de productos como aceites, grasas, líquidos, jabón y repuestos para vender y  obtener mayores ingresos.  Su meta es ver que el negocio crezca para bienestar familiar.
texts.en: René is 32 years old, lives in a common-low marriage with his wife with whom he has one son, and lives in the municipality of Masico, Atlántida. Previously, he was a day laborer, but three years ago, he decided to start his own business where he offers repair services for vehicle tires, carwashes, and oil changes and where he sells spare parts, such as patches, oil, candles, belts, and other car accessories. With the goal of collecting capital and increasing his sales, he decided to request a loan for 15,000 lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of products like oil, grease, fluids, soap, and spare parts to sell and to earn a larger income. His goal is to see his business grow for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy products like oil, grease, fluids, soap, and spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Shareefan is 62-year-old widow and lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has had a business to polish newly constructed concrete and marble floors for many years. He uses a floor polishing machine. His machinesFew is currently out of order due to  electrical problems. Shareefan's son wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash to buy it.

Shareefan  requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her son to buy a new floor polishing machine so that he can continue his services with minimal interruption. 

She is thankful to kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a  floor polishing machine for her son's work.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of Beera Self Help Group and joined the group in 2014.  She is a 25-year-old married woman with 2 children.  She grows vegetables to earn a living. 
 
Joyce is taking a loan to improve her farm by buying manure and fertilizer. She hopes that her yield will increase and provide more income. The increased income will help to educate her children. 

She is grateful for Kiva’s help.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yajayra Nohely

texts.es: Yajayra es una joven de 24 años de edad que pudo terminar sus estudios de enfermería satisfactoriamente y continua realizando su diplomado. Desde que era muy joven, ella siempre le ha gustado ayudar a las personas en delicado estado de salud. Es por eso que ella es buena en su carrera, como sus calificaciones demuestran. Su mayor deseo es poder insertarse al mercado laboral y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Actualmente está cuidando a un paciente. El préstamo que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de sus estudios y materiales de estudio.  Yajayra está muy agradecida a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible su sueño de ser profesional.
texts.en: Yajayra is a young, 24-year-old woman. She was able to complete nursing school successfully and continues working towards her certification. Since she was very young, she has always liked to help people in poor health. Because of this, she is good at her profession, as her qualifications show. Her biggest desire is to be able to enter the work force and, in this way, to be able to improve her quality of life. At present, she is caring for a patient. The loan that she requested will be used to pay for her education and school supplies. Yajayra is very thankful to Kiva lenders for making possible her dream to be a professional.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and materials for school.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's group is comprised of hard working women. Jane is twenty years old and lives in the town of Packwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Jane has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells tomatoes, cabbages and onions. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, onions and cabbage. This will help Jane to generate greater profits and educate her children. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to provide for the family. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more tomatoes, onions and cabbage

loans.name: Sharon's Group

texts.en:
Sharon's group is comprised of two hard working women. Sharon is eighteen years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer, soda and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks that will sold in the bar, and help Sharon to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the bar. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell in the bar

loans.name: Prahim

texts.en:
Prahim is 25 years old, a university student,  and an administrative assistant in an association.  He earns  $3 per day and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 

Prahim would like to request a loan to pay for his first-trimester tuition fee for his fourth year. This loan will help him to graduate. In the future, he is going to find a better job with a better salary.

loans.use: to pay for his first-trimester tuition fee.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda . She is a married woman with one child. She cares for additional family members. 

She has been in  business for 3 years and requests 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, and treatments.    She works  seven days a week. Her major business challenges include power shortages and customers who default on payments. 

She wishes to own a fully stocked bridal shop. She rents a house with access to electricity but not running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, and treatments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the walls of her home.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman with six children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business and earns additional income raising pigs.  Mercedes requests 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her food stall.

Mercedes has sustained her business  through 25 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Azraa

texts.en:
Azraa is twenty-eight years old and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in the public sector for many years and he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Azraa also provides sewing services and earns an income that she contributes to her husband's income, for managing the household.

For her business, she needs needles, thread, pieces of cloth and machine oil but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase them. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the items she needs and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profits because she will be able to provide better sewing services.

Azraa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy needles, thread, pieces of cloth and machine oil

loans.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
María, siente que es bien atendida en Padecomsm y que le brinda facilidades de pago, por lo que requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar nacazcol, barro crudo, arcilla y leña, contara con la materia prima para  continuar diversificando las piezas de loza que elabora.
Los efectos que ha tenido María en su negocio son muy positivos, pues tuvo el material necesario para cumplir con sus pedidos en menor tiempo, sus ganancias poco a poco están mejorando y ha pagado su deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Maria feels that she is well looked after by PADECOMSM and that it offers her good payment terms. She needs a new loan to buy nacazcol, raw clay, sandy clay, and firewood. She says that with the raw materials, she will be able to continue diversifying the pieces of pottery she makes.

The effects of a previous loan of her business were very positive, since she had the material need to satisfy her orders in less time. Her earnings are improving little by little, and she has paid the debt she has accumulated.

loans.use: to buy nacazcol, raw clay, sandy clay, and firewood, which are the raw materials she needs to continue diversifying the pieces of pottery she makes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Meet Robert. He is a thirty-one-year-old smallholder farmer from Tulwet village in the South Rift region of Kenya. Like most farmers in the region, Robert practises mixed farming.  He keeps dairy animals and grows tea among other crops. He has been doing this work for a decade now. 

Over the years, he has come to like farming because it is a sustainable and self-fulfilling investment. Farming doesn’t take all his time, so he is also able to attend to his salary-paying job. A delicate balance of both jobs has enabled him to comfortably raise his three children. 

Robert is seeking a loan to purchase poultry and construct a chicken coop. He is ready to get into commercial production for meat, eggs and, perhaps, feathers. This business is very profitable but it doesn’t require a licence, a big space or product marketing. There is an established market for poultry products in almost all places around the world.

Besides, chickens will bring many non-monetary benefits to Robert’s farm. Chickens will be great for his farm's compost because their poop is high in nitrogen; in free-range, they will naturally forage by scratching soil looking for bugs, which aerates the soil and breaks up vegetation for decomposition.

Robert will also use your money to construct a chicken coop in order to make the raising of chickens easier. By putting all the chickens in one place, he can feed them consistently, track each one of them easily and more easily manage and collect eggs and manure. The coop will contain water containers and laying boxes for the health, comfort and safety of the chickens. 

When Juhudi Kilimo’s loan officer asked Robert how his family will benefit from the loan, he replied, “they will benefit from the income I get once I acquire the loan and buy the asset.”

loans.use: to purchase poultry and construct a chicken coop

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона родилась и выросла в семье простого рабочего. Ее родители не имели возможности получить высшее образование и поэтому они всегда мечтали, чтобы их дочь Фарзона получила высшее образование. В этом году она окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Она поступила в факультет Финансы и кредит. Фарзона в средней школе училась успешно и в университете она проявляется себя уже неплохо. Фарзона запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Farzona was born and grew up in a family of workers. Her parents did not have the opportunity to get higher education and therefore they always dreamed of their daughter Farzona getting it. This year she finished high school and entered the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. She started at the faculty of Finance and Credit. 

Farzona studied well in high school and she is not doing badly in university either. Farzona requests a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 22 года. Она успешно окончила Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности Автоматизация Системы Управления. Гулноза получила диплом с отличными оценками. Теперь она хочет получить второе высшее образование и с такой целью она поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса в юридический факультет. Она очень умная девушка и хочет после окончания университета поступить на работу и служить своему народу. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulnoza is a hardworking girl. She is 22 years old. She successfully graduated from the Tajik State University of Politics and Business, specializing in automation of control systems. Gulnoza got a diploma with honors. 

Currently she would like to get a second degree and with this aim she entered the faculty of law at the Tajik State University of Politics and Business. She is a very smart girl, and when she graduates she would like to start working and serve her people. 

Gulnoza requests a loan to pay for tuition at the university. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат добрая женщина. Она родилась в 1966 году. Мухабат в 1990 году окончила Педагогический Университет по специальности преподаватель русского языка. Она в 2002 году получила бухгалтерское образование и поступила на работу преподавателем бухгалтерского учета в учебном центре. Она там работает до сегодняшнего дня. Мухабат замужем и имеет 3 детей. Она всегда заботится об образовании своих детей. Ее сын учится в 8 классе Турецкой школе. Мухабат каждый год оплачивает за учебу сына, но данное время она не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabat is a good woman. She was born in 1966. In 1990, Muhabat graduated from the Pedagogical University, as a Russian language teacher. In 2002 she received accounting education and began to work as an accounting teacher at a training center. She still works there.

Muhabat is married and has three children. She is always concerned about her children's upbringing. Her son is in 8 grade at the Turkish school. Every year Muhabat pays for the education of her son, however this time she does not have the money. She requests a loan to pay for her son's education. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old, married and has been blessed with two children.

She runs a retail store and corn farming business. Marites would like to keep her retail store profitable. That's the reason why she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP. It will allow her to buy volume stocks of grocery items such as canned goods, sugar, milk, cooking oil, assorted biscuits and ingredients. She knows that her requested loan amount will enable her to improve her financial stability and provide quality services to all her customers. 

She is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy volume stocks of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Louel

texts.en:
Louel resides at Gata Daku, Clarin with his family. He has earned his living by providing transportation services for four years. He also works as a security guard in a private company to earn additional income. 

He had  successfully repaid his previous loan which he used to purchase new tires. Louel took a new loan recently to pay motorcycle repair and maintenance costs.

His plan in the future is to  improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay motorcycle repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesús María tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, junto a sus menores hijos, la vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la crianza y comercio de ganado, además de la agricultura; dicha comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Jesús María es a la venta de plástico, loza y productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 1 año y medio, ella reparte su producto en toda la zona de Buenos Aires y entrega pedido, contando con experiencia en el negocio y conocida en la zona, con muy buenas referencias personales y crediticias. El destino del crédito será para la compra de plástico y loza, para así aumentar su stock y poder cumplir con todos los pedidos pendientes que tiene, esto a su vez le va ayudar a mejorar su calidad de atención lo que le permitirá captar nuevos clientes, mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por consecuente su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejorará.
texts.en:
Jesús María is 39 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in the district of Buenos Aires with her dependent children. Life in the community is quiet; people earn their livings by raising and selling livestock as well as by farming. The community is located in the province of Morropón, in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast.

The business that Jesús María runs is the sale of plastics, dishes, and beauty products, an activity that she has carried out for more than a year and a half. She distributes her goods throughout the Buenos Aires area and delivers orders. She has experience in the business and is well-known in the area, with many good personal and credit references. 

The loan is destined for the purchase of plastic and dishes to increase Jesús María's stock and fill all the outstanding orders that she has. This, in turn, is going to help improve the quality of her service, allowing her to attract new customers and have greater revenues and better profits, consequently improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase plastic and dishes to increase her stock and to be able to fill all her outstanding orders

loans.name: Anamarie

texts.en:
Her name is Anamarie, and she is a resident of Coron, Palawan City, Philippines. She is married to Louie, a driver, and has five children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Anamarie has a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Natasha, and Boardwalk. Dealers buy the products at a lower price than that shown in the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries, and undergarments for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.   

Anamarie aims to grow her business so she can send her children to the best school possible. She dreams that all of them will finish college and that they live a quiet life.  She faithfully meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise items and orders of clothing, bags, cosmetics, undergarments, and other direct-selling items.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is an experienced farmer living in the village of Griboyedov in the Ejmiatsin region. She lives with her husband and they are involved in agriculture. They own a greenhouse to grow tomatoes and greens. 

Tamara's husband helps her to  farm  and sells the harvest in the local markets. 

The requested loan of 1,500 USD will be used to purchase  a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse and fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.
 
This is Tamara's first loan and has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Tamara ensures that she will make payments on time and hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse, and fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with five children, all attend school. She has no additional family members. 

She has operated a home-based restaurant for 3 years. She has applied for 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy green bananas, flour, beans, beef, and cooking oil .  She works seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include changing weather conditions and transportation. She would like to buy a refrigerator to serve her customers better . 

She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, flour, beans, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 46-year-old Palestinian refugee.  He is  a married man with three children. He has operated a small restaurant specializing in traditional foods (beans and chick peas) since 1997.

Mahmoud is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort in developing his business in a well managed way. He is able to  cover his family's increasing needs. 

His specialty restaurant and business reputation is expanding and developing in a well managed way, so he decided to take the step forward and open another branch to increase his income and develop both his business and family's standard of living.

Mahmoud plans to continue developing his business to provide his family with a better living.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to establish a second restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children attend school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilou has had a fishing business for 5 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Wuilmer Alexis

texts.es: Wuilmer, tiene 31 años de edad, está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con su madre y dos hermanos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Iguala,  Lempira. Se dedica al cultivo de café, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 11 años, cultiva en terrenos agrícolas de la zona y vende el café despulpado y secado en el mercado local o intermediarios. Ha solicitado un préstamo por  28,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá  en la compra de abonos para dar asistencia a su finca de café y  mejorar su producción. Su plan es  seguir cultivando y crear su propio patrimonio.
texts.en: Wuilmer is 31 years old and single without children. He lives with his mother and two siblings in a community in the municipality of Iguala, Lempira. He cultivates coffee, which he has done for 11 years. He grows it on agricultural lank in this zone and he sells the pulped and dried coffee in the local market or to intermediaries. He has applies for a loan for 28,000 Lempiras, which he will use to purchase manure to help his coffee crops and improve his production. His plan is to continue cultivating coffee and create his own legacy.

loans.use: to buy manure to help his coffee harvest.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
Norma es una señora de 58 años de edad, no estudio debido a la situación económica en que vivía y por la distancia del centro educativo. Es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 40, 30, 28,25 y 24 años de edad, los cuales ya todos ellos están acompañados, por lo tanto ya no dependen de ella. Norma vive con una hija, sus nietos y su yerno. 

Norma se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar, pero viendo la necesidad económica que estaban pasando decidió dedicarse a la agricultura, ahora tiene 4 años de desempeñar ese oficio y lo aprendió de su madre quien siempre se dedico a esto, para llegar a su trabajo Norma viaja 1 ½ km en carro, trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm. Todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución de CREDICAMPO, es para comprar un repuesto para su vehículo, ya que con el vehículo saca a promocionar la cosecha de maíz.

Norma sueña con llegar a tener un terreno agrícola, comprar otro vehículo y ampliar y mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Norma is a 58 year old woman. Because of the financial situation she faced at the time and the distance it took to get to the nearest school, she was unable to attend school. She is a single mother to five children—aged 40, 30, 28, 25, and 24—all of whom are married and don’t depend on her. She lives with a daughter, her grandchildren, and her son-in-law.

Norma used to be a homemaker, but because of the financial situation they were facing, she decided to work in agriculture. She has been farming for four years now, and she learned this trade from her mother, who always worked as a farmer. Norma travels 1½ km by car to get to work. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 12 p.m. every day.

She is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO to purchase spare parts for her vehicle because she uses the vehicle to market the corn harvest. 

Norma dreams of having a piece of farmland, buy another car, and expand and improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her vehicle because she uses her vehicle to market the corn harvest.

loans.name: Roseline's Group

texts.en:
Roseline's group is comprised of  hard working women. Roseline is 22 years old and lives in the town of Packwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, both attend school. For the past 3 years, Roseline has worked hard to manage her fish vending business. 

Roseline requests 450,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to buy more fish.  This loan will help Roseline to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Roseline hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Roseline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is married with four children and has operated a fishing  business for more than fifteen years. The family business provides adequate earnings.

He is determined to send his children to school and provide a better education.  The family  works with love that they never  tire of working. 

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman and owns a house that has running water but not electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Masika has operated a tailoring business for 4 years and makes women's  and men suits. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

She will use the loan to purchase fabric and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan has his stall in the market. He is selling imported goods, like pants, shoes, shirts, and sandals. Jonathan is married and has two kids. His goals are to earn higher income, and to save some of it for the preparation of his children's education. Jonathan wants also to sell imported bags in the market, but he can’t pursue it because of financial constraints. Hence, Jonathan is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. He will use this amount to buy more shoes, clothes, sandals, and bags to sell. He is anticipating that by borrowing this loan amount, he will develop the business and get higher profits.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, clothes, sandals, and bags to sell.

loans.name: Jani's Group

texts.en:
Jani's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Jani is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki, in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jani has been working hard to manage her fish business, where she sells fresh fish.

To help expand her business, Jani has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. Her portion of this group loan will be used to purchase more fish for sale, and will help Jani to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Jani hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

Jani is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Tania Judith

texts.es: Tania es una estudiante universitaria que estudia Tecnología del vestido. Ella tiene 22 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Tania actualmente trabaja como costurera en un taller de costura de sus padres. El préstamo que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de una laptop y útiles de estudios. Su mayor deseo es seguir estudiando para obtener un título en diseño de moda para que pueda proporcionar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Tania está agradecido a los prestamistas de Kiva por el préstamo que se le ha proporcionado.
texts.en: Tania is a university student enrolled in Fashion Design. She is 22 years old, single and has no children. Tania currently works as a seamstress in her parent's sewing workshop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a laptop and study material. Her greatest dream is to continue to study and get a degree in Fashion design so that she can provide a higher quality of living for her family. Tania is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for granting her a loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop and study materials.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 65 year old man married to Grace who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with seven children.  

James has been operating a Butchery shop business for ten years, earning an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

James is now servicing his second loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use this amount to buy goats and sheep for slaughtering and to sell them to his customers on a daily basis.

James plans to use the anticipated income to open a retail shop which will be operated by one of his sons and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for slaughtering.

loans.name: Rocio Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rocío, vive con su esposo de 30 años de edad y sus hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad; por la necesidad de ofrecer una vida más confortable a su familia se decidió a fundar su propio negocio, el cual consiste en vender pupusas y diferentes antojitos como enchiladas, tostadas, etc., ya tiene un año de realizar esta actividad y lo hace todos los días por las tardes en la acera de su vivienda.
Necesita capital para comprar aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, harina, maíz y otros materiales para elaborar su venta, su negocio se mantendrá funcionando, de esta manera las ventas y ganancias serán más altas y responderá positivamente a sus compromisos.
Su visión es ampliar su negocio, seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Rocío is 30 years old and lives with her husband and her children ages 3 and 5 years old. Out of the need to provide a more comfortable life for her family she decided to found her own business. She sells pupusas and different snacks like enchiladas, tostadas etc. She has been doing this for one year, every day on the sidewalk in front of her house. She needs capital to buy oil, pork cracklings, cheese. flour corn and other materials to make her food. She will keep her business functioning and doing this her sales and profits will be greater so she can respond positively to her commitments. Her dream is to expand her business and continue to support her husband with the household expenses and own her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy oil, pork cracklings, cheese, flour, corn and other materials.

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en: Hello! Meet Zephaniah from Kapsowar, a rural town in Kenya with a hot and wet climate. Zephaniah is a mixed farmer with over five years of experience. He makes money selling milk, eggs, and vegetables produced on his farm. He also makes extra income by engaging in other personal businesses. He finds farming, especially dairy farming, to be enjoyable and profitable. The biggest challenge for all farmers in the region is the lack of a good road network. Poor roads make it hard for farmers to transport their produce to the market. Zephaniah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Milk prices in Kapsowar are always high and stable. Zephaniah is determined to acquire more cows and produce more milk. He is also breeding his cows with the assistance of an agricultural extension officer to ensure the calves inherit the most desirable traits from pedigree bulls. "Higher quality cows produce much more milk than regular ones. My dream is to own a couple of pedigree cows," Zephaniah said. With your loan, Zephaniah is going to improve his agribusiness and produce more milk. The extra income will be ploughed back into the business. In the long run, Zephaniah will be able to live an improved life, the life he never had growing up.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Ijevan town, with her two sons and her father-in-law. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country and works hard for sustaining his family financially.

Lusine asks this loan for university tuition of her elder son, Edik. He studies at university, in the Department of Architecture. The loan will greatly help Lusine to cover her son's university costs, and she hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay her son Edik's university tuition, toward his degree in architecture

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 30 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with one child. He does a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for four years. Right now, he makes a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle, and thereby expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In future, Cyrus hopes to expand his business and become the leading transporter in the area.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy is a hard-working woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill, in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Loy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells cooking oil, sanitary towels, sugar, and salt.

To help expand her business, Loy has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil, sanitary towels, sugar, and salt, and will help Loy to generate greater profits and improve her business. Loy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase extra-big machines.

Loy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sanitary towels, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Nubu

texts.en: Nubu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children. two of whom go to school.  She has additional family members. She sells used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.  She gets additional income from roasting maize. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenge includes seasonality.  She is aspiring to educate her children up to the university level.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is married with three children. She provides transportation services in her village with her husband as the operator.  The couple plans to improve their house while their children are still young. In the coming years, they are going to send them to college. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to cover the costs of motorcycle repair and maintenance. Chona wants to improve their business by adding a side car to their vehicle and improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Jeniffer Medalye

texts.es:
Jeniffer es una joven muy entusiasta y soñadora de 21 años, vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia. Es madre soltera de un pequeño niño, por diversas circunstancias tuvo que salir adelante sola, sin el apoyo del padre de su hijo, sin embargo se siente muy bendecida porque su familia la apoya de manera incondicional. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo abrir una pequeña tienda y tiene mucha acogida por sus clientes.
Jeniffer quiere tener la oportunidad de poder ampliar su negocio, es por ello que está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más productos para surtir su negocio, de esta manera tendrá más clientes y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 21 year old youth with lots of enthusiasm and dreams. She lives in San Juan de Lurigancho with her family. She is the single mother of a young child who for a variety of circumstances has to get ahead by herself without the help of the father of her son. Nevertheless she feels very blessed as her family supports her unconditionally.

With much effort she was able to open a small store and has been warmly accepted by her clients. Jeniffer wants to have the opportunity to expand her business. She is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the support they have given her so she can buy more products to stock her merchandise. Doing this she will have more clients and be able to provide a higher quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
Kadija is a hardworking 16-year-old who lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Kadija has been working hard to manage her charcoal sales business. 

To help expand her business, Kadija has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more charcoal; this will help her  to generate greater profits and sustain her business. Kadija hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business and buy a plot of land. 

Kadija is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se ha mantenido trabajando en la sastrería, el capital que anteriormente invirtió en materiales de costura, le han servido para elaborar las prendas de vestir a sus clientes con mejor calidad, su negocio ha ganado popularidad, cuenta con buenas ganancias y cancelo su deuda.
Para mantener su fuente de ingresos mejorando se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar telas, botones, hilos, agujas y repuestos para la máquina de coser, equipara el negocio para seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en: María continues to work as a seamstress. She used the capital of the last loan to invest in sewing materials with which she made better quality clothing for her clients. Her business has gained in popularity and she had good profits and paid off her loan. To continue to expand her revenues she has decided to request a new loan. She will buy fabric, buttons, thread, needles and parts for her sewing machine, to outfit her business to continue to provide a good service.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, thread, needles and parts for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
Irma, con ayuda del crédito anterior incremento el inventario de su negocio, su situación económica ha cambiado positivamente, da a su familia una mejor alimentación y vestuario.
Para seguir trabajando en la agricultura opta por solicitar más capital que utilizara para comprar ganado de repasto y concentrado para alimentarlos, fortalecerá su negocio y mantendrá un progreso continuo.
texts.en:
Irma, with the help of the previous loan, increased the inventory in her business.  Her financial situation has changed positively, and she gives her family better food and clothing.

In order to continue working in agriculture, she chooses to request more capital to use to buy livestock for the pasture and concentrated feed for them.  She will strengthen her business and maintain continual progress.

loans.use: to buy livestock and concentrated feed for them.

loans.name: Srey On's Group

texts.en: Srey On, 24 years old, is a farmer who lives in Kampong Speu province. To support her living, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland as the main source of income. Moreover, she plants peanuts and works as a construction worker to supplement her income. For Srey On, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. She will spend this loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's healthy living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Sema

texts.en:
Sema is a married mother of two. After finishing university, she worked at various jobs, but stopped after she got married. As an active person who likes to help people, have discussions and produce things, sitting at home didn’t suit her, so she worked for multi-level marketing companies while raising her children. She was successful, which gave her confidence. 

Sema then decided to start her own business, and chose to follow in her father’s footsteps, working with meerschaum. She processes meerschaum and designs jewelry. With this loan from Maya, she will buy more raw meerschaum to process and finish, thereby increasing her income. She wants to ensure a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw meerschaum

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Hope has been working hard to manage her fish vending where she sells fish.

To help expand her business, Hope has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more baskets of fish and will help Hope to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Hope hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Hope is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Filiz

texts.en:
One of her daughters is in high school and the other is in college. She has been running a small breakfast restaurant to add to the family income despite limited opportunities for many years. She has run it for a year and a half.  She makes homemade jams, pickles and sauces and serves breakfasts “like Mom used to make.” With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy a lot of fruits and vegetables when they’re in season and use them to make jams, pickles and sauces, increasing her sales. She contributes to the family’s income and the national economy and wants to prepare a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Filiz Hanım lise ve üniversitede okuyan İki kız çocuk annesi .  Uzun yıllar sonra aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için kısıtlı imkanlarınla küçük bir kahvaltı salonu açıyor. 1.5 yıl kadar işletmeyi çalıştırıyor .Ev yapımı reçel turşu ve soslar yapıyor .  Kahvaltı salonunda gelen müşterilerine anne lezzetinde kahvaltı veriyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile sezonda sebze ve meyvenin bol olduğu zamanda sebze ve meyvayı alarak reçel ,turşu ve soslar yaparak satışlarını artırmak istiyor . Aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shamilah

texts.en:
Shamila is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Shamila has been working hard to manage her snacks business, selling chapatti and doughnuts. 

To help expand her business, Shamila has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more baking flour, cooking oil, and salt, and will help Shamila to generate greater profits and personal development. Shamila hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her business and welfare. 

Shamila is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, cooking oil, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to help her coffee crops grow in this new season.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero, tiene 2 hijos, vive con sus hijos y su madre en una aldea del municipio de la Campa, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, lleva 7 años cultivando café el cual vende en oro en el mercado o a intermediarios de la zona. El  monto del  préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 lempiras, y  lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para obtener mejores cosechas de café. Su meta es sembrar una manzana mas de café.
texts.en:
Adrian, age 26, is single and has two children.  He lives with his children and mother in a village in the Campa municipality in Lempira.  He has always worked in agriculture growing basic grains.  For seven years he has been growing coffee.  He sells the coffee beans in the market or to intermediaries in the area.

The amount of the loan he is requesting is 25,000 lempiras.  He will use it to buy fertilizers to get better coffee harvests.  His goal is to plant a ‘manzana’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] more of coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en:
Robinah's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Robinah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past year, Robinah has been working hard to manage her flour business, selling cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Robinah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava flour to sell, and will help Robinah to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. Robinah hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand in the business and own other businesses. 

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
This is Chona, 51, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Felizardo, an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker), and they have two children who are now in College.
