She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet the family’s daily personal and household needs and for the education of her children.

Chona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, rice, cookies, school supplies, beverages and oil to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also has a small eatery where she sells packed meals for added income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, beverages, assorted candies and school supplies to expand her product inventory. She is positive that more items displayed at her store will mean more sales and income for her. She is also thanking God in advance for your great help.

Chona hopes to be able to grow her business and dreams that her two children will earn a college degree for them to have a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items like rice, canned goods, beverages, sugar, cookies, school supplies, oil and other items for her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, no tiene hijos dependientes, vive con su esposa, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Jorge se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas, desde hace 10 años en el distrito de Pucará, él solicita préstamo para invertir en la implementación de local e invertir en negocio de venta de cerveza comprando una mayor cantidad de mercadería (cerveza), Jorge posee conocimiento en el negocio y es muy conocido en la zona por esta labor, lo que en un corto plazo pueda aumentar sus ingresos y pueda mejorar su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 47 years old and lives in a common law marriage. He does not have dependent children. He lives with his wife in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.

For ten years, Jorge has earned his living selling beer and sodas in the district of Pucará. He is requesting the loan to invest in furnishing his shop and invest in his beer-sales business by buying bulk merchandise (beer). 

Jorge has business knowledge and is very well-known in the area for this work, which can increase his income before long and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to furnish his shop and invest in his beer-sales business by buying beer in bulk.

loans.name: Al Walaa Group

texts.en:
Zahra is the featured borrower of the Al Walaa group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends and they seek to develop their businesses and family's living conditions.

Zahra is a 39-year-old married lady who sells specially-made perfume scents in addition to mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards. She supports her husband in increasing their family's income to make sure that they can benefit from a secure living.

Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special newly-released mobile phone accessories and perfumes, in addition to mobile phone prepaid cards.

Zahra is the lady sitting on the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Khadija is the lady in the center, while Mariam is the lady on the right.

loans.use: To buy special newly-released mobile phone accessories, perfumes and mobile phone prepaid cards

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es:
Ascencion vive en casa propia de material rustico, cliente vive con su conyugue, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder, pero si un hijo de 24 años el cual le acompaña pero ya es independiente económicamente, Ascencion tiene 30 años radicando en la zona, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, la misma que esta ubicada en el distrio de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Ascencion es a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Ascencion lives in his own home made from rustic materials with his wife. Although none of his children are dependent, he has a 24-year-old son who lives with him but is economically independent. Ascencion has spent 30 years in the zone and he has good references, both personal and professional, in the community. He lives in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca in the mountains of northern Peru.

Ascencion is a farmer, specifically cultivating rice. He has 10 years of experience. He will use the loan to pay agricultural workers to apply and use plant protection products and fertilizers and to help with the harvest. In this manner, he will help his crop physically, morphologically, and  he will have a greater production, a higher quality product, and he will not have any problems selling his product.

loans.use: to pay agricultural workers to apply and use plant protection products and fertilizers and to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products at wholesale, such as perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para la maicillera, vitaminas para el ganado y repuesto para el taller de bicicletas, fortalecer su negocio, continuara desarrollando sus diferentes actividades económicas para mantener sus ingresos y cumplir con el pago de los gastos familiares y de sus deudas.
El efecto que ha tenido en al invertir el préstamo anterior en su negocio es positivo, ha establecido mejor el taller de bicicletas, ha podido resarcir su deuda y cubre las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José requests a new loan to buy agricultural inputs for his fields of sorghum, vitamins for livestock, and parts for his bicycle shop to strengthen his business and continue to develop his various business activities to maintain his income and meet the payments of his family's expenses and debts.

The effect of his previous loan used to invest in his business is positive. He has an established bicycle shop and has been able to repay his debt and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his bicycle shop

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 38-year-old woman and the mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is only responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shama's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. But due to his unfavourable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore, Shama has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 38 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with four children. He does a motorcycle transport business and this has been profitable. He currently makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He will be using this loan to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to save and buy another motorcycle.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya and in the future, he hopes to grow his transport business, make more income and own a car.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Radifa

texts.en:
Radifa is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Radifa has been working hard to manage her snacks business selling popcorn and groundnuts. 

To help expand her business, Radifa has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more popcorn and groundnuts and will help Radifa to generate greater profits and sustain her business. Radifa hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 

Radifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more popcorn and groundnuts

loans.name: Zuleyxa

texts.en:
Zuleyxa is a 53-year-old widow and she has five kids. Zuleyxa is an IDP person (internally displaced person) and she lives with her kids in Bilasuvar region. Twenty-four years ago, in a search for a source of income for her family, she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry. Thanks to her hard work, she has achieved great success in her business and now earns a monthly income of 250 AZN, with assets including three milking cows, 10 sheep and one hectare of land on which she grows cereal crops both for her own use and for sale. 

Zuleyxa sells organic milk, which is in high demand among local residents. Since demand is growing, she has turned to Aqroinvest CU for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy an additional milking cow as well as to build a barn for her livestock. She plans to use the profits from the loan to further develop her business and to buy a family car.

loans.use: to buy an additional milking cow

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, es acompañada, es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, viven todos juntos en un ambiente lleno de armonía; como una forma de tener ingresos económicos para apoyar a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su familia se dedica a elaborar tortillas para vender, su producto lo distribuye entre los vecinos de la colonia en la que vive, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero.
Para ubicar mejor su negocio se ha decidido a solicitar capital para comprar láminas, madera y clavos para construir un corredor en el que atenderá mejor a sus clientes y poder elaborar la venta de tortillas en un lugar más adecuado e higiénico, así su productividad será mejor y las nuevas ganancias le servirán para pagar las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
María anhela mantenerse trabajando hasta lograr que sus hijos se superen académicamente y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María is in a relationship. She is the mother of two children aged 18 and 15 years old, living all together in a room full of harmony. As a way to have an income to help her life partner and the expenses of the family, she makes tortillas to sell. She sells her product among the residents of the neighborhood where she lives. She receives no remittances from abroad.

To improve her business location, she has decided to seek a loan to buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails to build a room in which she can better serve her customers and make her tortilla sales in a more suitable and hygienic place. Her productivity will be better and her new profits will serve to pay her loan repayments.

María longs to keep working to help her children succeed academically and have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a place of business to sell tortillas

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Ella es Maritza, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de venta de tintos, cigarrillos y frituras de manera ambulante desde hace aproximadamente 5 años. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica con la necesidad de obtener recursos para el cuidado y sostenimiento de su familia.

Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, siempre en busca de una mejor vida familiar y económica.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar un coche nuevo para transportar sus mercancías ya que el que tiene actualmente está en muy mal estado, adicionalmente desea comprar surtido de cigarrillos y frituras para abastecer su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.

Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Maritza. She is a woman of character and good will who wants to progress and move forward with her husband and two children. She decided to start her business selling coffee, cigarettes, and fried foods about five years ago.

She learned her work from observation because of the need for resources to care for and support her family. She has always been known as a hardworking woman, always looking for better family and economic life. 

Today, she wants to give a small boost to her business, therefore, she requires a loan to buy a new cart to transport her goods and the one she has currently is in very poor condition. She additionally want to buy an assortment of cigarettes and fried foods to supply her business and improve her sales. 

She is a woman who bravely faces her challenges.

loans.use: to purchase a new cart

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married with two children, works as a teacher, and does daily tutoring to make a living. She earns a better income for the family and is able to support her children. 

Her previous loan, used for buying tutoring materials, has been fully paid successfully. She took a new loan recently to pay the school tuition fees for her child. 

She always finds ways to improve their situation. In the future, she wants to buy a motorcycle to use for her transportation.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her child

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a hardworking woman. Agness is 20 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Agness has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Agness has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy groundnuts and corn seeds, and will help Agness to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Agness hopes that in the future she will be able to move into a bigger business. 

Agness is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy groundnuts and corn seeds

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Julia has decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Amparo Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante su vida y a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad. 

Amparo es madre soltera cabeza de hogar debido a que es viuda desde hace un tiempo y esto ha hecho que su situación económica sea muy difícil, pero con su negocio ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante. 

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender mercancía como ropa, calzado y accesorios para vestir.

Actualmente Amparo tiene unos cuantos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con capital para surtir su negocio, busca un préstamo para abastecer su inventario y poder mejorar sus ventas y cubrir los pedidos pendientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking person who has managed to work through life and provide an education of good quality to her son through her daily efforts. Amparo is a single mother and head of household because she is a widow. For some time, this has made her economic situation very difficult but with her business and great strength she has been able to get ahead. She started selling merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and accessories a long time ago.

Currently, Amparo has a few orders from customers. Because she does not have capital for her business, she is seeking a loan to stock her inventory and to improve her sales and meet pending orders. 

Her dream is to move forward with her business and be able to offer her son a good quality of life and improved economic stability.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing and more to meet pending orders

loans.name: Andrea Isabel

texts.es:
Andrea desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco margarita empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene una hija de 11 años por la cual ha tenido que responder durante 10 años sola ya que el padre de la niña las abandonó cuando era apenas una bebe.

Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora.

Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar una maquina plana y así poder aumentar su volumen de producción, al mismo tiempo que ofrece un empleo.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande.
texts.en:
From an early age, Andrea has learned the craft of making clothes from her mother who was a clothing manufacture her entire life. That's how she began slowly to understand and apply this knowledge.

She has an 11-year-old daughter that she has been solely responsible for for 10 years because the girl's father abandoned them when she was just a baby. She is an entrepreneurial, loving woman who is always ready to serve her customers better. 

She feels very grateful to all that she has been able to accomplish so far. She asks for financial support to buy a sewing machine to be able to increase her production volume and offer employment. She has high hopes for her business and has a dream of a much larger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
This is Purita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and supplies needed in her welding shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and supplies and keep up the maintenance of her shop. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Purita dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to grow and expand her welding shop. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional welding equipment and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 19-year-old single man who has been working in the construction business for the last four years. Moustafa quit school during the Intermediate stages to find himself and his father responsible for the living of the other five members of his family.

He is a hard worker who is well known in his region for his good reputation. He is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start his own charcoal trade business, since his family's needs are increasing and his current business income isn't enough to cover their increasing living needs and requests.

He hopes that his income from the new business will lead him to open a wholesale business and cover a wider region.

loans.use: To start his own charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur is married with three children. She and her husband have a ceramics and meerschaum business. She began making meerschaum items at home to sell many years ago. For 16 years, she has sold from her home and on the Internet. 

A year and a half ago, she opened a shop. As tourism in the city increased over the past few years, it helped their sales. Their family brand is slowly starting to be recognized abroad. With this loan, she will buy raw meerschaum. She is contributing to the family income and the national economy, and wants to ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff 

Aynur Hanım  evli üç çocuk annesi .  Eşiyle beraber seramik ,lüle taşı ile işiyle uğraşıyor.  lüle taşı işine ilk önceleri evden üretip ve satarak başlıyor .  16 yıl evden ve internetten satarak devam ediyor.  Geçimini böyle sağlıyor.  1.5 yıl evvel dükkan açıyor.  Son yıllarda turizminde gelişmeye başlamasıyla satışlarıda olmaya başlamış .  Markalarını yavaş yavaş yurt dışına duyurmaya başlamış.Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile lületaşı hammadde alacak. Aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor .

loans.use: to buy raw meerschaum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products and to pay for manual labor in order to support her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This entrepreneur's name is Nida. She is a widow, 58 years old, and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She has four children: one is in college, one in high school, and two in elementary school. She works hard to meet their daily household needs and to pay for the schooling of her children. She has fully dedicated herself to rearing her children.

Nida makes and sells native cakes called "puto" in our language. This a popular and favourite snack and dessert of Filipinos. She sells it per order and on demand for special occasions and holidays. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan, which she will use to buy raw ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar, and coconut milk. She is positive that she will have a good return on her investment. She believes that with this financial assistance, her sales and earnings will increase. She is thanking God in advance for your great help.

Nida dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the education of her children so they can have a bright future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week in a setting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like all-purpose flour, baking soda, sugar, lehiya, cheese and coconut for her native cake business.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le 13 Février 2010 est composé de cinq membres qui habitent le même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Oumou Khayri à droit de la photo est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq  enfants dont quatre filles et un garçon tous scolarisés. 
Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus et de chaussures depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience.
Son nouveau crédit  de 500000 lui permettra de se payer 15 paires de chaussures ; 4 rouleaux de voiles a 18000f l'un;2 rouleaux de brodé a 44000.
Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son activité et d'aider son marie dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on February 13, 2010. 
Its four members live in the same neighborhood and share healthy social and professional bonds. 
Mrs Oumou Khayri, on the right hand side of the photo, is the group representative. She is 37. She is married and has five children, four girls and one boy, who all go to school. 
She has been in the business of shoes and fabric for a long time and has great experience in this field. This new loan of 500,000F will enable her to buy 15 pairs of shoes, four rolls of cloth, which cost 18,000F each, and two rolls of embroidered fabric for 44,000F. The profits will enable her to strengthen her business and help her husband take care of their family.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and pairs of shoes in order to generate an income

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Diana has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which also sells bed sheets. 

To help expand her business, Diana has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bed sheets and will help Diana to generate greater profits and personal development. Diana hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her business. 

Diana is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a hardworking woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past year, Shamim has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, in which she sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and improve on her business. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on her business and have a good future. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou, fait parti des premiers clients de l’IMCEC et elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. Elle travaillait avec son propre argent. Actuellement, elle vient solliciter une somme de 200 000F CFA pour augmenter son fond de roulement. Fatou vend de la viande de bœuf dans le marché du quartier, métier qu’elle fait depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est active le matin jusqu’à 14h et l’après midi, elle se repose. Avec le crédit, elle veut acheter un bœuf pour l’abattre et revendre la viande.
Fatou est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont son ainé, âgé de 35 ans. Concernant les charges, elle s’occupe du petit déjeuner et ce sont ses enfants qui s’occupent des autres dépenses de la maison.
Madame Fatou trouvant son activité un peu lourde pour son âge actuel, aimerait diversifier et changer d’activité : voyager pour aller à Doubaï acheter de la marchandise et venir revendre au pays. Cela n’empêchera pas que l’activité de vente de viande va continuer et va être pris en charge par ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou is one of IMCEC's first customers and she hasn't received a loan so far. She has been working with her own money. She is currently asking for a 200 000F CFA loan in order to increase her working capital. Fatou has been selling beef at the local market for over 20 years. She works in the morning until 2 p.m. and rests in the afternoon. With this loan, she will buy a cow for slaughter and will resell its meat. 
Fatou is married and has eight children. The eldest is 35. As far as expenses go, she is in charge of breakfast. Her children take care of other household-related expenses. 
Given her age, Mrs. Fatou is starting to find her activity rather strenuous and would like to diversify it by traveling to Dubai to buy goods she would resell back home. That said, her beef selling business wouldn't stop, as it would be taken over by her children.

loans.use: to buy beef for resale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a hard working woman. Shamim is 18 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials, and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and improve on her business. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to become a well-known tailor. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Twizigirane Group

texts.fr:
Rosalie fait partie du groupe  Twizigirane et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée à Sylvestre ,un militaire. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 7 à 9ans,tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz  depuis  12 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  du riz  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rosalie is part of the Twizigirane group and lives in Gitega. She is 30 and is married to Sylvestre, a soldier. They have three children, between the ages of 7 and 9, who all go to school.

She has been selling rice for 12 years.

This is her sixth loan with Turame. With this loan from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy rice which she will resell to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy rice which she will resell to earn more.

loans.name: Tugwizumwimbu Group

texts.fr:
Honorate  fait partie du groupe  Tugwizumwimbu et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 45 ans et est mariée à Martin ,un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 9 à 28 ans,dont 6 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants ,membres de sa famille élargie, qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce du riz, du haricot et de l'huile de palme  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de haricot,et d 'huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle ,et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Honorate is part of the Tugwizumwimbu group and lives in Gitega. She is 45 and is married to Martin, a shopkeeper. They have seven children, aged 9 to 28, six of whom go to school. 
She has two additional dependent children, members of her extended family, who go to school.
She has been buying and selling rice, beans, and palm oil for six years.
This is her sixth loan with Turame. With this loan from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice, beans, and plam oil, which she will resell to earn more.
In the years to come, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children further their education.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large amount of rice, beans, and plam oil.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
María, posee un cibercafé, es casada, junto a su esposo tienen tres hijos, de los cuales una está estudiando en la universidad y los otros dos estudian en la primaria, todos viven juntos, no tienen ayuda económica del extranjero, por esfuerzos personales han ido progresando. El negocio ha sido establecido con el fin de generar ingresos para mejorar la estabilidad económica y ayudar a las personas que necesitan buscar información, por el momento cuenta con 7 computadoras en el negocio.
Con el préstamo comprara teclados, monitores, bocinas, memorias, mouse, etc., para actualizar parte del equipo y tener un negocio competitivo que le genera más ingresos, espera tener resultados positivos con dicha inversión.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable, cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien en la Universidad.
texts.en:
María owns an internet cafe. She's married and has three children with her husband, of whom one is studying in university and the others are in primary school. 

She has no outside economic help, and has progressed through her own efforts. Her business was established with a goal of generating income to improve her economic stability and help people who need to look for information. Right now, she has seven computers in the business.

With the loan, she will buy keyboards, monitors, speakers, memory, mouse, etc., to upgrade her equipment and have a competitive business that earns her better income. She hopes to have positive results with this investment.

She dreams of having a more profitable business, covering her family's basic needs and supporting her children so they study in the university.

loans.use: buy keyboards, monitors, speakers, memory, mouse, etc., to upgrade equipment and have a competitive business.

loans.name: Wend La Malgda Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAMOUNA représente le groupe WEND LA  MALGDA. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 29ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales  depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs de 100kg de maïs.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Mme ambitionne  ouvrir un magasin de céréales et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. MAMOUNA is the representative of the WEND LA MALGDA group. She is healthy. She is a married mother of  and seven children, aged 12 to 29, three of whom go to school. She supports five people. 
Mrs. MAMOUNA has been selling grains for twelve years. She buys her stock at the local market. 
She wants to buy six 100-kg sacks of maize. With the profits, she plans on saving. Mrs. MAMOUNA's goal is to open a cereal shop and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy six 100-kg sacks of maize.

loans.name: Silver

texts.es:
Silver vive en el departamento de Cochabamba – Bolivia, nació en el centro minero de Huanuni ubicado en el departamento de Oruro y es el menor de 9 hijos, su padre falleció en un accidente en la mina cuando él tenía meses de nacido y su mamá quien era ama de casa, falleció hace 7 meses. 
Silver es Licenciado en Filosofía y se estaba preparando para ser sacerdote pero sintió que no era suficiente pues su verdadera vocación era ayudar a los demás de una manera más tangible y concreta, por lo que inicio su labor trabajando en un centro de apoyo pedagógico para niños necesitados. 
Silver nos comenta que los ingresos de su familia solo alcanzan para cubrir los gastos mensuales, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para lograr culminar sus estudios en la carrera de Ingeniería Ambiental y así cumplir uno de sus sueños que es optar a un buen trabajo para ayudar económicamente en su hogar y finalmente considera que con los nuevos conocimientos adquiridos podrá ayudar a mejorar la vida de los habitantes de Huaninu, su pueblo natal, para que dejen de sufrir por los desechos que genera la mina. 
Silver agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán terminar sus estudios y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Silver lives in the Cochabamba department of Bolivia. He was born in the mining venter of Huanuni, located in the Oruro department. 

He's the oldest of nine children. His father died in a mine accident when he was a few months old, and his mother, who was a housewife, died seven months ago.

Silver has a degree in philosophy and was preparing to be a priest, but he felt it was not enough. His true calling was to help people in a more tangible and concrete way, so he began his work in a learning support center for needy children.

Silver told us that his family's income is only enough to cover monthly expenses. Because of this, he's seeking an education loan to be able to finish his studies for an environmental engineering degree, and thus achieve one of his dreams - to choose a good field of work to be able to help economically in his household. 

He finally believes that his new knowledge can help improve the lives of the inhabitants of Huanuni, his hometown, to stop suffering for the waste generated by the mine.

Silver thanks the people who, through their economic resources, will allow him to finish his studies and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for a degree in environmental engineering.

loans.name: Maria Yanira

texts.es: Maria de 36 años  de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace  de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 36 years old, lives in her own home with her family. She earns a living selling clothing, traveling through the different developments found near her home. 

With what she earns from her sales, she successfully covers some household expenses. Maria is seeking a loan to buy more clothing in bulk to continue her sales and thus earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Silvia, vive junto a su compañero de vida, una hija y su madre, ambos se dedican a trabajar para cubrir las necesidades de su familia y dar a su hija el apoyo necesario para tener un mejor futuro; Silvia se dedica a vender verduras y lo realiza en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., el oficio lo aprendió de su padre, actualmente no representa dificultades en su negocio.
El capital que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de chiles, tomates, papas, yuca, lechugas y otras verduras que le ayuden a mejorar el inventario para satisfacer a sus clientes, de esta manera atraerá nuevos clientes y sus demandas serán mayores generándole mejores ingresos.
Silvia desea ampliar su negocio hasta lograr vender verduras para distribuirlas al por mayor y de esa manera mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her partner, her daughter, and her mother. Both work to cover the family's necessities and to give their daughter the support she needs to have a better future. Silvia sells vegetables from 7:00am to 4:00pm. She learned the business from her father. Currently the business isn't confronting any challenges.

The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, cassava, lettuce, and other vegetables that will improve her inventory and satisfy her clients. In this way she will atrract new customers and their demand will be greater, generating more income for her.

Silvia wants to grow her business until she can distribute as a wholesaler and thereby improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, cassava, lettuce, and other vegetables that will improve her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy satin materials and cotton materials to make dresses, skirt suits, and trouser suits for her customers.

loans.name: Mirtala

texts.es:
Mirtala, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito que le ayudara a fortalecer la venta de tacos, comprara carne, tomates, cebolla, aceite, tortillas y dará mantenimiento al coche en el que elabora la venta, seguirá trabajando y mejorando su situación económica.
Con la inversión anterior Mirtala ha podido tener su negocio activo, cuenta con más clientes satisfechos, mantiene un buen record crediticio y su familia le apoya en elaborar la venta, ya que ha enseñado a sus hijos todo lo referente al negocio.
texts.en: Mirtala has decided to request another loan which will help her strengthen her taco sales. She will buy meat. tomatoes, onions, oil, tortillas and do maintenance on her sales cart to continue working and improving her economic situation. With the last loan Mirtala was able to keep her business active, have more satisfied customers and maintain her good credit history. Her family helped her in making her sales as she has taught her children everything to do with the business.

loans.use: to buy meat. tomatoes, onions, oil, tortillas and do maintenance on her sales cart.

loans.name: Carla Yessica

texts.es:
Carla es una joven de 19 años, nació en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia, vive con su mamá y su hermano de 9 años. 

Actualmente Carla trabaja como Secretaria Administrativa en una empresa de servicios, los ingresos que obtiene solo alcanzan a cubrir sus gastos personales y ayuda en la manutención de su hogar, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poder financiar sus estudios en la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial en la Universidad Privada Cumbre, ella escogió esta carrera pues le interesa todo lo relacionado con el estudio de mercado y la parte comercial de las empresas y en un futuro se ve trabajando en una empresa de gran prestigio donde podrá  aplicar los conocimientos que adquirirá en la universidad.

Carla se considera una persona muy perseverante para hacer realidad lo que se propone ya que ningún obstáculo que se le aparezca le impedirá llegar a la meta que se ha trazado para alcanzar sus sueños. 

Carla se siente muy honrada y agradecida por aquellas personas que a través de sus recursos económicos le permitirán cumplir sus sueños y está plenamente convencida que todo lo que uno hace por el bien del prójimo Dios le devuelve el doble.
texts.en:
Carla is a 19-year-old young woman. She was born in the Andrés Ibáñez de Santa Cruz de la Sierra province of Bolivia, and lives with her mother and 9-year-old brother.

Currently, Carla works as an administrative secretary in a service business. The income she earns only cover her personal expenses and help with the maintenance of her home, which is why she's seeking an education loan to be able to pay for her studies for a business engineering degree at the Universidad Privada Cumbre.

She chose this career because she's interested in everything related to the study of markets and the commercial part of businesses. In the future, she sees herself working in a prestigious business where she'll be able to apply the knowledge she'll learn in university.

Carla is considered to be a very persevering person to be able to realize what she intends to do. No obstacle that appears will prevent her from reaching the goal she has set to achieve her dreams. 

Carls feels very honored and grateful for the people who, through their economic resources, will allow her to achieve her dreams. She is fully convinced that whatever you do for the good of others God gives back double.

loans.use: to pay for a business engineering degree.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 63 years old and married. She has a grocery business which she has been running for the past 33 years. Her spouse provides additional income and together they have been blessed with 3 children who are now adults. Right now her current monthly income is KES 11,000.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of fruits such as bananas, mangoes and oranges. She will also buy tomatoes, onions and vegetables. She will use the anticipated profits to build her house.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes and dreams are to be successful in her business and live a good prestigious life in her old age.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Anita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 25,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Anita hopes to have expansions to her variety store. She only desires to be always healthy and fit to work so that she can sustain their everyday needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias exitosas una de ellas es Marlene mujer de 67 años de edad, es viuda y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace nueve años en su comunidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de camisas, shores, jean, vestidos etc. Blanca tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida y Zeneyda  tiene 35 años de edad también se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en: The group is made up of three successful members. One of them is Marlene, a woman who is 67 years old and a widow. Her business for the past nine years has been selling used clothing in her community. She will use the loan to buy bales of t-shirts, shorts, jeans, dresses, etc. Blanca is 47 years old and her business is selling food. Zeneyda is 35 years old and she also sells food.

loans.use: to buy bales of t-shirts, shorts, jeans, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines.  She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 13 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income. Several months ago, their fishing business was affected when Typhoon Haiyan hit the country and ruined several houses and businesses. As of now, Bella is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets. Bella believes that this loan could help them improve their business, as well as their income. Bella plans to save enough money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase spare parts and supplies needed for her welding shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and supplies and for the maintenance of her shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedes still hopes to improve and increase her profits from the business for she wants to give the best education for her child. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and supplies needed for her welding shop business.

loans.name: Rosevilla

texts.en:
Rosevilla is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 11 years. This is their main source of income. Late last year, a super typhoon hit their place and ruined most of the houses and businesses including Rosevilla’s. With this, their fishing business was affected resulting to a decrease in income.

Now Rosevilla is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, crab cages, hooks and other items. With this loan, her husband will be able to go back to fishing to earn an income. In the future, Rosevilla hopes to make their fishing business a success. In addition, she wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, crab cages, hooks and other items

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 68-years-old and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. Sargis has worked for many years at Vnadzor city’s shoe fabric as a senior specialist, but in the last few years he established a small business of his own.  He changed his garage to a small workshop where he takes orders of making shoes and he also repairs them.  

His son's family lives with him and his wife.  Their daughter is married and she lives separately with her family. Sargis’ son now is in the Russian Federation and from there he sends money for his family's needs. Sargis also does his best to earn for his family's living. This time he wants to help his son with the repayment of his granddaughter’s tuition fees. She studies at the paid division of Yerevan State University at the faculty of International Relations.

Sargis will be greatly happy to have this loan in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to pay his granddaughter’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay his granddaughter’s tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María, es propietaria de una tienda de productos varios y cosméticos por medio de catálogo, es casada, tiene tres hijos; su negocio fue fundado hace 6 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00 p.m. a 7:00 p.m., aprendió a desempeñar esta actividad junto a su mamá, ella atiende sola su negocio, ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes establecidos.
Considera que necesita mejorar el inventario de su negocio por lo que se decidió a solicitar un préstamo para comprar lácteos, embutidos, bebidas, boquitas, dulces, huevos, etc., así tendrá nuevos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, espera ganar mayor popularidad, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
Sus sueños son ampliar poco a poco su negocio, lograr tener ingresos más estables para cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Maria is the owner of a store selling various goods as well as cosmetics through catalog sales.

She is married and has three children. Her business was established six years ago, she works daily from 6am to 7pm, she learned this work next to her mother. She now runs the store by herself since she has a steady customer base. 

She is thinking of enhancing the inventory and decided to request a loan. She will buy dairy products, cold cuts, drinks, snacks, sweets, eggs, etc. to have new products to offer her clients. She hopes to gain more popularity and thus increase her sales and earnings.

She dreams of expanding her business little by little, attaining better income stability to pay off her debts, and giving her family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, cold cuts, drinks, snacks, sweets, eggs, etc., and thus have new products to offer her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime, propane and bags to have raw materials to keep working.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 47-year-old married mother of three who has been running her convenience store since 2004 to help and support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs.

Aliya is a hard worker who puts very much effort in meeting her children's needs. Unfortunately, her business income isn't enough to cover her family's increasing needs and the necessary business development needs. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a special car for transporting business merchandise easily from the market. This will save time and money at the same time and it won't be obligatory to wait for a cash van to pass by her village in order to buy the out-of-stock merchandise she needs.

Aliya is hoping that in the future, she'll be capable of buying her own shop and increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy a special car for transporting her business merchandise easily from the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise chickens

loans.name: Dancy

texts.en: Dancy is a fish vendor from Iloilo, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Dancy has been in the fish vending business for more than 7 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. Late last year, Dancy’s business was affected when a super typhoon hit the country.  As of now, she and her husband have just started to rebuild their fishing business again. She is requesting a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights and hooks for her husband’s fishing.  With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus allowing Dancy to sell more fish at the market. In the future, Dancy hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights and hooks for her husband’s fishing

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 54-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and six children. Despite bad circumstances, Leila puts forth great effort in cooperation with her husband to be able to satisfy the family’s demands. She owns a grocery store where she sells dairy and daily products. And today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase food provisions to increase her business sales as well as her income.  Leila is an optimistic person always aiming for the best and plans to receive more Kiva loans with the coming days to keep improving her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions

loans.name: Vivian Rocio

texts.es: Vivian de 33 años de edad desde hace varios años posee en su lugar de residencia una pequeña tienda donde vende diferentes productos como: golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, sopas, etc. posee mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos para surtir su tienda y así poder generar mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vivian is 33 years old. For several years, she has had in her home a small store where she sells different products, such as: sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, soups, etc. She has many customers because of her good prices and her friendly sales manner. She is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock her store, so she can generate a better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, basic grains, soups, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Garut, a town in the West Java province of Indonesia and the capital of the Garut Regency, also known as the ‘Swiss van Java’ in the colonial era. Eva’s husband is an employee in a private company. As a housewife, Eva contributes to the family's income by running a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, consumer products such as groceries, personal care and home care products, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

Eva joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to expand her business. She feels comfortable doing business with Ruma because she is starting to see improvements in her small stall after she got support and assistance from Ruma staff. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more airtime transactions in her community on the weekends. Eva is pictured in the photo standing in front of her small stall and holding up Ruma banner. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes to sale.

loans.name: Salini

texts.en:
Salini is married and has seven children, two of whom attend school and the others are grown ups. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit sends her sincere greetings to Kiva lenders and greatly thanks them for her two previous loans, since both of them helped her to pay her daughter’s tuition fee. Anahit greatly wants to continue her partnership with Kiva. She lives with her nice family in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Anahit works as an accountant simultaneously in two places and her husband is still in his previous work (at the flour mill plant as the head of production). Their daughter is still a student of Yerevan State University in the faculty of Romance and Germanic philology. In the future, she hopes to be a translator of English and French Languages.

So this loan again, in the amount of 200.000 Armenian drams, will be of great help to Anahit’s family and she will manage to pay her daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.en: Melquiades is a fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is a married man and has a two year old child. Melquiades has been in this business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income. Several months ago, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined thousands of houses and businesses, including Melquiades’ fishing boat. As of now, he is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine for his fishing boat and new fishing nets. With this, Melquiades will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell at the market. Melquiades hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine for his fishing boat and new fishing nets

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en:
Garegin is 29-years-old. He lives in Kapan city of the Syunik region. He is married and has two sons who are still small and they go kindergarten.  Garegin has a vocational education and he has become a skilled and great master of welding. For many years, Garegin worked by order and he did not have a constant income, but since 2007 he has worked at the Kapan city’s combine as a welder. Thanks to his professionalism, he is one of the best specialists at the combine. So his good income allowed him to do some saving and he managed to repair his house, but now he does not have enough money for furnishings

Garegin asks for a loan of 250, 000 Armenian drams in order to buy new furniture for his kitchen which his wife wants so much.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his kitchen

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a housewife with 5 children.  She is married to a welder who manufactures iron furniture.  She requires a loan to help her husband buy the iron rods essential for assembling iron beds and chairs.  Zarina can fulfill her aim of getting her children educated once her husband's business is operational with a constant inflow of income.Therefore, the loan is crucial for the well being of her family.

loans.use: To help her husband buy iron rods to manufacture

loans.name: Biswa Maa Kandhuni Budhi Shg Group

texts.en:
Sujata is a 28-year-old lady living with her mother, sister, brother, and one child. Sujata lives separately from her husband due to some personal reasons. Sujata is an active woman having good rapport with her neighbors. She does not want to be a burden on her mother's family. She started a general store in her village with the support of her sister and her brother who is a daily laborer. She sells biscuits, cakes, wafers, chocolates, etc. and she wants to add a variety of items like pens, notebooks, pencils, rice, lentils, etc. There is no other general store in her village and the demand for the items is great but she is not able to get the products due to her poor financial condition. 

Sujata, along with her group, applied for a loan of 80,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase the above products for her general store. She says that if she adds a variety of items, then she can meet the customer's demand and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase pens, notebooks, pencils, rice, and lentils for her general store

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 61-year-old married Palestinian refugee. Due to the low financial and social situation of her husband who works in a scrap metal business, she decided fourteen years ago to start working in selling lingerie and special occasion dresses to help cover the expenses and needs of her family.

Today, Alia is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released fashionable clothes especially for the upcoming autumn season. She hopes to increase her income in order to open her own special occasion dress shop.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released fashionable clothes especially for the upcoming autumn season

loans.name: Masha

texts.en:
Masha is a married woman. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Masha dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat  maize, beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik and her husband are dentists. Near the house where they live, they own a small room where they make different ceramic dentures for dental clinics. The work that they are doing is very important for local clinics. 

Because of the lack of financial resources, Astghik and her husband have to take the dentures to Yerevan, and organize the heating there, which requires many costs (transportation, service, etc.). The requested loan is very important for this pair to purchase a new ceramic heater and organize the heating of the dentures themselves. 

Astghik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  Astghik hopes for lenders' support and goodwill for funding her loan and giving her an opportunity to enlarge her work.

loans.use: to pay for a ceramic heater to make dentures from ceramics

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 43 years old. She is married with five children aged between three and eighteen, with four of them in school. She has been selling beans for seven years. With the loan she would like to buy more beans for sale. The profits from her business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits to sell at the port.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality.  She aspires to open a boutique selling different kinds of used commodities.   She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Wenniebeth

texts.en: Wenniebeth is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 17 years now. This is the source of their income. Wenniebeth is asking for a loan to buy more fishing nets. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Wenniebeth hopes to improve their fishing business and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, se ha decidido por un nuevo  préstamo, por que ve en ellos una herramienta de trabajo para mejorar sus condiciones económicas, se comprará insumos agrícolas y pagara mano de obra, para realizar el cultivo de maíz.
Con el financiamiento anterior logro tener una cosecha abundante, ha mejorado estabilizarse económicamente, así como también tiene una mejor calidad de vida junto  a su familia.
texts.en:
Mateo has decided to take out a new loan because he sees in them a tool for work to improve his economic conditions. He will buy agricultural inputs and will pay for labor so he can plant corn.

With the previous loan, he was able to have an abundant harvest. His economic situation has stabilized and he has a better quality of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for labor so he can plant corn.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of three adult children from Iloilo, Philippines.  She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a fisherman. Late last year her business was ruined when a super typhoon hit their place. Nida is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, and beverages, sugar, cooking oil, vinegar, etc. Nida hopes that this loan could help her improve her stocks which will attract more buyers. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, and beverages, sugar, cooking oil, vinegar,  etc.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bananas for sale. 

She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. Madina's target is to diversify to selling fruits and vegetables so as to increase her profits.  

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is a 38-year-old fisherman from Iloilo, Philippines. He is a married man with three children. Melvin has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Melvin’s fishing boat was damaged when a super typhoon hit his place several months ago. This resulted in a decrease in his income. As of now, Melvin has just started to rebuild and is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks, and to pay for the repair of his fishing boat. 

With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Melvin also wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks, and to pay for the repair of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Henry Hernan

texts.es:
Henry de 25 años de edad, es vendedor, esta acompañado, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, que viven y depende de él, junto a su esposa. 

Henry estudio hasta septimo grado de básica, su epsosa se dedica a los oficios domesticos. Henry trabaja con ganado de repasto lo ha hecho por un año y lo aprendio de su padre y decidio hacerlo para ir obtando por un patrimonio mejor, tambien trabaja la agricultura, y en ocasiones trabaja como ayudante de albañil.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ganado de repasto, porque tendra mas ganado y por lo tanto mayores  ganancias y asi poder superar algunas limitantes economicas. 

sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda, para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Henry is 25 years old and is a merchant. He lives with his wife and has two young sons who live with him and are dependent on him, along with his wife.

Henry studied until seventh grade. His wife works in the home. Henry works with cattle that he's raising and fattening on grass. He has done this for one year and he learned it from his father. He decided to do this in order to build a better future. He also works in agriculture, and he sometimes works as a bricklayer's assistent.

The loan that he's requesting from Credicampo is to buy cattle for fattening, because he'll have more cattle and therefore more income. This way he will be able to overcome some economic limitations.

His dream is to continue working as best he can, so he can give a better future to his sons.

loans.use: to buy cattle that he'll raise and fatten on grass, so he can overcome some economic limitations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of nine grown up children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in hog raising business for more than 35 years now.  She also sells dried fish in the market. Late last year, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined several houses and businesses, including Perlita’s. Her income was greatly affected. Perlita is asking for a loan to buy new piglets and additional dried fish to sell. In the future, Perlita hopes to make her hog raising business a success.

loans.use: to buy new piglets and additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Donik

texts.en:
Donik is thankful for his first Kiva loan and hopes to get his second one. He lives in the village of Sevakar, which is in the Syunik region. He is married and has a large family including a daughter and three sons. Only his smallest son is unmarried and he lives with his parents. 

Many years ago, Donik worked at the Kapan city combine, but since 1992, with his smallest son, he has been actively engaged in farming and agriculture. On his farm, he has two cows, two bulls and a calf. On his plot of land, he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, and potatoes and sells the harvest from his farm to re-sellers. The sale of the dairy-products from his farm is organized by Donik’s wife and she sells milk, macun (Armenian national dairy product) and cheese. Donik now also works at Kapan city’s electricity network.

Donik needs this loan as he wants to repair his cattle barn. With the beginning of the cold season, he wants his cattle to be in safe and warm conditions.

loans.use: to repair his cattle barn

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 44-year-old woman from the community of Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married with four children aged 7 to 24.  She is a hardworking woman with multiple small businesses like a sari-sari (variety) store, eatery and she also sell bamboo. Evelyn is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of merchandise for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, snack food, vegetables, spices, fish and condiments. Evelyn bravely faced the challenge of trying to recover her loss when typhoon Haiyan hit their place many months ago. She will continue to work hard so she can provide for her family and provide for their basic needs like food and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, snack food, vegetables, spices, fish and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Taingou

texts.en:
Taingou is a 34-year-old single woman who earns a living through growing cassava as the main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 16 years; the business currently earns her about US$10 per day to support her daily needs.  

Taingou is a return client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund, which she wants to use to spend on her school fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a good job after her graduation.

loans.use: to spend on her school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos, todos dependen económicamente de él; practica la agricultura desde hace 50 años, el horario en el que trabaja es de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, realiza los trabajos con ayuda de sus hijos, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, las ventajas y desventajas del negocio dependen mucho de los cambios del clima.
Necesita capital para comprar abono, semilla e insecticidas, le será de ayuda para preparar el terreno y tendrá los recursos económicos para realizar dicha compra, espera tener una cosecha abundante para alimentar a su familia y abastecer a sus clientes.
Para Santiago sus proyectos son mejorar la productividad de su negocio, las condiciones de vida familiar, cancelar sus deudas y prepararse mejor para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Santiago makes a living growing basic grains. He is married and lives with his wife and children, all of whom are his dependants. 

He has been working in agriculture for the past 50 years. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. He learned this trade from his parents, and his children help him out. The advantages and disadvantages of this type of business are highly dependent on the weather changes.

He needs money to purchase inorganic fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. The loan will help him to have the means to pay for such purchase and prepare the land. He hopes to have an abundant harvest with which he will feed his family and supply his customers.

Santiago's projects are to improve the productivity of his business and his family's living conditions, pay off his debts, and be better prepared for the next harvest.

loans.use: to purchase inorganic fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides. The loan will help him to have the means to pay for such purchase and prepare the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow and feed to start an agriculture business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
La señora  Celina de  35  años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus hijos, no tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de camarón, pescado  y también elabora tortillas para la venta  que realiza en su casa.
Doña Celina  compra  el producto por mayor y  sus clientes llegan a su casa a recoger el producto para reventa, vive en una comunidad de San  Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 
Doña Celina  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de camarón, maíz y leña. Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ganancias porque tendrá más producto que vender sus clientes que le prefieren  por su buen producto, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma
Uno de sus sueños es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Celina, 35, lives with her husband and children. They do not own their home.  For the past five years, she has been making a living selling fish and shrimp, and also makes tortillas for sale from home. Celina buys products wholesale and her clients arrive to her house to pick up the products that she re-sells.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.
