She is a hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead.  

Celina is requesting the loan for the purchase of shrimp, corn and firewood.  With the help of this loan she intends to improve her income because she will have more products to sell.  Her clients prefer her for her good products.  She is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  One of her dreams is to have her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2014

loans.use: to buy shrimp, corn and firewood for her business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is a 62-year-old woman with eight adult children. She is from Ajuy, Iloilo. Last year, the Haiyan typhoon greatly affected her source of income, which is fishing. It destroyed some of her fishing tools, like a fish cage and the boat. She started fishing as her business 10 years ago. Aside from regular fishing, she is also into fishing with the use of a “bobo” (a kind of fish cage that serves as a trap made of net and plastic screen for fish and crabs). She is asking for a loan of 25000 PHP to buy fish and crab traps so that she can earn a better income. She hopes that with the help of her loan she can go back to having a steady and reliable income. This will provide her and her family healthy meals and pay for other basic household needs.

loans.use: to buy fish and crab traps

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a 44 year old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. 

She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Her husband is a fisherman. Ma. Fe’s business was damaged when typhoon Haiyan hit their place several months ago. 

Ma. Fe is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, cooking oil, salt, seasonings and others items as well as a new boat engine. With this, she will be able to improve her store as well as the fishing business of her husband. 

In the future, Ma. Fe hopes of improving their businesses so that they will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family especially the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, biscuits, snack foods, cooking oil, salt, seasonings and other items.

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. 

Melrose owns and operates a business venture raising fish. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Aside from this, he also has a piggery that earns additional income for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for the business. 

Currently, Melrose is taking a new loan to purchase feeding supplies in order to feed his pigs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis, administra un car wash, anteriormente vivía en la capital del país en donde trabajaba como conductor de transporte público, debido a los altos índices de delincuencia decidió mudarse al oriente del país y establecer su propio negocio; es casado, tienen tres hijos los cuales están estudiando, mientras que su esposa se dedica a vender golosinas y frutas.
Se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo, porque parte del equipo con el que realiza su trabajo está dañado, comprará una aspiradora, una bomba, ceras, limpia vidrios, etc., renovara su equipo de trabajo y continuara dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, espera tener buenos resultados con la inversión.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en: Luis runs a car wash. He used to live inthe capital of the country, where he worked as a public transportation driver. Due to the high crime rate, he decided to move to the east of the country and establish his own business. He is married and has three children, all of whom are studying in school. His wife sells sweets and fruits. He needs to request a loan because some of the equipment that he uses to do his work is damaged. He will buy a vacuum, a pump, waxes, windshield wash, etc. He will upgrade his work equipment and continue providing good service to his clients. He expects to have good results from the investment. His dream is to continue working in order to provide for his family and pay his debts.

loans.use: buy a vacuum, a pump, waxes, windshield wash, etc. He'll upgrade his equipment so he can continue providing good service.

loans.name: Joerlyn

texts.en:
Joerlyn is a 26-year-old married woman from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is a mother of three children aged 3, 4 and 8. She has run a fishing business together with her husband for six years now. She is also into bobo fishing (a kind of fishing that uses fish cages that serve as traps made of net and plastic screen for fish and crabs). She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more fish cages to catch more fish and crabs. 

Joerlyn is one of those residents affected by the typhoon Haiyan that ravaged her place and their livelihood months ago. 

Her loan is important to her and will provide for her children’s needs like food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fish cages to catch more fish and crabs

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Talin with her husband and two children (son, 24-years-old, and daughter, 23 years-old,). 
Her husband and son work at a local mining company and her daughter is a student at Armenan Pedagogical University. 

The whole family works hard to sustain their living. The requested loan is important for Gohar to be able to cover her daughter Liana's university tuition. She asks lenders to support her with the loan and relies on their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Liana's university tuition.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona, who is 28 years old, is a married woman living in Kutaisi city, west Georgia. She has a little son and daughter and lives alone with them. In spite of her high education, Nona can't find any stable job and depends on her mother's transfers, who lives abroad and sends some money gradually. However, this income is hardly enough to satisfy her children's basic needs and Nona is very motivated to start her own business activity.

All of the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Nona applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start-Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the poor to start or re-start businesses. She will purchase stock of various kinds of home products and will sell them in her community at increased prices.

It is obvious that this job will be hard for Nona, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start-Up credit will be a great support for her family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To start a retail business selling various home products to generate income

loans.name: Martopo

texts.en: Martopo, his wife, and their only child live in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Martopo runs a small stall that provides printing services and he also sells mobile phone airtime credits. Martopo decided to join Ruma about 2 months ago because he was excited to start out selling mobile airtime. Besides that, he also needs to increase his income to fulfill his family's needs, and save the extra income for his child's education. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more airtime transactions in his community on the weekends. Martopo is pictured in the photo sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Los Gavilanes Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores exitosos uno de ellos es Francisco varón de 46 años de edad, acompañado y su negocio es la elaboración de cepillos de lavar ropa desde hace siete años, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio en la fábrica de cepillos. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como nylon de varios colores, madera, alambre etc. uno de los logros obtenidos con los prestamos anteriores es la compra de pequeñas maquinarias que le ayudan en el proceso productivo de los productos. Karla tiene 29 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería y María Mercedes tiene 42 años y su  negocio es la venta de zapatos y sandalias.
texts.en: The group is made up of three sucessful entreprenurs. One of them is Francisco, who is 46 years old and married. For seven years he has had a business that makes brushes for washing clothes. His wife helps him with the business in the brush-making workshop. He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as nylon in a variety of colors, wood, wire, etc. One of the things he was able to do with the previous loans was to buy small machines that help him in the process of producing his products. Karla is 29 years old and her business is a small grocery store. María Mercedes is 42 years old and her business sells shoes and sandals.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as nylon in a variety of colors, wood, wire, etc.

loans.name: Verone

texts.en: Verone is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. Verone is engaged in a fishing business with her husband and they have been involved in this business for more than 16 years now. This is the source of their income. Verone is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and boat engine. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Verone hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and boat engine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a Sari-sari (variety) store owner from the municipality of Concepcion in Iloilo. She is married and her husband works in another country to provide for them. She in turn started her business a year ago to help her husband and support her three children ages 8-19. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise such as coffee, shampoo, detergent, bath soap, candies, chips and condiments. 

Evelyn hopes that with a loan she can continue rebuilding her life after the Haiyan typhoon caused her to lose a good income from the past months and greatly affected her family.
 
Her profits will be used to buy food and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as coffee, shampoo, detergent, bath soap, candies, chips and condiments

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Iloilo, Philippines. Emma has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than six years now. This is the source of their income. Emma lives in a typhoon-prone area where most houses and business were damaged in Super Typhoon Haiyan.

Emma is asking for a loan to buy materials such as plywood, nails, wood, paint and a new boat engine for the repair of their fishing boat. With this, they will be able to improve their catch as well as their income. In the future, Emma hopes to improve their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy materials such as plywood, nails, wood, paint and a new boat engine for the repair of their fishing boat

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en: Annalyn is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two children aged 14 and 10. She lives with her family in Iloilo, Philippines. Annalyn has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income. Annalyn is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and nets. With this, her husband will be able to go back to fishing thus improving his catch which they can sell to the market. Annalyn hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and nets

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children aged 9 and 13 from Ajuy, Iloilo. Jean, together with her husband, has been engaged in regular fishing, bobo fishing (fishing with the use of a trap both for fish and crabs) and raising hogs for ten years now. This business usually earns her 16,000 PHP per month. Jean is asking for a loan to buy fish nets, piglets and hard wood for boat repairs. Through this, they will be able to enhance their daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Jean dreams of improving their livelihood and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, piglets and hard wood for boat repairs

loans.name: Queens Way Group

texts.en:
Anthony is a member of Queens Way Group, He is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance LTD. He last took out a loan of 400,000 UGX. He works with an electrical shop where he works as a technician. 
Anthony wants to start an electrical supply business and it is the reason for which he needs a loan. Being an electrician, he will manage the shop himself and will be assured of income. He hopes to borrow more money after this loan so that he can boost the business. He is innovative and shrewd.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, plugs, cables and switches to sell

loans.name: Cecilia Clarita

texts.es:
Cecilia es una joven emprendedora, con un maravilloso hijo, es natural de Chimbote. Por iniciativa propia pudo abrir un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa por reparto, trabaja por más de 10 horas al día visitando y ofreciendo sus productos, Cecilia cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo constante, la amabilidad que tiene, el entusiasmo y sobre todo porque la mejor motivación para salir adelante es su hijo.
Cecilia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio, ya que por temporada de invierno las personas están demandando ropas gruesas. Así ella seguirá esforzándose para ampliar su negocio y brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a young entrepreneur, with a marvelous son.  She hails from Chimbote.  By her own initiative, she has been able to open a small business selling clothing by delivery.  She works more than ten hours per day, visiting and offering her products.  Cecilia believes that it goes well for her owing to her constant effort, her pleasant demeanor, enthusiasm, and, above all, because the best motivation to get ahead is her son.

Cecilia is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have granted she is able to buy merchandize to supply her business, since for the winter season people are looking for heavier clothing.  In this way, she will continue forcing herself to expand her business and offer a better future to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing to supply her business

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 30-year-old married mother of one child. Due to the low financial situations of her husband, she decided to work in a hospital six years ago to cover the expenses and needs of her family. Since 2006,  she has owned a purses and accessories business, an attempt to increase her family’s income. 

Salam is working hard to provide her family with better living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child’s school increasing tuition fees and fix her car, which will facilitate her work.

Salam hopes to expand her business in the future and increase her income to save some profit for her child.

loans.use: To pay her child’s tuition fees and fix her car

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in the Bazmaberd village of the Aragatsotn region with her two children (her daughter: Ani, 18 years old, and her son: Nver who is 14 years old). Susanna runs a farm and works hard to cover her family's needs. Her daughter studies at the Armenian state pedagogical university. Susanna faces some financial difficulties, so she isn't able to pay for Ani's tuition fees. The requested loan will greatly help Susanna to cover her daughter's educational costs. She hopes that lenders will support the funding of her loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Ani's tuition fees

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en: Vergie is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Iloilo, Philippines. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband and they have been doing this for more than 10 years now. She also raises piglets in their backyard. Several months ago, their place was ravaged by a super typhoon leaving thousands of homeless people with ruined businesses. As of now, Vergie is in need of additional capital. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and fishing gears like nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. Vergie believes that this loan could help her to improve their business as well as their income. Furthermore, Vergie wants to save money for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and fishing gears like nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Aeister

texts.en: Aeister is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She has been successfully running a school in her community for the last five years. She is motivated to provide for her family. She has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 to provide better facilities for the 150 students in her school and to buy chairs to accommodate more students in order to grow her business. Aeister is committed to working hard to expand and improve her school so that she can fulfill her dream of providing the children in her community with quality education.

loans.use: to provide better facilities for the 150 students and to buy chairs to accommodate more students

loans.name: Eugenia Isabel

texts.es:
Eugenia, vive con dos nietos, su esposo hace 10 meses falleció; hace mucho tiempo aprendió a elaborar piñatas en una iglesia, con las ganancias que esta actividad le genera incorporo la venta de jugos naturales, frutas y verduras. Por su experiencia ha logrado mantener su negocio funcionando y generando los ingresos que necesita para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Comprará pegamento, papelería, alambre, azúcar, bolsas, frutas y verduras, tendrá un inventario surtido para seguir realizando sus actividades y mejorando su situación económica, ofrecerá más productos frescos a sus clientes, el riesgo es que la mayoría de productos son de poca durabilidad.
 Sus sueños consisten terminar de cancelar su casa y proveer a su familia de lo necesario para tener una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Eugenia lives with two grandchildren.  Her husband passed away ten months ago.  A long time ago, she learned to make piñatas at church.  With the earnings from this business, she was able to include also for sale fresh juices, fruits and vegetables.  Owing to this experience, she has been able to maintain the business functioning and generating the income that she need to cover household necessities.  

She will buy glue, paper products, wire, sugar, bags, fruit and vegetables, and will have a varied inventory to continue realizing her business and improving her economic situation.  She will offer more fresh products to her customers.  The risk is that the majority of the products have a short shelf life.  Her dreams consist of finishing paying off her house and providing her family with what they need to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy glue, paper products, wire, sugar, bags, fruit and vegetables, and to have a varied inventory to continue carrying out her business

loans.name: Saira Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Saira Yamileth  de 28  años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus tres  hijos tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de productos como  arroz, frijoles, verduras, jabón, detergentes, maíz, café, pan, etc. sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y buenos precios.
Saira Yamileth  su venta es de lunes a domingo, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como arroz, café, frijoles, aceite, harina, azúcar, refrescos, etc. espera con esta inversión  hacer crecer más su negocio y que pueda suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es su segundo crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Saira Yamileth is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. She owns her house. For 3 years she has worked in the business of selling products such as rice, beans, vegetables, soap, detergents, corn, coffee, bread, etc. Her customers prefer her because of her good service and good prices.

Saira Yamileth sells from Monday through Sunday. She is requesting the loan to buy grocery items such as rice, coffee, beans, cooking oil, flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc. She expects that with this investment she will grow her business and will be able to meet her need for financing that will allow her to improve her income and also her quality of life. This is the second loan that she has requested from Prisma. Her dream is to improve her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2014.

loans.use: to buy rice, coffee, beans, cooking oil, flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Candy

texts.en:
Candy is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of a five-year-old daughter from Concepcion, Iloilo. Candy runs a sari-sari (variety) store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Several months ago, Candy's business was affected when a super typhoon hit the country. As of now, she is starting to rebuild her business again. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of products to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil, salt, sugar, and seasoning. With this, she will be able to augment her product stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Candy hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil, salt, sugar, and seasoning.

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en:
Tosigwegwe is a mother of three sons and one daughter, of whom one is still at school and the rest are grown. She is a widow, and now she has been taking care of her family and depending on her business. She is in her mid-forties. Tosigwegwe cooks breakfast snacks, half-cakes and donuts, and she also sells tap water. Finally, she is also a tailor, running all of these businesses at home. Working from 07:30am to 06:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Tosigwegwe has been with Tujijenge Tanzania for more than ten loan cycles; she is always trustful. She manages to repay all of her previous loans successfully. She invested the previous credits to buy baking flour and cooking oil, and started her tailoring business; all was possible because of Kiva's support. She is so thankful for Kiva's support. Tosigwegwe earned an extra income, which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She is requesting a new credit with which she wants to replenish her cooking store with baking flour and cooking oil. 

Tosigwegwe will share this loan with her loan group, MAKONGO KK, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her cooking store with baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 33-year old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. Her place is one of the towns affected by the typhoon Haiyan many months ago. The tragedy gave them a great challenge to put their lives back. Liza is a married woman with three children, ages 9-16. For 10 years now, she has been doing traditional fishing and also bobo fishing (fishing using a fish cage that serves as trap made of a net and plastic screen for fish and crabs). 

Liza is asking for a loan to buy more fish cages to earn more and to help her husband to have a good catch and be more productive. Her income will provide school fees and healthy meals for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish cages.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 45-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with five children, ages 14 to 25. Her husband is a fisherman. She earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store, which she started three years ago. The recent typhoon, Haiyan, had adversely affected the buying capacity of the locals, thus affecting her income. Marlyn is hoping that with a loan, she can continue to boost her livelihood.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. Her profits will be for school fees, food, and reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She has one buffalo. She is happily supporting her family with the generated income. She is in her 4th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that the increase in milk production will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Waheeda

texts.en: Waheeda is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has 12 years of experience in hand embroidery, and has great talent. Her designs and patterns are highly demanded in her area. Through this business she is able to bear her household expenses. She is in her 5th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She wants a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread, beads, stones, sequins, and frames.  She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, beads, stones, sequins, and frames.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 29 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling for the past five years. She has two buffaloes, and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes, performs the task of collecting milk from them, and sells it at different places, on a daily basis. In this way, she obtains decent profits. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. She uses the income to support her family.

In order to make more profit, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She will use it to buy one more buffalo, which will enable her to cater to more customers. She hopes that this loan will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood, age 49, is a hardworking married woman, who enjoys doing embroidery work. Her handmade designs are very popular in her territory. She has five children. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes, and education. Her husband also supports her in the business.

Due to an increase in demand for her designs, she needs to purchase more raw materials. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. In this way, she can manage to buy more thread, frames, needles, sequins and stones, which will help her to generate more income. She hopes that she will have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials for embroidery work, including thread, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past four years, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail business, which sells food products. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans and maize flour for sale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Rose hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business more. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 26 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Several months ago, a super typhoon called Haiyan ravaged the country, leaving thousands of people homeless. Businesses were greatly affected and lots of people were desperate to make a living. Sarah and her husband were not spared by the crisis left by the typhoon. As of now, she and her husband have just started to rebuild again. 

Sarah is now asking for a loan to buy new fishing gear like nets, hooks, lead weights, and buckets. With this, they will be able to go back to fishing again and earn an income. Sarah believes that a loan could help them stand again. She dreams of expanding her business again and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear like nets, hooks, lead weights, and buckets.

loans.name: Marlena

texts.en:
Marlena lives in Vanadzor town with her husband and two sons. Her elder son Merujan is a student at Economic University of Armenia, and currently is in his third year of study. 

Marlena and her husband work hard to be able to sustain their family's living. The requested loan is very important for Marlena and her whole family to be able to pay for Merujan's tuition costs and give him an opportunity to continue his education.

loans.use: to pay for her son Merujan's university tuition.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is from Ajuy, Iloilo, in the Philippines. She is married with six children ages 6-11. Rodelyn is engaged in traditional fishing and fishing with the use of fish cage or bobo. This business started 11 years ago and is the very source of income in supporting her young children. It was quite a challenge for her when many months ago, her place was devastated by Typhoon Haiyan. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fish net, plastic screen and wood for boat maintenance. 

Rodelyn is determined to make her business a success for her children’s education and healthy meals for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, plastic screen and wood for boat maintenance

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and married and with six children, ages six to eighteen. She is from the town of Concepcion, Iloilo.

For twenty years, she has been engaged in fishing and bobo fishing (which uses fish cages). Together with her husband, they work hard to provide for her family. This is their very source of income. Emma is asking for a loan in order to buy a new boat for fishing. After the typhoon Haiyan wreaked havoc in their place many years ago, she hopes to have a stable income once again. Through this investment, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Emma hopes to expand their fishing business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy a new boat for fishing.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 39-year-old, married woman. For the past three years she has been running a business, selling milk, with her husband. She has two cows and two buffaloes, from which she obtains milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese, to generate an extra amount of profit. Kousar has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and she makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

Kousar has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fifth loan cycle, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will enable her to purchase one more cow. Kousar hopes that this loan will be a productive one for her and that it will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 36-year-old mother of four children.  She is a housewife and her husband runs a retail store. The earnings generated from the retail store are used by Shehnaz to provide a better quality of life for her family.  She requires funds to replenish her husband's retail store with groceries so that a constant flow of income is generated and her dream of improving her standard of living is realized.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is a teacher and mother of two children.  She lives in Artik town, Armenia, and works at a local secondary school as a part time teacher.  Her salary at the school is very low so she is hardly able to cover even the basic needs of her family with that money. 

To tackle financial hardships, Alvard is also providing personal classes from her home.  She is a very hardworking teacher and locals in town prefer her lessons to others.
 
The requested loan is very important, and will allow Alvard to purchase a personal computer needed for her classes.  She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.  The start-up loan program provides business startup loans, with minimal conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Alvard greatly hopes for lender support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a personal computer needed for providing language classes to her students.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 37-year-old married woman, and a mother of three.  She has been running a business selling cloth for many years.  She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity, and has become famous for selling quality cloth in her community.  

Zahida requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.  This will allow her to earn more income through greater sales.  She hopes to have a positive experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.  She dreams of providing prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 57-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has five calves and two cows that she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Kaneez has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 (Pakistani rupees). This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Kaneez is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 32 years old and provides the service of tailoring to her community. She has been providing this service for many years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. She is a very hardworking woman. She is providing for the education of her four children through the income she generates from her work. She has been able to establish a good customer base over the years. 

Razia has requested for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR), with which she wants to purchase a new sewing machine along with some spools of threads in different colors. She is hopeful that her hard work will pay off and she will be able to provide a good life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 44-year-old married lady who runs a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Rabia makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 45,000 PKR. She will use this to buy stocks of rice, sugar, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Rabia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Dolphin Group

texts.en:
Rose is aged in her thirties, married and has two kids who are at school. For three years, she has had a business selling clothes. Working from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her sixth credit request via Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Dolphin, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to replenish her business with clothing stock. She earned an extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. Rose will use her portion of loan to buy clothes for selling. She dreams to buy a plot and build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Dolphin," which consists of two members.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Sanat

texts.en:
Sanat is 47 years old. She is a careful mother of 3 children. Sanat is married and her husband Abdukayum is kind man. She has 6 grandchildren. 

Sanat has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 18 years. Also she has a sweet selling business. She buys cattle, feeds them for some months,  and then sells them in a local market. Sanat has great experience in this field. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Tajikistani Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with six children ages 2-14. She lives with her husband in the town of Ajuy in Iloili, Philippines. Marites and her husband operate a business doing traditional fishing and also bobo fishing (fishing using a cage to catch fish and crabs). This has been their livelihood for 14 years now. 

Marites is asking for a loan to buy fishing and boat materials like hard wood, fish net, paint, and plastic screen. Marites works hard to have a stable business after the struggle of typhoon Haiyan, which devastated their place.

Her income will be for her children’s school fees and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy boat materials like hard wood, fish net, paint, and plastic screen.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 42-year-old, married woman. She is a hardworking mother of two children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health care, clothing, and education. Alongside her husband, Shazia has been doing work in agriculture, for many years. She cultivates different vegetables and fruits, and sells them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shazia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help her to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other crop inputs

loans.name: Khaton

texts.en: Khaton is a 52-year-old married woman.  She began selling milk in order to help her husband take care of the family. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns one buffalo. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she has requested a 45,000 PKR loan to purchase another buffalo. She is in her 4th loan cycle. She is hopeful that increases in milk production will help her to generate a greater income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Kaysie

texts.en:
Kaysie is a 26-year-old woman from Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married with a two-year-old daughter. She helps her husband in their fishing business to earn a living. It is her main livelihood, which she started 2 years ago. Aside from regular fishing, she is also into fishing with the use of “bobo,” a kind of fish cage that serves as a trap, made of net and plastic screen for fish and crabs.

She needs help through a loan so she can put her life back after the typhoon Haiyan ravaged their place months ago. She will use her loan to buy boat and bobo (fish cage) materials such as fish net, wood, and plastic screen.

In the future, Kaysie hopes to continue improving her livelihood as well as the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy boat and bobo (fish cage) materials such as fish net, wood, and plastic screen.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora, who is a 34-year-old married woman, lives in Gori city. She has a husband and 2 school-aged daughters. Eleonora works as a sales lady. Her husband is a private worker, who gets paid a very small salary. As they find it hard to provide for their family with their current income, Eleonora decided to start a side business to get additional income. 
Now, she needs financial support to purchase clothing and to have money for working capital to start her business. She will sell clothing in her community and reap a profit. Eleonora has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Eleonora and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better lifestyle from the revenues.

loans.use: To start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en: Nahid is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past six years. She is an experienced seamstress. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also knows the art of hand embroidery and uses it to generate extra income. To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine along with spools of thread and ribbons in different colors to address the increasing demand for her services. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her 9th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine along with the spools of thread and ribbons in different colors for her tailoring business

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started a milk production business. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her local area. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for milk production

loans.name: Berny

texts.es: BERNY VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD EL SARDINAL #2 DE JINOTEGA. NACIÓ EN EL AÑO 1980 EN LA MISMA COMUNIDAD. INICIÓ SUS ESTUDIOS DE PRIMARIA PERO SOLO PUDO CURSAR HASTA SEGUNDO GRADO A CAUSA DEL PELIGRO QUE HABÍA POR LA GUERRA DE LOS AÑOS 80'S. FUE ENTONCES ASÍ QUE SUS PADRES DECIDIERON QUE SE DEDICARA A LAS ACTIVIDADES AGRICOLAS Y AYUDARA A SU PADRE EN LAS TAREAS DEL CAMPO. ACTUALMENTE EL SE SIENTE MUY AGRADECIDO CON SU PADRE YA QUE GRACIAS A QUE APRENDIÓ A TRABAJAR EL CAMPO EL AHORA PUEDE GANARSE LA VIDA. BERNY HA PODIDO COMPRAR TIERRAS DONDE SIEMBRA CAFÉ Y GRANOS BÁSICOS; GRACIAS AL ESFUERZO QUE HA HECHO Y A SU ARDUO TRABAJO TAMBIEN HA PODIDO ADQUIRIR UNA MOTO Y UNA CAMIONETA LA CUAL UTILIZA PARA TRASLADAR LOS INSUMOS Y LOS GRANOS BASICO QUE PRODUCE EN SU TIERRA. BERNY ACTUALMENTE ESTÁ CASADO Y TIENE DOS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, EN LA COMUNIDAD DONDE BERNY VIVE NO HAY ENERGÍA ELECTRICA, POR ESTA RAZÓN EL DESEA COMPRAR UN SISTEMA SOLAR PARA PODER TENER LUZ Y QUE SUS HIJOS PUEDAN ESTUDIAR MEJOR.
texts.en:
BERNY LIVES IN THE COMMUNITY OF JINOTEGA SARDINAL No. 2.  HE WAS BORN IN 1980 IN THE SAME COMMUNITY.  HE STARTED PRIMARY STUDIES BUT COULD ONLY COMPLETE SECOND GRADE BECAUSE OF THE DANGER OF THE WAR IN THE 80'S. HIS PARENTS DECIDED DEVOTE THEMSELVES TO AGRICULTURAL.  HE HELPED HIS FATHER TO WORK THE FIELD.

CURRENTLY, HE IS VERY GRATEFUL TO HIS FATHER AND THANKS TO HIM, HE LEARNED TO WORK THE FIELD AND NOW CAN EARN A LIVING.  BERNY WAS ABLE TO BUY LAND, PLANTING COFFEE BEANS AND BASIC GRAINS.  THANKS TO THESE EFFORTS AND HIS HARD WORK, HE  ALSO OBTAINED A MOTORCYCLE AND A TRUCK WHICH HE USES TO TRANSPORT SUPPLIES AND PRODUCTS HE GROWS.

BERNY IS CURRENTLY MARRIED AND HAS TWO SMALL CHILDREN IN THE COMMUNITY.  WHERE HE LIVES, BERNY HAS NO ELECTRICITY. FOR THIS REASON, HE WANTS TO BUY A SOLAR POWER SYSTEM FOR ELECTRICITY AND HELP HIS CHILDREN STUDY BETTER.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: César Mauricio

texts.es:
César de 24 años de edad, es agricultor, esta acompañado, tiene dos hijos; uno de año y medio y el otro de 2 meses de edad. César estudio hasta noveno grado de educación básica, esta acompañdo, su pareja trabaja en oficios domesticos, viven con él sus hijos y su señora, ellos dependen de él.

César trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho durante 2 años, y lo aprendio de su padre; decidio hacerlo para independizarse y obtener un ingreso economico extra, tambien esta trabajando como empleado en una farmacia.


El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar ganado de repasto, ya que esta es una buena epoca para engordarlos y venderlos luego. Sus sueños son que sus hijos crezcan fuertes y sanos, y poder trabajar lo mejor que se pueda para poderles ofrecer un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
César is 24 years old, a farmer, has two children; one is a year and a half and the other 2 months old.  César studied until the ninth grade of basic education.  He is married, his partner takes care of domestic chores, living with his sons and his wife.  They depend on him.

Cesar spends his days pasturing his cattle. He has been working at this for two years, and learned from his father. He decided to become independent and earn extra income, also working as a clerk in a pharmacy.

The loan requested is to buy cattle to pasture, as this is a good time for fattening and later sale. His dreams are that his kids grow strong and healthy and to be able to work the best he can to offer a good future to his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle to pasture, as this is a good time for fattening and later sale.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, tiene 48 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien  tiene una hija, y reside en el municipio de Tocoa Colon. Don Jesús tiene 23 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y reparación de calzado de todo tipo para damas, caballeros y niños. Este taller lo tiene establecido  en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos.  El  préstamo que solicita es de  6,000 lempiras, para invertirlo en la compra de  materia prima como cuero, cuerina, pegamento, y suelas para la elaboración de calzado y poder mejorar la producción y los ingresos. su sueño es poner un taller completo con empleados para producir mas y así poder darle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 48 years old and lives in with his partner with whom he has a daughter.  He lives in the town of Colon Tocoa. For 23 years, Jesus has worked at the making and repair of all types of footwear for men, women and children.

This workshop was established in his home is his source of income. The loan request is for 6,000 Lempiras to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as leather, synthetic leather, glue, and soles for footwear manufacturing and to improve production and incomes.

His dream is to create a complete workshop with employees to produce more so they can provide a quality of life to the family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as leather, synthetic leather, glue, and soles for making footwear.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 48 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 6 children. She sells bed covers and wall hangings and has been in this business for 2 years. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She will be using this loan to buy more clothes to sell. These include bed covers, bed sheets and curtains too. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to expand her business and open a boutique and also be able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of bed covers and bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Analene

texts.en:
Analene is 35 years old.  She is married with two children aged 9 and 11. Analene and her husband earn a living by fishing. For ten years now they have been engaged in traditional fishing and fishing with the use of a “bobo” (a kind of fish cage that traps fish and crab). As fate would have it, typhoon Haiyan adversely affected their source of living many months ago.

Now, she is asking for a loan to buy more fish cages and ropes. She hopes that the future will be brighter after this challenge that she faced with her family.

Her income will be for family consumption, school fees and reinvestment into her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish cages and ropes for her fishing business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 37 años de edad, es jornalero, esta casado, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad. Estudio hasta segundo grado de educacion basica; esta casado su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos, sus hijos viven con él.

Jorge trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo a hecho por unos 18 años y lo aprendio de su padre, decidio hacerlo para obtener un ingreso economico; antes solo la agricultura trabajaba.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto. El préstamo le ayudara mucho porque puede comprar y tener mas ganado para seguir trabajando y asi tener mejor calidad de vida. la necesidad satisfecha es la de poder comprar sin tener que vender lo que ya se tiene.

Sus sueños son poder trabajar y que sus hijos puedan tener la oportunidad de estudiar hasta niveles superiores.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old, a laborer, married with two children aged  17 and 10 years old. He studied through the second grade of basic education.  He is married and his partner takes care of the domestic trades.  Their children live with them.

Jorge works pasturing cattle.  He has been doing this for about 18 years and learned from his father.  He decided to do so for an economic income; previously he only worked in agriculture.

The loan he is requesting is to buy cattle to pasture. The loan will help a lot because he can buy and own more livestock to keep working and so have better quality of life. Thus he can meet the needs to be able to buy without selling what they already have.

His dreams are to work and for his children to have the opportunity to study up to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy cattle to pasture.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Waleska mujer de 25 años de edad, acompañada, y su negocio es de una pequeña pulpería en su domicilio, desde hace cinco años, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulperías como gaseosas variadas, galletes, pan, caramelos, jugos, medicamentos populares, sopas maggi, jabón de baño, etc. María Elena tiene 59 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de granos básicos y María Mercedes tiene 56 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs, one of whom is Waleska. She is 25 years old and is in a relationship. Waleska's business is a small grocery store, which she has run out of her home for the past five years. 

She will invest the loan in products for her store such as sodas, cookies, bread, candies, juices, popular medications, Maggi brand soups and bathroom soap.

María Elena is 59 years old and and sells basic goods; María Mercedes is 56 years old and sells shoes and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
La señora  Marciana  47 años de edad, vive con familia es soltera y tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de costura, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trabajo, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Marciana está solicitando el préstamo para compra de telas, agujas, hilos  y accesorios.  Con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar su taller de costura es un cliente nuevo, que desea salir adelante en su negocio gracias a la inversión que realice. 
Doña Marciana  espera que su negocio sea uno de los más reconocidos de las zona uno de sus  sueños es mejorar su casa y su taller.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2014.
texts.en:
Marciana is 47 years old and is single and living with her family in a home that she owns. For the past ten years she has been a tailor and is well liked by her clients because of her quality work. She is a hardworking woman who wishes to get ahead.

Marciana is requesting a loan to purchase fabric, needles, thread and accessories. With the support of this loan she seeks to improve the area where she works. She is a new client and hopes to get ahead in her business thanks to the investment she will be making. She hopes that her business will become one of the most well-known in the area. She also dreams of improving her home and workshop.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  August 2014.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, thread and accessories.

loans.name: Dinabala

texts.en:
Dinabala hails from Dhupguri. As a mother of one daughter, the great desire to see her to grow up to be educated is what fills Dinabala with enthusiasm and inspiration. Dinabala is 32 years old and an illiterate woman who works tirelessly on her farm rearing goats. She lives with her daughter and husband in their own kachha house (bamboo, mud and straw-made).

Her husband Jayanta runs a small shop which sells 'Pan' (a kind of mouth freshener) and beetle nuts. To support her husband financially, she began rearing livestock like goats. She buys baby goats, raises them, fattens them and at the time of sale, charges a higher price according to the weight acquired by the animal. This has permitted her to obtain additional resources to continue taking care of and sustaining her family.

Dinabala is a hardworking, thriving woman, who does her best every day to get ahead, motivated by her family. She is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase goats to fatten and sell. Dinabala hopes to advance one step closer towards the fulfillment of her principal dream of providing her daughter the opportunity for a better education and good living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her business.

loans.name: Seedan

texts.en: Seedan has been successfully running a “tandoor” (clay oven used for cooking) business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has become famous in her town for making good tasting chapattis and she has attained a good number of customers. Previously with the help of a Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase sacks of flour, oil, salt and baking powder.  She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, oil, salt and baking powder.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a 36-year-old married man from the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. He has four children to support, ages one to six. Loreto relies on his fishing business to provide for his family. The devastation brought by typhoon Haiyan many months ago almost destroyed his boat and made his source of income less stable.

He is asking for a loan to buy a new boat so he can fish again and provide better for his family.

In the future, he hopes to buy a new fish net, engine and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem has successfully built her business selling bangles with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a new collection of bangles. This will enable her to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of bangles.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en: Nosheen is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for the last seven years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames, etc to complete the orders of her customers on time.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman who has been doing business selling cattle for many years. She has five calves. Her business is good enough to provide her with a decent life. She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support. Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells fabric materials and has been in this business for three years now. She is 28 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of fabric to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more fabric.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has a retail shop in Kakamega town and has been in the business for 7 years. She is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. She also supports 10 members of her family. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of bread, rice, tea leaves, sugar and cooking oil to sell in her shop. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase some land for farming.

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a 34-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She successfully runs a small general store at the corner of her house, and has 4 years' experience in this field. She offers various items like stitching materials, beauty products and bangles. Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Shakila wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy a variety of bangles, spools of threads and  packs of lotions and creams, in order to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bangles, spools of threads and packs of lotions and creams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, detergents and cooking fat.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 49-year-old, hardworking single woman who supports a family of three children. She has been operating a fruit and vegetable stall for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 4,000 at the end of every month.

Veronica was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 5,000, with which she intends to buy pineapples, mangoes, watermelons, bananas and apples to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and wants to be able to further their education to higher levels.

She hopes that she will become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy pineapples, mangoes, watermelons, bananas and apples to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ever Antonio

texts.es:
Ever de 31 años de edad, es agricultor, esta soltero y vive con sus padres, solamente estudio hasta quinto grado. Solamente los padres dependen de él.

Ever trabaja con ganado de repasto, con su padre lo ha hecho por mucho tiempo, tambien trabaja la agricultura, antes era empleado en un agroservicio. La ditancia que recorre con el ganado, esta como a 2 km y viaja a pie.

El préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes, el préstamo le mejorara mucho porque se hara de sus propio patrimonio y asi mismo mejor calidad de vida.

La necesidad satisfecha es que puede comprar y luchar con sus animales y asi sentirse satsifecho con la isntitucion financiera. Sus sueños son formar su propia familia y luchar en el trabajo para obtener un ingreso economico.
texts.en:
Ever is 31 years old, he is a farmer, single and living with his parents, he only studied up to the 5th grade. Only his parents depend on him.

Ever works grazing cattle with his father. They have done this for a long time. He also works in agriculture, before he was employed in an agro-service. The distance that he covers with his cattle is about 2km and he travels on foot.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMP, is to purchase a pair of oxen. This loan will improve things a lot because he will have his own assets and thus a better quality of life.

The need is to be able to buy and struggle through with his animals and thus feel satisfied with the financial institution. His dreams are to have his own family and to struggle at work to get a better income.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Saeraan

texts.en: Saeraan is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been running a business with her son selling milk for many years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with the butter that she makes from the milk. In this way she earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Nieve Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cinco socias emprendedoras, exitosas una de ellas es Humbelina de 53 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 8 años en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, caramelos, galletas, pan, jaleas, chiclets, etc. Nieve tiene 50 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de zapatos, ropa y cosméticos, María tiene 49 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y zapatos usados, Reyna tiene 47 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y María Cristina tiene 45 años y su negocio es la venta de fritanga en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five successful entrepreneurs. One of the members is Humbelina, 53 years old, her business is a grocery store which she's had for 8 years. She will use the loan to purchase soft drinks, caramels, cookies, bread, jellies, chewing gum, etc.

Nieve is 50 years old and her business is selling shoes, clothing and cosmetics. Maria is 49 years old and her business is used clothing and shoes sales. Reyna is 47 years old, her business is a grocery store in her home and Maria Cristina is 45 years old. Her business is a small restaurant in her home.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, caramels, cookies, bread, jellies, chewing gum, etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He also supports two members of her family. He has a boutique business which he has been running for seven years and right now he makes a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Stephen will be using this loan to buy more clothes to sell. These include shorts, shirts, jeans, trousers and suits. He will use the anticipated profits to open a big boutique and become a wholesaler.

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to grow his boutique business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 55-year-old married woman from the Gori district. She is from a 9 member family, of whom only 2 are in employment. One of them is Marine, who works as a cleaner at the local restaurant and the other is her husband, who is a watchman and who earns 150 GEL per month. To take care of her big family's increased needs, Marine also rents out a house and gets some income from it. However the family still lives in poverty as they have no source of significant income to deal with financial difficulties.
 
Marine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times in order to start a trading business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. 

Then Marine requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business, and her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides startup credit soft conditions for the country's poor people, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With the credit received, Marine will go to Turkey to purchase a stock of home products and clothing and will then start trading. 

This new business, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and hence the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To begin trading with home products and clothing, and improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a kitchen for her house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 65-year-old hardworking woman married to Boniface, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. Ruth has been selling maize flour for six years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Ruth was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to purchase maize flour to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Ruth plans to use the anticipated income to pay to buy a posho mill, pay school fees to her children and hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 12 and 1, and two of them go to school. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been running this business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava, beans and maize for resale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is a first-time borrower of the institution applying for UGX 2,000,000. He is a married man with three children aged 15, 12, and eight years. Hakim is a dry coffee dealer in one of the villages. It is this business that has enabled him buy a small piece of land and also put up a simple residential house. As it is clearly seen in the photo, the house is not fully complete. Its interior has no cement and plaster as also seen outside. 

To have the house plastered and cemented, he applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to help him finish his house. His hope is to have his house fully completed so that he can happily occupy it with his family.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and paint to finish constructing his house.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 1, and 2 of them go to school.

Fabien is a driver and has been driving for the past 8 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts in order to repair vehicles. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts in order to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 24 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She has a grocery store that she has run for one year now and she makes a monthly income of KES 3,000.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya; she will use the loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, vegetables, potatoes and fruits. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more groceries. 

Violet's future hopes are to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, vegetables, onions and fruits for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a 43-year-old woman married to Charles, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Dorcus has been operating a retail shop for a period of five years earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Dorcus was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use this amount to buy maize flour to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy maize flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 32 years old; she is married with five children aged between seven and 12. Four of them go to school. She has been selling clothes for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale in her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, an accountant by profession, is from Artik town where she lives with her sister and cousin. She works at local company as an accountant and along with that work also provides math classes to school-age children from her house. Teaching is very important for Gayane and she does her work with great love and care. The requested loan is for giving Gayane an opportunity to purchase a PC and chairs for the working room. She needs this loan to be able to provide normal conditions to her students. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a PC and chairs for the working room where she provides math lessons to school-age children.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 37 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 17 and 6, and all of them go school. 

She is a tailor and has been working in this business for the past 12 years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more clothes from which she will make fashionable dresses to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used for renovation and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from which she will make fashionable dresses to sell.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 26 years old. She is married with two children who are 5 and 3 years old. One of them goes to school. She has a shop and has been running her  business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, rice, sugar, salt and soap to sell. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, rice, sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Las Devoras Group

texts.es: El grupo Las Devoras está formado por tres socias emprendedora de éxito una de ellas es María tiene 50 años de edad su negocio es la venta de zapatos y sandalias desde hace 4 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de calzados para niños y adultos, sandalias etc. Gloria tiene 27 años de edad y su  negocio es  la venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada y Argentina tiene 27 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida y batidos.
texts.en:
The group Las Devoras is made up of three enterprising members of success. One of them is Maria who is 50 years old. Her business is selling shoes and sandals which she has done for the last 4 years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of footwear for children and adults, sandals, etc.

Gloria is 27 years old, her business is selling new and used clothing and Argentina is 27 years old and works selling food and shakes.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 28 years old. She is married with two children aged between 12 and seven years; both of them go to school. She has a restaurant and has been running it for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment such as chairs, saucepans, plates and food stuffs for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more equipment such as chairs, saucepans, plates and food stuffs for sale in her restaurant business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 62-year-old woman married to Peter, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with four children. Christina has been operating a Posho Mill (a grinding maize stall) for a period of five years earning her an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Christina was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this amount to purchase maize for grinding and selling to her customers on a daily basis. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Christina plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase maize for grinding and selling to her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a tailoring business in Kisumu town. She makes different types of clothes such as blouses, trousers, dresses, skirts, and school uniforms. She has been in this business for 10 years now and it has been profitable. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she will be using this loan to buy more stock of fabric materials, sewing threads, buttons and embroidery threads. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more materials.

Her future hopes and dreams are to open more tailoring shops and to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tailoring materials for use in her business.
